Of the bounties of thy Lord We bestow freely on all these as well\n\t\t\tas those: the bounties of thy Lord are not closed (to anyone).\n\t\t\t2200
See how We have bestowed more on some than on others; but verily\n\t\t\tthe Hereafter is more in rank and gradation and more in\n\t\t\texcellence. 2201
Take not with Allah another object of worship; or thou (O man!)\n\t\t\twilt sit in disgrace and destitution. 2202 2203

Thy Lord hath decreed that ye worship none but Him and that ye be kind to parents. Whether one or both of them attain old age in thy life say not to them a word of contempt nor repel them but address them in terms of honor. 2204
And out of kindness lower to them the wing of humility and say:\n\t\t\t"My Lord! bestow on them Thy Mercy even as they cherished me in\n\t\t\tchildhood." 2205 2206
Your Lord knoweth best what is in your hearts: if ye do deeds of\n\t\t\trighteousness verily He is Most Forgiving to those who turn to\n\t\t\tHim again and again (in true penitence). 2207
And render to the kindred their due rights as (also) to those in\n\t\t\twant and to the wayfarer: but squander not (your wealth) in the\n\t\t\tmanner of a spendthrift. 2208 2209
Verily spendthrifts are brothers of the Evil Ones; and the Evil\n\t\t\tOne is to his Lord (Himself) ungrateful. 2210
And even if thou hast to turn away from them in pursuit of the\n\t\t\tMercy from thy Lord which thou dost expect yet speak to them a\n\t\t\tword of easy kindness. 2211
Make not thy hand tied (like a niggard's) to thy neck nor stretch\n\t\t\tit forth to its utmost reach so that thou become blameworthy and\n\t\t\tdestitute. 2212
Verily thy Lord doth provide sustenance in abundance for whom He\n\t\t\tpleaseth and He provideth in a just measure: for He doth know and\n\t\t\tregard all His servants. 2213
Kill not your children for fear of want: We shall provide\n\t\t\tsustenance for them as well as for you: verily the killing of\n\t\t\tthem is a great sin. 2214
Nor come nigh to adultery: for it is a shameful (deed) and an\n\t\t\tevil opening the road (to other evils). 2215

Nor take life which Allah has made sacred except for just cause. And if anyone is slain wrongfully We have given his heir authority (to demand Qisas or to forgive): but let him not exceed bounds in the matter of taking life: for he is helped (by the Law). 2216

Come not nigh to the orphan's property except to improve it until he attains the age of full strength; and fulfil (every) engagement for (every) engagement will be enquired into (on the Day of Reckoning). 2217 2218 2219 2220
Give full measure when ye measure and weigh with a balance that\n\t\t\tis straight: that is the most fitting and the most advantageous\n\t\t\tin the final determination. 2221
And pursue not that of which thou hast no knowledge; for every\n\t\t\tact of hearing or of seeing or of (feeling in) the heart will be\n\t\t\tenquired into (on the Day of Reckoning). 2222
Nor walk on the earth with insolence: for thou canst not rend the\n\t\t\tearth asunder nor reach the mountains in height. 2223
Of all such things the evil is hateful in the sight of thy Lord.
These are among the (precepts of) wisdom which thy Lord Has revealed to thee. Take not with Allah another object of worship lest thou shouldst be thrown into Hell blameworthy and rejected. 2224 2225
Has then your Lord (O Pagans!) preferred for you sons and taken\n\t\t\tfor Himself daughters among the angels? Truly ye utter a most\n\t\t\tdreadful saying! 2226
We have explained (things) in various (ways) in this Qur'an in\n\t\t\torder that they may receive admonition but it only increases\n\t\t\ttheir flight (from the Truth)! 2227
Say: if there had been (other) gods with Him as they say behold\n\t\t\tthey would certainly have sought out a way to the Lord of the\n\t\t\tThrone! 2228
Glory to him! He is high above all that they say! Exalted and\n\t\t\tGreat (beyond measure)!

The seven heavens and the earth and all beings therein declare His glory: there not a thing but celebrates His praise; and yet ye understand not how they declare His glory! Verily He is Oft- Forbearing Most Forgiving! 2229
When thou dost recite the Qur'an We put between thee and those\n\t\t\twho believe not in the Hereafter a veil invisible: 2230

And We put coverings over their hearts (and minds) lest they should understand the Qur'an and deafness into their ears: when thou dost commemorate thy Lord and Him alone in the Qur'an they turn on their backs fleeing (from the Truth). 2231
We know best why it is they listen when they listen to thee; and\n\t\t\twhen they meet in private conference Behold the wicked say "Ye\n\t\t\tfollow none other than a man bewitched!" 2232
See what similes thy strike for thee; but they have gone astray\n\t\t\tand never can they find a way. 2233
They say: "What! when we are reduced to bones and dust should we\n\t\t\treally be raised up (to be) a new creation?" 2234
Say: "(Nay!) be ye stones or iron

"Or created matter which in your minds is hardest (to be raised up)--(yet shall ye be raised up)!" Then will they say: "Who will cause us to return?" Say: "He Who created you first!" Then will they wag their heads towards thee and say "When will that be?" Say "Maybe it will be quite soon! 2235
"It will be on a Day when He will call you and ye will answer\n\t\t\t(His call) with (words of) His praise and ye will think that ye\n\t\t\ttarried but a little while!" 2236 2237
Say to My servants that they should (only) say those things that\n\t\t\tare best: for Satan doth sow dissensions among them: for Satan is\n\t\t\tto man an avowed enemy. 2238
It is your Lord that knoweth you best: if He please He granteth\n\t\t\tyou mercy or if He please punishment: We have not sent thee to be\n\t\t\ta disposer of their affairs for them. 2239

And it is your Lord that knoweth best all beings that are in the heavens and on earth: We did bestow on some Prophets more (and other) gifts than on others: and We gave to David (the gift of) the Psalms. 2240 2241
Say: "Call on those besides Him whom ye fancy: they have neither\n\t\t\tthe power to remove your troubles from you nor to change them."\n\t\t\t2242

Those whom they call upon do desire (for themselves) means of access to their Lord even those who are nearest: they hope for His Mercy and fear His Wrath: for the Wrath of thy Lord is something to take heed of. 2243
There is not a population but We shall destroy it before the Day\n\t\t\tof Judgment or punish it with a dreadful Penalty: that is written\n\t\t\tin the (eternal) Record. 2244

And We refrain from sending the Signs only because the men of former generations treated them as false: We sent the She-camel: to the Thamud to open their eyes but they treated her wrongfully: We only send the Signs by way of terror (and warning from evil). 2245 2246 2247

Behold! We told thee that thy Lord doth encompass mankind round about: We granted the Vision which We showed thee but as a trial for men as also the Cursed Tree (mentioned) in the Qur'an: We put terror (and warning) into them but it only increases their inordinate transgression! 2248 2249 2250
Behold! We said to the angels: "Bow down unto Adam": they bowed\n\t\t\tdown except Iblis: he said "Shall I bow down to one whom Thou\n\t\t\tdidst create from clay?" 2251
He said "Seest Thou? This is the one whom thou hast honored above me! If Thou wilt but respite me to the Day of Judgment I will surely bring his descendants under my sway all but a few!" 2252
Allah said: "Go thy way; if any of them follow thee verily Hell\n\t\t\twill be the recompense of you (all) an ample recompense.\n\t\t\t2253

"Lead to destruction those whom thou canst among them with thy (seductive) voice; make assaults on them with thy cavalry and thy infantry; mutually share with them wealth and children; and make promises to them. But Satan promises them nothing but deceit. 2254 2255 2256 2257 2258
"As for My servants no authority shalt thou have over them."\n\t\t\tEnough is thy Lord for a Disposer of affairs. 2259\n\t\t\t2260
Your Lord is He that maketh the Ship go smoothly for you through\n\t\t\tthe sea in order that ye may seek of His Bounty: for He is unto\n\t\t\tyou Most Merciful. 2261
When distress seizes you at sea those that ye call upon besides Himself leave you in the lurch! But when He brings you back safe to land ye turn away (from Him). Most ungrateful is man! 2262

Do ye then feel secure that He will not cause you to be swallowed up beneath the earth when ye are on land or that He will not send against you a violent tornado (with showers of stones) so that ye shall find no one to carry out your affairs for you? 2263
Or do ye feel secure that He will not send you back a second time to sea and send against you a heavy gale to drown you because of your ingratitude so that ye find no helper therein against Us? 2264

We have honored the sons of Adam; provided them with transport on land and sea; given them for sustenance things good and pure; and conferred on them special favors above a great part of Our Creation. 2265

One day We shall call together all human beings with their (respective) Imams: those who are given their record in their right hand will read it (with pleasure) and they will not be dealt with unjustly in the least. 2266 2267
But those who were blind in this world will be blind in the\n\t\t\tHereafter and most astray from the Path. 2268

And their purpose was to tempt thee away from that which We had revealed unto thee to substitute in Our name something quite different: (in that case) behold! they would certainly have made thee (their) friend! 2269
And had We not given thee strength thou wouldst nearly have\n\t\t\tinclined to them a little. 2270
In that case We should have made thee taste an equal portion (of punishment) in this life and an equal portion in death: and moreover thou wouldst have found none to help thee against Us! 2271 2272
Their purpose was to scare thee off the land in order to expel\n\t\t\tthee; but in that case they would not have stayed (therein) after\n\t\t\tthee except for a little while. 2273
(This was Our) way with the apostles We sent before thee: thou\n\t\t\twilt find no change in Our ways. 2274
Establish regular prayers at the sun's decline till the darkness of the night and the morning prayer and reading: for the prayer and reading in the morning carry their testimony. 2275 2276
And pray in the small watches of the morning: (it would be) an additional prayer (or spiritual profit) for thee: soon will thy Lord raise thee to a station of Praise and Glory! 2277 2278
Say: "O my Lord! let my entry be by the Gate of Truth and Honor and likewise my exit by the Gate of Truth and Honor; and grant me from Thy Presence an authority to aid (me)." 2279 2280
And say: "Truth has (now) arrived and Falsehood perished: for\n\t\t\tFalsehood is (by its nature) bound to perish." 2281
We send down (stage by stage) in the Qur'an that which is a\n\t\t\thealing and a mercy to those who believe: to the unjust it causes\n\t\t\tnothing but loss after loss. 2282
Yet when We bestow Our favors on man he turns away and becomes\n\t\t\tremote on his side (instead of coming to Us) and when Evil seizes\n\t\t\thim he gives himself up to despair! 2283
Say: "Everyone acts according to his own disposition: but your\n\t\t\tLord knows best who it is that is best guided on the Way."\n\t\t\t2284
They ask thee concerning the Spirit (of inspiration). Say: "The\n\t\t\tSpirit (cometh) by command of my Lord: of knowledge it is only a\n\t\t\tlittle that is communicated to you (O men!) 2285
If it were Our Will We could take away that which We have sent\n\t\t\tthee by inspiration: then would thou find none to plead thy\n\t\t\taffair in that matter as against Us 2286
Except for Mercy from thy Lord: for His Bounty is to thee\n\t\t\t(indeed) great. 2287

Say: "If the whole of mankind and Jinns were to gather together to produce the like of this Qur'an they could not produce the like thereof even if they backed up each other with help and support. 2288 2289
And We have explained to man in this Qur'an every kind of\n\t\t\tsimilitude: yet the grater part of men refuse (to receive it)\n\t\t\texcept with ingratitude! 2290 2291
They say: "We shall not believe in thee until thou cause spring\n\t\t\tto gush forth for us from the earth 2292
"Or (until) thou have a garden of date trees and vines and cause\n\t\t\trivers to gush forth in their midst carrying abundant water;\n\t\t\t2293
"Or thou cause the sky to fall in pieces as thou sayest (will\n\t\t\thappen) against us; or thou bring Allah and the angels before\n\t\t\t(us) face to face; 2294 2295

"Or thou have a house adorned with gold or thou mount a ladder right into the skies. No we shall not even believe in thy mounting until thou send down to us a book that we could read." Say: "Glory to my Lord! am I aught but a man an apostle?" 2296 2297 2298
What kept men back from Belief when Guidance came to them was\n\t\t\tnothing but this: they said "Has Allah sent a man like us) to be\n\t\t\t(His) Apostle?" 2299
Say "If there were settled on earth angels walking about in peace\n\t\t\tand quiet We should certainly have sent them down from the\n\t\t\theavens an angel for an apostle." 2300
Say: "Enough is Allah for a witness between me and you: for He is\n\t\t\twell-acquainted with His servants and He sees (all things)."\n\t\t\t2301

It is he whom Allah guides that is on true guidance; but he whom He leaves astray for such wilt thou find no protector besides Him. On the Day of Judgment We shall gather them together prone on their faces blind dumb and deaf: their abode will be Hell: every time it shows abatement We shall increase for them the fierceness of the Fire. 2302 2303
That is their recompense because they rejected Our Signs and said\n\t\t\t"When we are reduced to bones and broken dust should we really be\n\t\t\traised up (to be) a new Creation?" 2304

See they not that Allah Who created the heavens and the earth has power to create the like of them (anew)? Only He has decreed a term appointed of which there is no doubt. But the unjust refuse (to receive it) except with ingratitude. 2305 2306
Say: "If ye had control of the Treasures of the Mercy of my Lord\n\t\t\tbehold ye would keep them back for fear of spending them: for man\n\t\t\tis (ever) niggardly!" 2307
To Moses We did give nine Clear Signs: ask the Children of Israel: when he came to them Pharaoh said to him: "O Moses! I consider thee indeed to have been worked upon by sorcery!" 2308 2309 2310

Moses said "Thou knowest well that these things have been sent down by none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth as eye-opening evidence: and I consider thee indeed O Pharaoh to be one doomed to destruction!" 2311
So he resolved to remove them from the face of the earth: but We\n\t\t\tdid drown him and all who were with him. 2312
And We said thereafter to the Children of Israel "Dwell securely in the land (of promise)": but when the second of the warnings came to pass We gathered you together in a mingled crowd. 2313 2314
We sent down the (Qur'an) in Truth and in Truth has it descended:\n\t\t\tand We sent thee but to give Glad Tidings and to warn (sinners).\n\t\t\t2315 2316
(It is) a Qur'an which We have divided (into parts from time to\n\t\t\ttime) in order that thou mightest recite it to men at intervals:\n\t\t\tWe have revealed it by stages. 2317
Say: "Whether ye believe in it or not it is true that those who\n\t\t\twere given knowledge beforehand when it is recited to them fall\n\t\t\tdown on their faces in humble prostration" 2318
And say: "Glory to our Lord! truly has the promise of our Lord\n\t\t\tbeen fulfilled!" 2319
They fall down on their faces in tears and it increases their\n\t\t\t(earnest) humility. 2320

Say: "Call upon Allah or call upon Rahman: by whatever name ye call upon Him (it is well): for to Him belong the Most Beautiful Names. Neither speak thy Prayer aloud nor speak it in a low tone but seek a middle course between." 2321 2322 2323
Say: "Praise be to Allah Who begets no son and has no partner in (His) dominion: nor (needs) He any to protect Him from humiliation: Yea magnify Him for His greatness and glory!" 2324
Praise be to Allah Who hath sent to His Servant the Book and hath\n\t\t\tallowed therein no Crookedness: 2325 2326

(He hath made it) Straight (and Clear) in order that He may warn (the godless) of a terrible Punishment from Him and that He may give Glad Tidings to the Believers who work righteous deeds that they shall have a goodly Reward. 2327
Wherein they shall remain forever: 2328
Further that He may warn those (also) who say "Allah hath\n\t\t\tbegotten a son": 2329
No knowledge have they of such a thing nor had their fathers. It\n\t\t\tis a grievous thing that issues from their mouths as a saying. \n\t\t\tWhat they say is nothing but falsehood! 2330
Thou wouldst only perchance fret thyself to death following after\n\t\t\tthem in grief if they believe not in this Message. 2331
That which is on earth We have made but as a glittering show for\n\t\t\tthe earth in order that We may test them as to which of them are\n\t\t\tbest in conduct. 2332
Verily what is on earth We shall make but as dust and dry soil\n\t\t\t(without growth or herbage). 2333
Or dost thou reflect that the Companions of the Cave and of the\n\t\t\tInscription were wonders among Our Signs? 2334\n\t\t\t2335 2336
Behold the youths betook themselves to the Cave: they said "Our\n\t\t\tLord! bestow on us Mercy from Thyself and dispose of our affair\n\t\t\tfor us in the right way! 2337 2338
Then We drew (a veil) over their ears for a number of years in\n\t\t\tthe cave (so that they heard not): 2339
Then We roused them in order to test which of the two parties was\n\t\t\tbest at calculating the term of years they had tarried!\n\t\t\t2340 2341
We relate to thee their story in truth: they were youths who\n\t\t\tbelieved in their Lord and We advanced them in guidance:\n\t\t\t2342

We gave strength to their hearts: Behold they stood up and said: "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and of the earth: never shall we call upon any god other than Him: if we did; we should indeed have uttered an enormity!" 2343 2344

"These our people have taken for worship gods other than Him: why do they not bring forward an authority clear (and convincing) for what they do? Who doth more wrong than such as invent a falsehood against Allah? 2345

"When ye turn away from them and the things they worship other than Allah betake yourselves to the Cave: your Lord will shower his mercies on you and dispose of your affair towards comfort and ease." 2346

Thou wouldst have seen the sun when it rose declining to the right from their Cave and when it set turning away from them to the left while they lay in the open space in the midst of the Cave. Such are among the Signs of Allah: he whom Allah guided; but he whom Allah leaves to stray for him wilt thou find no protector to lead him to the Right Way. 2347 2348

Thou wouldst have deemed them awake whilst they were asleep and We turned them on their right and their left sides: their dog stretching forth his two forelegs on the threshold: if thou hadst come up on to them thou wouldst have certainly turned back from them in flight and wouldst certainly have been filled with terror of them. 2349 2350 2351

Such (being their state) We raised them up (from sleep) that they might question each other. Said one of them "How long have ye stayed (here)?" They said "We have stayed (perhaps) a day or part of a day." (At length) they (all) said "Allah (alone) knows best how long ye have stayed here...Now send ye then one of you with this money of yours to the town: let him find out which is the best food (to be had) and bring some to you that (ye may) satisfy hunger herewith: and let him behave with care and courtesy and let him not inform anyone about you. 2352 2353 2354
"For if thy should come upon you they would stone you or force\n\t\t\tyou to return to their cult and in that case ye would never\n\t\t\tattain prosperity." 2355 2356

Thus did We make their case known to the people that they might know that the promise of Allah is true and that there can be no doubt about the Hour of Judgment. Behold they dispute among themselves as to their affair. (Some) said "Construct a building over them": their Lord knows best about them: those who prevailed over their affair said "Let us surely build a place of worship over them." 2357 2358

(Some) say they were three the dog being the fourth among them; (others) say they were five the dog being the sixth doubtfully guessing at the unknown; (yet others) say they were seven the dog being the eighth. Say thou: "My Lord knoweth best their number; it is but few that know their (real case)." Enter not therefore into controversies concerning them except on a matter that is clear nor consult any of them about (the affair of) the Sleepers. 2359 2360 2361 2362
Nor say of anything "I shall be sure to do so and so tomorrow"
Without adding "So please Allah!" And call thy Lord to mind when thou forgettest and say "I hope that my Lord will guide me ever closer (even) than this to the right road." 2363 2364
So they stayed in their Cave three hundred years and (some) add\n\t\t\tnine (more). 2365

Say: "Allah knows best how long they stayed: with Him is (the knowledge of) the secrets of the heavens and the earth: how clearly He sees how finely He hears (everything)! They have no protector other than Him; nor does He share His Command with any person whatsoever. 2366 2367
And recite (and teach) what has been revealed to thee of the Book\n\t\t\tof thy Lord: none can change His Words and none wilt thou find as\n\t\t\ta refuge other than Him. 2368

And keep thy soul content with those who call on their Lord morning and evening seeking his Face; and let not thine eyes pass beyond them seeking the pomp and glitter of this Life; nor obey any whose heart We have permitted to neglect the remembrance of Us one who follows his own desires whose case has gone beyond all bounds. 2369 2370

Say "The Truth is from your Lord": let him who will believe and let him who will reject (it): for the wrongdoers We have prepared a Fire whose (smoke and flames) like the wall and roof of a tent will hem them in: if they implore relief they will be granted water like melted brass that will scald their faces. How dreadful the drink! How uncomfortable a couch to recline on! 2371
As to those who believe and work righteousness verily We shall\n\t\t\tnot suffer to perish the reward of any who do a (single)\n\t\t\trighteous deed. 2372

For them will be Gardens of Eternity; beneath them rivers will flow; they will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and they will wear green garments of fine silk and heavy brocade; they will recline therein on raised thrones. How good the recompense! How beautiful a couch to recline on! 2373 2374
Set forth to them the parable of two men: for one of them We provided two gardens of grapevines and surrounded them with date-palms: in between the two We placed corn-fields. 2375
Each of those gardens brought forth its produce and failed not in\n\t\t\tthe least therein: in the midst of them We caused a river to\n\t\t\tflow.

(Abundant) was the produce this man had: he said to his companion\n\t\t\tin the course of a mutual argument: "More wealth have I than you\n\t\t\tand more honor and power in (my following of) men." 2376
He went into his garden in a state (of mind) unjust to his soul:\n\t\t\tHe said "I deem not that this will ever perish. 2377
"Nor do I deem that the Hour (of Judgment) will (ever) come: even\n\t\t\tif I am brought back to my Lord I shall surely find (there)\n\t\t\tsomething better in exchange." 2378
His companion said to him in the course of the argument with him:\n\t\t\t"Dost thou deny Him Who created thee out of dust then out of a\n\t\t\tsperm-drop then fashioned thee into a man? 2379
"But (I think) for my part that He is Allah my Lord and none\n\t\t\tshall I associate with my Lord.
"Why didst thou not as thou wentest into thy garden say: `Allah's\n\t\t\tWill (be done)! There is no power but with Allah!' If thou dost\n\t\t\tsee me less than thee in wealth and sons 2380
"It may be that my Lord will give me something better than thy\n\t\t\tgarden and that He will send on thy garden thunderbolts (by way\n\t\t\tof reckoning) from heaven making it (but) slippery sand!
"Or the water of the garden will run off underground so that thou\n\t\t\twilt never be able to find it." 2381

So his fruits (and enjoyment) were encompassed (with ruin) and he remained twisting and turning his hands over what he had spent on his property which had (now) tumbled to pieces to its very foundations and he could only say "Woe is me! would I had never ascribed partners to my Lord and Cherisher!" 2382 2383
Nor had he numbers to help him against Allah nor was he able to\n\t\t\tdeliver himself. 2384
There the (only) protection comes from Allah the True One. He is\n\t\t\tthe Best to reward and the Best to give success. 2385

Set forth to them the similitude of the life of this world: it is like the rain which We send down from the skies: the earth's vegetation absorbs it but soon it becomes dry stubble which the winds do scatter: it is (only) Allah Who prevails over all things. 2386
Wealth and sons are allurements of the life of this world: but the things that endure Good Deeds are best in the sight of thy Lord as rewards and best as (the foundation for) hopes. 2387
One Day We shall remove the mountains and thou wilt see the earth\n\t\t\tas a level stretch and We shall gather them all together nor\n\t\t\tshall We leave out any one of them. 2388

And they will be marshalled before thy Lord in ranks (with the announcement) "Now have ye come to Us (bare) as We created you first: aye ye thought We shall not fulfil the appointment made to you to meet (Us)!": 2389 2390

And the Book (of Deeds) will be placed (before you); and thou wilt see the sinful in great terror because of what is (recorded) therein; they will say "Ah! woe to us! what a book is this! It leaves out nothing small or great but takes account thereof!" They will find all that they did placed before them: and not one will thy Lord treat with injustice. 2391

Behold! We said to the angels "Bow down to Adam": they bowed down except Iblis. He was one of the Jinns and he broke the Command of his Lord. Will ye then take him and his progeny as protectors rather than Me? And they are enemies to you! Evil would be the exchange for the wrongdoers! 2392 2393 2394 2395
I called them not to witness the creation of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth nor (even) their own creation: nor is it for Me to take as\n\t\t\thelpers such as lead (men) astray! 2396
One Day He will say "Call on those whom ye thought to be My partners" and they will call on them but they will not listen to them; and We shall make for them a place of common perdition. 2397
And the Sinful shall see the Fire and apprehend that they have to\n\t\t\tall therein; no means will they find to turn away therefrom.
We have explained in detail in this Qur'an for the benefit of\n\t\t\tmankind every kind of similitude: but man is in most things\n\t\t\tcontentious. 2398

And what is there to keep back men from believing now that Guidance has come to them nor from praying for forgiveness from their Lord but that (they ask that) the ways of the ancients be repeated with them or the Wrath be brought to them face to face? 2399

We only send the Apostles to give glad tidings and to give warnings: but the Unbelievers dispute with vain argument in order therewith to weaken the truth and they treat My Signs as a jest as also the fact that they are warned! 2400

And who doth more wrong than one who is reminded of the Signs of his Lord but turns away from them forgetting the (deeds) which his hands have sent forth? Verily We have set veils over their hearts lest they should understand this and over their ears deafness. If thou callest them to guidance even then will they never accept guidance. 2401

But your Lord is Most Forgiving Full of Mercy. If He were to call them (at once) to account for what they have earned then surely He would have hastened their Punishment: but they have their appointed time beyond which they will find no refuge. 2402
Such were the populations We destroyed when they committed\n\t\t\tiniquities; but We fixed an appointed time for their destruction.\n\t\t\t2403
Behold Moses said to his attendant "I will not give up until I\n\t\t\treach the junction of the two seas or (until) I spend years and\n\t\t\tyears in travel." 2404 2405 2406
But when they reached the Junction they forgot (about) their Fish\n\t\t\twhich took its course through the sea (straight) as in a tunnel.\n\t\t\t2407 2408
When they had passed on (some distance) Moses said to his\n\t\t\tattendant: "Bring us our early meal; truly we have suffered much\n\t\t\tfatigue at this (stage of) our journey." 2409

He replied: "Sawest thou (what happened) when we betook ourselves to the rock? I did indeed forget (about) the Fish: none but Satan made me forget to tell (you) about it: it took its course through the sea in a marvelous way!" 2410
Moses said: "That was what we were seeking after": so they went\n\t\t\tback on their footsteps following (the path they had come).
So they found one of Our servants on whom We had bestowed Mercy\n\t\t\tfrom Ourselves and whom We had taught knowledge from Our own\n\t\t\tpresence. 2411 2412
Moses said to him: "May I follow thee on the footing that thou\n\t\t\tteach me something of the (Higher) Truth which thou hast been\n\t\t\ttaught?" 2413
(The other) said: "Verily thou wilt not be able to have patience\n\t\t\twith me! 2414
"And how canst thou have patience about things about which thy\n\t\t\tunderstanding is not complete?" 2415
Moses said: "Thou wilt find me if Allah so will (truly) patient:\n\t\t\tnor shall I disobey thee in aught." 2416
The other said: "If then thou wouldst follow me ask me no\n\t\t\tquestions about anything until I myself speak to thee concerning\n\t\t\tit."
So they both proceeded: until when they were in the boat he scuttled it. Said Moses: "Hast thou scuttled it in order to drown those in it? Truly a strange thing hast thou done!" 2417
He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no\n\t\t\tpatience with me?"
Moses said: "Rebuke me not for forgetting nor grieve me by\n\t\t\traising difficulties in my case."
Then they proceeded: until when they met a young man he slew him. Moses said: "Hast thou slain an innocent person who had slain none? Truly a foul (unheard-of) thing hast thou done!" 2418
He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no\n\t\t\tpatience with me?"
(Moses) said: "If ever I ask thee about anything after this keep\n\t\t\tme not in thy company: then wouldst thou have received (full)\n\t\t\texcuse from my side."

Then they proceeded: until when they came to the inhabitants of a town they asked them for food but they refused them hospitality. They found there a wall on the point of falling down but he set it up straight. (Moses) said: "If thou hadst wished surely thou couldst have exacted some recompense for it!" 2419 2420
He answered: "This is the parting between me and thee: now will I\n\t\t\ttell thee the interpretation of (those things) over which thou\n\t\t\twast unable to hold patience. 2421

As for the boat it belonged to certain men in dire want: they plied on the water: I but wished to render it unserviceable for there was after them a certain king who seized on every boat by force. 2422
"As for the youth his parents were people of Faith and we feared\n\t\t\tthat he would grieve them by obstinate rebellion and ingratitude\n\t\t\t(to Allah and man). 2423
"So we desired that their Lord would give them in exchange (a\n\t\t\tson) better in purity (of conduct) and closer in affection.\n\t\t\t2424

"As for the wall it belonged to two youths orphans in the Town; there was beneath it a buried treasure to which they were entitled: their father had been a righteous man: so thy Lord desired that they should attain their age of full strength and get out their treasure a mercy (and favor) from thy Lord. I did it not of my own accord. Such is the interpretation of (those things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience." 2425 2426 2427
They ask thee concerning Zul-qarnain. Say "I will rehearse to\n\t\t\tyou something of his story." 2428
Verily We established his power on earth and We gave him the ways\n\t\t\tand the means to all ends. 2429
One (such) way he followed

Until when he reached the setting of the sun He found it set in a spring of murky water: near it he found a People: We said: "O Zul-qarnain! (thou hast authority) either to punish them or to treat them with kindness." 2430 2431
He said: "Whoever doth wrong him shall we punish; then shall he\n\t\t\tbe sent back to his Lord; and He will punish him with a\n\t\t\tpunishment unheard-of (before). 2432
"But whoever believes and works righteousness he shall have a\n\t\t\tgoodly reward and easy will be his task as we order it by our\n\t\t\tcommand." 2433
Then followed he (another) way.
Until when he came to the rising of the sun he found it rising on\n\t\t\ta people for whom We had provided no covering protection against\n\t\t\tthe sun. 2434 2435
(He left them) as they were: We completely understood what was\n\t\t\tbefore him. 2436
Then followed he (another) way
Until when he reached (a tract) between two mountains he found\n\t\t\tbeneath them a people who scarcely understood a word.\n\t\t\t2437 2438
They said: "O Zul-qarnain! the Gog and Magog (people) do great mischief on earth: shall we then render thee tribute in order that thou mightest erect a barrier between us and them?" 2439
He said: "(The power) in which my Lord has established me is better (than tribute): help me therefore with strength (and labor): I will erect a strong barrier between you and them: 2440

"Bring me blocks of iron." At length when he had filled up the space between the two steep mountain sides he said "Blow (with your bellows)." Then when he had made it (red) as fire he said: "Bring me that I may pour over it molten lead." 2441 2442
Thus were they made powerless to scale it or to dig through it.\n\t\t\t2443
He said: "This is a mercy from my Lord: but when the promise of\n\t\t\tmy Lord comes to pass He will make it into dust; and the promise\n\t\t\tof My Lord is true." 2444
On that day We shall leave them to surge like waves on one\n\t\t\tanother; the trumpet will be blown and We shall collect them all\n\t\t\ttogether. 2445
And We shall present Hell that day for Unbelievers to see all\n\t\t\tspread out 2446
(Unbelievers) whose eyes had been under a veil from Remembrance\n\t\t\tof Me and who had been unable even to hear. 2447
Do the Unbelievers think that they can take my servants as\n\t\t\tprotectors besides Me? Verily We have prepared Hell for the\n\t\t\tUnbelievers for (their) entertainment.
Say: "Shall we tell you of those who lose most in respect of\n\t\t\ttheir deeds? 2448
"Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life while they\n\t\t\tthought that they were acquiring good by their works?"\n\t\t\t2449
They are those who deny the Signs of their Lord and the fact of their having to meet Him (in the Hereafter): vain will be their works nor shall We on the Day of Judgment give them any Weight. 2450
That is their reward Hell; because they rejected Faith and took\n\t\t\tMy Signs and My Messengers by way of jest. 2451
As to those who believe and work righteous deeds they have for\n\t\t\ttheir entertainment the Gardens of Paradise 2452
Wherein they shall dwell (for aye): no change will they wish for\n\t\t\tfrom them.
Say: "If the ocean were ink (wherewith to write out) the words of my Lord sooner would the ocean be exhausted than would the words of my Lord even if we added another ocean like it for its aid." 2453

Say: "I am but a man like yourselves (but) the inspiration has come to me that your Allah is one Allah: whoever expects to meet his Lord let him work righteousness and in the worship of his Lord admit no one as partner." 2454
Kaf. Ha. Ya. `Ain. Sad. 2455
(This is) a recital of the Mercy of thy Lord to His Servant\n\t\t\tZakariya. 2456
Behold! he cried to his Lord in secret 2457
Praying: "O my Lord! infirm indeed are my bones and the hair of\n\t\t\tmy head doth glisten with grey: but never am I unblest O my Lord\n\t\t\tin my prayer to Thee! 2458
"Now I fear (what) my relatives (and colleagues) (will do) after\n\t\t\tme: but my wife is barren: so give me an heir as from Thyself\n\t\t\t2459
"(One that) will (truly) represent me and represent the posterity\n\t\t\tof Jacob; and make him O my Lord! one with whom Thou art\n\t\t\twell-pleased!" 2460
(His prayer was answered): "O Zakariya! We give thee good news of\n\t\t\ta son: his name shall be Yahya: on none by that name have We\n\t\t\tconferred distinction before." 2461
He said: "O my Lord! how shall I have a son when my wife is\n\t\t\tbarren and I have grown quite decrepit from old age?"
He said: "So (it will be): thy Lord saith `That is easy for Me: I\n\t\t\tdid indeed create thee before when thou hadst been nothing!' "\n\t\t\t2462 2463
(Zakariya) said "O my Lord! give me a Sign." "Thy Sign" was the\n\t\t\tanswer "shall be that thou shalt speak to no man for three nights\n\t\t\talthough thou art not dumb." 2464 2465
So Zakariya came out to his people from his chamber: he told them\n\t\t\tby signs to celebrate Allah's praises in the morning and in the\n\t\t\tevening.
(To his son came the command): "O Yahya! take hold of the Book\n\t\t\twith might": and We gave him wisdom even as a youth.\n\t\t\t2466 2467
And pity (for all creatures) as from Us and purity: he was devout\n\t\t\t2468
And kind to his parents and he was not overbearing or rebellious.
So Peace on him the day he was born the day that he dies and the\n\t\t\tday that he will be raised up to life (again)! 2469
Relate in the Book (the story of) Mary when she withdrew from her\n\t\t\tfamily to a place in the East. 2470 2471
She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them: then We sent\n\t\t\tto her Our angel and he appeared before her as a man in all\n\t\t\trespects.
She said: "I seek refuge from thee to (Allah) Most Gracious:\n\t\t\t(come not near) if thou dost fear Allah."
He said: "Nay I am only a messenger from thy Lord (to announce)\n\t\t\tto thee the gift of a holy son." 2472
She said: "How shall I have a son seeing that no man has touched\n\t\t\tme and I am not unchaste?"
He said: "So (it will be): thy Lord saith `That is easy for Me:\n\t\t\tand (We wish) to appoint him as a Sign unto men and a Mercy from\n\t\t\tUs': it is a matter (so) decreed." 2473 2474
So she conceived him and she retired with him to a remote place.\n\t\t\t2475
And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree: she cried (in her anguish): "Ah! would that I had died before this! Would that I had been a thing forgotten and out of sight!" 2476
But (a voice) cried to her from beneath the (palm-free): "Grieve\n\t\t\tnot! for thy Lord hath provided a rivulet beneath thee;
"And shake towards thyself the trunk of the palm-tree: it will\n\t\t\tlet fall fresh ripe dates upon thee. 2477
"So eat and drink and cool (thine) eye. And if thou dost see any man say `I have vowed a fast to (Allah) Most Gracious and this day will I enter into no talk with any human being.' " 2478 2479
At length she brought the (babe) to her people carrying him (in\n\t\t\ther arms). They said: "O Mary! truly an amazing thing hast thou\n\t\t\tbrought! 2480
"O sister of Aaron! thy father was not a man of evil nor thy\n\t\t\tmother a woman unchaste!" 2481
But she pointed to the babe. They said: "How can we talk to one\n\t\t\twho is a child in the cradle?" 2482
He said: "I am indeed a servant of Allah: He hath given me\n\t\t\trevelation and made me a prophet;
"And He hath made me Blessed wheresoever I be and hath enjoined\n\t\t\ton me Prayer and Charity as long as I live; 2483
"(He) hath made me kind to my mother and not overbearing or\n\t\t\tmiserable; 2484
"So Peace is on me the day I was born the day that I die and the\n\t\t\tDay that I shall be raised up to life (again)"! 2485
Such (was) Jesus the son of Mary: (it is) a statement of truth\n\t\t\tabout which they (vainly) dispute. 2486
It is not befitting to (the majesty of) Allah that He should\n\t\t\tbeget a son. Glory be to Him! When He determines a matter He\n\t\t\tonly says to it "Be" and it is. 2487
Verily Allah is my Lord and your Lord: Him therefore serve ye:\n\t\t\tthis is a Way that is straight. 2488
But the sects differ among themselves: and woe to the Unbelievers\n\t\t\tbecause of the (coming) Judgment of a momentous Day!\n\t\t\t2489
How plainly will they see and hear the Day that they will appear\n\t\t\tbefore Us! But the unjust today are in error manifest!\n\t\t\t2490
But warn them of the Day of Distress when the matter will be\n\t\t\tdetermined: for (behold) they are negligent and they do not\n\t\t\tbelieve! 2491
It is We Who will inherit the earth and all beings thereon: to Us\n\t\t\twill they all be returned. 2492
Also mention in the Book (the story of) Abraham: he was a man of\n\t\t\tTruth a prophet.
Behold he said to his father: "O my father! why worship that\n\t\t\twhich heareth not and seeth not and can profit thee nothing?\n\t\t\t2493
"O my father! to me hath come knowledge which hath not reached\n\t\t\tthee: so follow me: I will guide thee to a Way that is even and\n\t\t\tstraight. 2494 2495
"O my father! serve not Satan: for Satan is a rebel against\n\t\t\t(Allah) Most Gracious. 2496
"O my father! I fear lest a Penalty afflict thee from (Allah)\n\t\t\tMost Gracious so that thou become to Satan a friend."\n\t\t\t2497
(The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods O Abraham? If thou\n\t\t\tforbear not I will indeed stone thee: now get away from me for a\n\t\t\tgood long while!" 2498
Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy\n\t\t\tforgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious. 2499
"And I will turn away from you (all) and from those whom ye\n\t\t\tinvoke besides Allah: I will call on my Lord: Perhaps by my\n\t\t\tprayer to my Lord I shall be not unblest." 2500
When he had turned away from them and from those whom they\n\t\t\tworshipped besides Allah We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob and\n\t\t\teach one of them We made a prophet. 2501
And We bestowed of Our Mercy on them and We granted them lofty\n\t\t\thonor on the tongue of truth. 2502
Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was\n\t\t\tspecially chosen and he was an apostle (and) a prophet.\n\t\t\t2503
And We called him from the right side of Mount (Sinai) and made\n\t\t\thim draw near to Us for mystic (converse). 2504
And out of Our Mercy We gave him his brother Aaron (also) a\n\t\t\tprophet. 2505
Also mention in the Book (the story of) Ismail: He was (strictly)\n\t\t\ttrue to what he promised and he was an apostle (and) a prophet.\n\t\t\t2506
He used to enjoin on his people Prayer and Charity and he was\n\t\t\tmost acceptable in the sight of his Lord. 2507
Also mention in the Book the case of Idris: he was a man of truth\n\t\t\t(and sincerity) (and) a prophet: 2508
And We raised him to a lofty station.

Those were some of the prophets on whom Allah did bestow His Grace of the posterity of Adam and of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of those whom We guided and chose; whenever the Signs of (Allah) Most Gracious were rehearsed to them they would fall down in prostrate adoration and in tears. 2509 2510
But after them there followed a posterity who missed prayers and\n\t\t\tfollowed after lusts: soon then will they face Destruction\n\t\t\t2511
Except those who repent and believe and work righteousness: for\n\t\t\tthese will enter the Garden and will not be wronged in the least
Gardens of Eternity those which (Allah) Most Gracious has\n\t\t\tpromised to His servants in the Unseen: for His promise must\n\t\t\t(necessarily) come to pass.
They will not there hear any vain discourse but only salutations\n\t\t\tof peace: and they will have therein their sustenance morning and\n\t\t\tevening. 2512 2513
Such is the Garden which We give as an inheritance to those of\n\t\t\tOur Servants who guard against evil.
(The angels say:) "We descend not but by command of thy Lord: to\n\t\t\tHim belongeth what is before us and what is behind us and what is\n\t\t\tbetween: and thy Lord never doth forget" 2514
"Lord of the heavens and of the earth and of all that is between them: so worship Him and be constant and patient in His worship: knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?" 2515
Man says: "What! when I am dead shall I then be raised up alive?"
But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of\n\t\t\tnothing?
So by thy Lord without doubt We shall gather them together and\n\t\t\t(also) the Evil Ones (with them); then shall We bring them forth\n\t\t\ton their knees round about Hell; 2516 2517
Then shall We certainly drag out from every sect all those who\n\t\t\twere worst in obstinate rebellion against (Allah) Most Gracious.
And certainly We know best those who are most worthy of being\n\t\t\tburned therein.
Not one of you but will pass over it: this is with thy Lord a\n\t\t\tDecree which must be accomplished. 2518
But We shall save those who guarded against evil and We shall\n\t\t\tleave the wrongdoers therein (humbled) to their knees.
When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them the Unbelievers say to\n\t\t\tthose who believe "Which of the two sides is best in point of\n\t\t\tposition? Which makes the best show in council?" 2519
But how many (countless) generations before them have We\n\t\t\tdestroyed who were even better in equipment and in glitter to the\n\t\t\teye?

Say: "If any men go astray (Allah) Most Gracious extends (the rope) to them. Until when they see the warning of Allah (being fulfilled) either in punishment or in (the approach of) the Hour they will at length realize who is worst in position and (who) weakest in forces! 2520
"And Allah doth advance in guidance those who seek guidance; and the things that endure. Good Deeds are best in the sight of thy Lord as rewards and best in respect of (their) eventual returns." 2521
Hast thou then seen the (sort of) man who rejects Our Signs yet\n\t\t\tsays: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children"?\n\t\t\t2522
Has he penetrated to the Unseen or has he taken a contract with\n\t\t\t(Allah) Most Gracious?
Nay! We shall record what he says and We Shall add and add to his\n\t\t\tpunishment. 2523
To Us shall return all that he talks of and he shall appear\n\t\t\tbefore Us bare and alone. 2524
And they have taken (for worship) gods other than Allah to give\n\t\t\tthem power and glory! 2525
Instead they shall reject their worship and become adversaries\n\t\t\tagainst them. 2526
Seest thou not that We have set the Evil Ones on against the\n\t\t\tUnbelievers to incite them with fury? 2527
So make no haste against them for We but count out to them a\n\t\t\t(limited) number (of days).
The day We shall gather the righteous to (Allah) Most Gracious\n\t\t\tlike a band presented before a king for honors.
And We shall drive the sinners to Hell like thirsty cattle driven\n\t\t\tdown to water 2528
None shall have the power of intercession but such a one as has\n\t\t\treceived permission (or promise) from (Allah) Most Gracious.
They say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten a son!"
Indeed ye have put forth a thing most monstrous! 2529
At if the skies are ready to burst the earth to split asunder and\n\t\t\tthe mountains to fall down in utter ruin.
That they should invoke a son for (Allah) Most Gracious.
For it is not consonant with the majesty of (Allah) Most Gracious\n\t\t\tthat He should beget a son. 2530
Not one of the beings in the heavens and the earth but must come\n\t\t\tto (Allah) Most Gracious as a servant.
He does take and account of them (all) and hath numbered them\n\t\t\t(all) exactly. 2531
And every one of them will come to him singly on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment.
On those who believe and work deeds of righteousness will (Allah)\n\t\t\tMost Gracious bestow Love. 2532
So have We made the (Qur'an) easy in thine own tongue that with\n\t\t\tit thou mayest give Glad Tidings to the righteous and warnings to\n\t\t\tpeople given to contention.
But how many (countless) generation before them have We\n\t\t\tdestroyed? Canst thou find a single one of them (now) or hear\n\t\t\t(so much as) a whisper of them? 2533
Ta Ha. 2534
We have not sent down the Qur'an to thee to be (an occasion) for\n\t\t\tthy distress 2535
But only as an admonition to those who fear (Allah)
A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the heavens on\n\t\t\thigh.
(Allah) Most Gracious is firmly established on the throne (of\n\t\t\tauthority). 2536
To Him belongs what is in the heavens and on earth and all\n\t\t\tbetween them and all beneath the soil. 2537
If thou pronounce the word aloud (it is no matter): for verily He\n\t\t\tknoweth what is secret and what is yet more hidden. 2538
Allah! there is no god but He! To Him belong the Most Beautiful\n\t\t\tNames. 2539
Has the story of Moses reached thee? 2540
Behold he saw a fire: so he said to his family "Tarry ye; I perceive a fire; perhaps I can bring you some burning brand therefrom or find some guidance at the fire." 2541 2542
But when he came to the fire a voice was heard: "O Moses!
"Verily I am thy Lord! Therefore (in My presence) put off thy\n\t\t\tshoes: thou art in the sacred valley Tuwa. 2543\n\t\t\t2544
"I have chosen thee: listen then to the inspiration (sent to\n\t\t\tthee).
"Verily I am Allah: there is no god but I: so serve thou me\n\t\t\t(only) and establish regular prayer for celebrating My praise.
"Verily the Hour is coming My design is to keep it hidden for\n\t\t\tevery soul to receive its reward by the measure of its endeavor.\n\t\t\t2545 2546
"Therefore let not such as believe not therein but follow their\n\t\t\town lusts divert thee therefrom lest thou perish!" 2547
And what is that in thy right hand O Moses?"
He said "It is my rod: on it I lean; with it I beat down fodder\n\t\t\tfor my flocks; and in it I find other uses." 2548
(Allah) said "Throw it O Moses!"
He threw it and behold! it was a snake active in motion.\n\t\t\t2549
(Allah) said "Seize it and fear not: We shall return it at once\n\t\t\tto its former condition"...
Now draw thy hand close to thy side: it shall come forth white\n\t\t\t(and shining) without harm (or stain) as another Sign\n\t\t\t2550
"In order that We may show thee (two) of Our Greater Signs.
"Go thou to Pharaoh for he had indeed transgressed all bounds."\n\t\t\t2551
(Moses) said: "O my Lord! expand me my breast;" 2552
"Ease my task for me;
"And remove the impediment from my speech. 2553
"So they may understand what I say:
"And give me a Minister from my family
"Aaron my brother;
"Add to my strength through him 2554
"And make him share my task:
"That we may celebrate Thy praise without stint 2555
"And remember Thee without stint:
For Thou art He that (ever) regardeth us." 2556
(Allah) said: "Granted is thy prayer O Moses!"
"And indeed We conferred a favor on thee another time (before).
"Behold! We sent to thy mother by inspiration the message:\n\t\t\t2557

" `Throw (the child) into the chest and throw (the chest) into the river: the river will cast him up on the bank and he will be taken up by one who is an enemy to Me and an enemy to him': but I cast (the garment of) love over thee from Me: and (this) in order that thou mayest be reared under Mine eye. 2558 2559 2560

"Behold! thy sister goeth forth and saith `Shall I show you one who will nurse and rear the (child)?' So We brought thee back to thy mother that her eye might be cooled and she should not grieve. Then thou didst slay a man but We saved thee from trouble and We tried thee in various ways. Then didst thou tarry a number of years with the people of Midian. Then didst thou come hither as ordained O Moses! 2561 2562 2563 2564
"And I have prepared thee for Myself (for service)"...
"Go thou and thy brother with My Signs and slacken not either of\n\t\t\tyou in keeping Me in remembrance. 2565
"Go both of you to Pharaoh for he has indeed transgressed all\n\t\t\tbounds; 2566 2567
"But speak to him mildly; perchance he may take warning or fear\n\t\t\t(Allah)." 2568
They (Moses and Aaron) said: "Our Lord! we fear lest He hasten\n\t\t\twith insolence against us or lest he transgress all bounds."\n\t\t\t2569
He said: "Fear not: for I am with you: I hear and see\n\t\t\t(everything).

"So go ye both to him and say `Verily we are apostles sent by thy Lord: send forth therefore the Children of Israel with us and afflict them not: with a Sign indeed have we come from thy Lord! And peace to all who follow guidance! 2570 2571
" `Verily it has been revealed to us that the Penalty (awaits)\n\t\t\tthose who reject and turn away.' "
(When this message was delivered) (Pharaoh) said: "Who then O\n\t\t\tMoses is the Lord of you two?" 2572
He said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each (created) thing its\n\t\t\tform and nature and further gave (it) guidance." 2573
(Pharaoh) said: "What then is the condition of previous\n\t\t\tgenerations?" 2574
He replied: "The knowledge of that is with my Lord duly recorded:\n\t\t\tmy Lord never errs nor forgets 2575

"He Who has made for you the earth like a carpet spread out; has enabled you to go about therein by roads (and channels); and has sent down water from the sky." With it have We produced divers pairs of plants each separate from the others. 2576 2577 2578
Eat (for yourselves) and pasture your cattle: verily in this are\n\t\t\tSigns for men endued with understanding.
From the (earth) did We create you and into it shall We return\n\t\t\tyou and from it shall We bring you out once again. 2579
And We showed Pharaoh all Our Signs but he did reject and refuse.\n\t\t\t2580
He said: "Hast thou come to drive us out of our land with thy\n\t\t\tmagic O Moses? 2581
"But we can surely produce magic to match thine! So make a tryst between us and thee which we shall not fail to keep neither we nor thou in a place where both shall have even chances." 2582
Moses said: "Your tryst is the Day of the Festival and let the\n\t\t\tpeople be assembled when the sun is well up." 2583
So Pharaoh withdrew: he concerted his plan and then came (back).\n\t\t\t2584
Moses said to him: "Woe to you! forge not ye a lie against Allah\n\t\t\tlest He destroy you (at once) utterly by chastisement: the forger\n\t\t\tmust suffer frustration!" 2585
So they disputed one with another over their affair but they kept\n\t\t\ttheir talk secret. 2586
They said: "These two are certainly (expert) magicians: their\n\t\t\tobject is to drive you out from your land with their magic and to\n\t\t\tdo away with your Most cherished institutions. 2587
"Therefore concert your plan. And then assemble in (serried)\n\t\t\tranks: he wins (all along) today who gains the upper hand."\n\t\t\t2588
They said: "O Moses! whether wilt thou that thou throw (first) or\n\t\t\tthat we be the first to throw?"
He said "Nay throw ye first!" Then behold their ropes and their\n\t\t\trods so it seemed to him on account of their magic began to be in\n\t\t\tlively motion! 2589
So Moses conceived in his mind a (sort of) fear. 2590
We said: "Fear not! for thou hast indeed the upper hand:

"Throw that which is in thy right hand: quickly will it swallow up that which they have faked. What they have faked is but a magician's trick: and the magician thrives not (no matter) where he goes." 2591
So the magicians were thrown down to prostration: they said "We\n\t\t\tbelieve in the Lord of Aaron and Moses." 2592

(Pharaoh) said: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? Surely this must be your leader who has taught you magic! Be sure I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and I will have you crucified on trunks of palm-trees: So shall ye know for certain which of us can give the more severe and the more lasting Punishment!" 2593

They said: "Never shall we regard thee as more than the Clear Signs that have come to us or than Him Who created us! So decree whatever thou desirest to decree: for thou canst only decree (touching) the life of this world. 2594 2595
For us we have believed in our Lord: may He forgive us our faults\n\t\t\tand the magic to which thou didst compel us: for Allah is Best\n\t\t\tand Most Abiding." 2596
Verily he who comes to his Lord as a sinner (at judgment) for him\n\t\t\tis Hell: therein shall he neither die nor live. 2597
But such as comes to Him as Believers who have worked righteous\n\t\t\tdeeds--for them are ranks exalted
Gardens of Eternity beneath which flow rivers: they will dwell\n\t\t\ttherein for aye: such is the reward of those who purify\n\t\t\tthemselves (from evil). 2598
We sent an inspiration to Moses: "Travel by night with my servants and strike a dry path for them through the sea without fear of being overtaken (by Pharaoh) and without (any other) fear." 2599
Then Pharaoh pursued them with his forces but the waters\n\t\t\tcompletely overwhelmed them and covered them up.
Pharaoh led his people astray instead of leading them aright.\n\t\t\t2600
O ye Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy and We\n\t\t\tmade a Covenant with you on the side of Mount (Sinai) and We sent\n\t\t\tdown to you Manna and quails: 2601

(Saying): "Eat of the good things We have provided for your sustenance but commit no excess therein lest My Wrath should justly descend on you: and those on whom descends My Wrath do perish indeed! 2602 2603
"But without doubt I am (also) He that forgives again and again\n\t\t\tto those who repent believe and do right who in fine are ready to\n\t\t\treceive true guidance."
(When Moses was up on the mount Allah said:) "What made thee\n\t\t\thasten in advance of thy people O Moses?" 2604
He replied: "Behold they are close on my footsteps: I hastened to\n\t\t\tThee o my Lord to please Thee."
(Allah) said: "We have tested thy people in thy absence: the\n\t\t\tSamiri has led them astray." 2605

So Moses returned to his people in state of indignation and sorrow. He said: "O my people! did not your Lord make a handsome promise to you? Did then the promise seem to you long (in coming)? Or did ye desire that Wrath should descend from your Lord on you and so ye broke your promise to me?" 2606

They said: "We broke not the promise to thee as far as lay in our power: but we were made to carry the weight of the ornaments of the (whole) people and we threw them (into the fire) and that was what the Samiri suggested. 2607 2608
"Then he brought out (of the fire) before the (people) the image of a calf: it seemed to low: so they said: `This is your god and the god of Moses but (Moses) has forgotten!' " 2609 2610 2611
Could they not see that it could not return them a word (for\n\t\t\tanswer) and that it had no power either to harm them or to do\n\t\t\tthem good? 2612
Aaron had already before this said to them: "O my people! ye are being tested in this: for verily your Lord is (Allah) Most Gracious: so follow me and obey my command." 2613 2614
They had said: "We will not abandon this cult but we will devote\n\t\t\tourselves to it until Moses returns to us. 2615\n\t\t\t2616
(Moses) said: " O Aaron! what kept thee back when thou sawest\n\t\t\tthem going wrong
"From following me? Didst thou then disobey my order?"\n\t\t\t2617

(Aaron) replied: "O son of my mother! seize (me not) by my beard nor by (the hair of) my head! Truly I feared lest thou shouldst say `Thou hast caused a division among the Children of Israel and thou didst not respect my word!'" 2618 2619
(Moses) said: "What then is thy case O Samiri?" 2620
He replied: "I saw what they saw not: so I took a handful (of\n\t\t\tdust) from the footprint of the Apostle and threw it (into the\n\t\t\tcalf): thus did my soul suggest to me." 2621

(Moses) said: "Get thee gone! but thy (punishment) in this life will be that thou wilt say `Touch me not'; and moreover (for a future penalty) thou hast a promise that will not fail: now look at thy god of whom thou hast become a devoted worshipper: we will certainly (melt) it in a blazing fire and scatter it broadcast in the sea!" 2622 2623 2624
But the god of you all is the One Allah: there is no god but He:\n\t\t\tall things He comprehends in His knowledge.
Thus do We relate to thee some stories of what happened before:\n\t\t\tfor We have sent thee a Message from Our own Presence.\n\t\t\t2625
If any do turn away therefrom verily they will bear a burden on\n\t\t\tthe Day of Judgement;
They will abide in this (state): and grievous will the burden be\n\t\t\tto them on that Day 2626
The Day when the Trumpet will be sounded: that Day We shall\n\t\t\tgather the sinful blear-eyed (with terror) 2627
In whispers will they consult each other: "Ye tarried not longer\n\t\t\tthan ten (Days)"; 2628
We know best what they will say when their leader most eminent in\n\t\t\tConduct will say: "Ye tarried not longer than a day!"\n\t\t\t2629
They ask thee concerning the mountains: say "My Lord will uproot\n\t\t\tthem and scatter them as dust;" 2630 2631
"He will leave them as plains smooth and level;"
Nothing crooked or curved wilt thou see in their place."

On that Day will they follow the Caller (straight): no crookedness (can they show) him: all sounds shall humble themselves in the presence of (Allah) Most Gracious: nothing shalt thou hear but the tramp of their feet (as they march). 2632 2633
On that Day shall no intercession avail except for those for whom\n\t\t\tpermission has been granted by (Allah) Most Gracious and whose\n\t\t\tword is acceptable to Him. 2634
He knows what (appears to His creatures as) before or after or\n\t\t\tbehind them: but they shall not compass it with their knowledge.\n\t\t\t2635
(All) faces shall be humbled before (Him) the Living the\n\t\t\tSelf-Subsisting Eternal: hopeless indeed will be the man that\n\t\t\tcarries iniquity (on his back). 2636
But he who works deeds of righteousness and has faith will have\n\t\t\tno fear of harm nor of any curtailment (of what is his due).\n\t\t\t2637
Thus have we sent this down an Arabic Qur'an and explained therein in detail some of the warnings in order that they may fear Allah or that it may cause their remembrance (of Him). 2638
High above all is Allah the King the Truth! Be not in haste with\n\t\t\tthe Qur'an before its revelation to thee is completed but say "O\n\t\t\tmy Lord! advance me in knowledge." 2639
We had already beforehand taken the covenant of Adam but he\n\t\t\tforgot: and We found on his part no firm resolve. 2640
When We said to the angels "Prostrate yourselves to Adam" they\n\t\t\tprostrated themselves but not Iblis: he refused.
Then We said: "O Adam! verily this is an enemy to thee and thy\n\t\t\twife: so let him not get you both out of the Garden so that thou\n\t\t\tart landed in misery. 2641
"There is therein (enough provision) for thee not to go hungry\n\t\t\tnor to go naked" 2642
"Nor to suffer from thirst nor from the sun's heat."
But Satan whispered evil to him: he said "O Adam! shall I lead\n\t\t\tthee to Tree of Eternity and to a kingdom that never decays?"\n\t\t\t2643

In the result they both ate of the tree and so their nakedness appeared to them: they began to sew together for their covering leaves from the Garden: thus did Adam disobey His Lord and allow himself to be seduced. 2644 2645
But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him and gave\n\t\t\thim guidance.

He said: "Get ye down both of you all together from the Garden with enmity one to another; but if as is sure there comes to you guidance from Me whosoever follows My guidance will not lose his way nor fall into misery. 2646 2647
"But whosoever turns away from My Message verily for him is a\n\t\t\tlife narrowed down and We shall raise him up blind on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment." 2648
He will say: "O my Lord! why hast thou raised me up blind while I\n\t\t\thad sight (before)?" 2649
(Allah) will say: "Thus didst thou when Our Signs came unto thee\n\t\t\tdisregard them: so wilt thou this day be disregarded."\n\t\t\t2650
And thus do We recompense him who transgresses beyond bounds and\n\t\t\tbelieves not in the Signs of his Lord: and the Penalty of the\n\t\t\tHereafter is far more grievous and more enduring. 2651
It is not a warning to such men (to call to mind) how many generations before them We destroyed in whose haunts they (now) move? Verily in this are Signs for men endued with understanding. 2652
Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord\n\t\t\t(their punishment) must necessarily have come; but there is a\n\t\t\tterm appointed (for respite). 2653

Therefore be patient with what they say and celebrate (constantly) the praises of thy Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; yea celebrate them for part of the hours of the night and at the sides of the day: that thou mayest have (spiritual) joy. 2654 2655

Nor strain thine eyes in longing for the things We have given for enjoyment to parties of them the splendor of the life of this world through which We test them: but the provision of thy Lord is better and more enduring. 2656
Enjoin prayer on thy people and be constant therein. We ask thee\n\t\t\tnot to provide sustenance: We provide it for thee. But the\n\t\t\t(fruit of) the Hereafter is for Righteousness. 2657
They say: "Why does he not bring us a Sign from His Lord?" Has\n\t\t\tnot a clear Sign come to them of all that was in the former Books\n\t\t\tof revelation? 2658

And if We had inflicted on them a Penalty before this they would have said: "Our Lord! if only Thou hadst sent us an apostle we should certainly have followed Thy Signs before we were humbled and put to shame." 2659
Say: "Each one (of us) is waiting: wait ye therefore and soon shall ye know who it is that is on the straight and even way and who it is that has received guidance." 2660 2661
Closer and closer to mankind comes their Reckoning: yet they heed\n\t\t\tnot and they turn away. 2662
Never comes (aught) to them of a renewed Message from their Lord\n\t\t\tbut they listen to it as in jest 2663
Their hearts toying as with trifles. The wrongdoers conceal their private counsels (saying) "Is this (one) more than a man like yourselves? Will ye go to witchcraft with your eyes open?" 2664 2665
Say: "My Lord knoweth (every) word (spoken) in the heavens and\n\t\t\tthe earth: He is the One that heareth and knoweth (all things)."\n\t\t\t2666 2667
"Nay" they say "(these are) medleys of dreams! nay he forged\n\t\t\tit!--nay he is (but) a poet! Let him then bring us a Sign like\n\t\t\tthe ones that were sent to (prophets) of old!" 2668
(As to those) before them not one of the populations which We\n\t\t\tdestroyed believed: will these believe? 2669
Before thee also the apostles we sent were but men to whom We\n\t\t\tgranted inspiration: if ye realize this not ask of those who\n\t\t\tpossess the Message. 2670
Nor did We give them bodies that ate no food nor were they exempt\n\t\t\tfrom death. 2671
In the end We fulfilled to them Our promise and We saved them and\n\t\t\tthose whom We pleased but We destroyed those who transgressed\n\t\t\tbeyond bounds. 2672
We have revealed for you (O men!) a book in which is a Message\n\t\t\tfor you: will ye not then understand?
How many were the populations we utterly destroyed because of\n\t\t\ttheir iniquities setting up in their places other peoples!
Yet when they felt Our Punishment (coming) behold they (tried to)\n\t\t\tflee from it. 2673
Flee not but return to the good things of this life which were\n\t\t\tgiven you and to your homes in order that ye may be called to\n\t\t\taccount. 2674
They said: "Ah! woe to us! We were indeed wrongdoers!"
And that cry of theirs ceased not till We made them as a field\n\t\t\tthat is mown as ashes silent and quenched. 2675
Not for (idle) sport did We create the heavens and the earth and\n\t\t\tall that is between! 2676
If it had been Our wish to take (just) a pastime We should surely\n\t\t\thave taken it from the things nearest to Us if We would do (such\n\t\t\ta thing)! 2677
Nay We hurl the Truth against falsehood and it knocks out its\n\t\t\tbrain and behold falsehood doth perish! Ah! woe be to you for the\n\t\t\t(false) things ye ascribe (to Us). 2678
To Him belong all (creatures) in the heavens and on earth: even\n\t\t\tthose who are in His (very) Presence are not too proud to serve\n\t\t\tHim nor are they (ever) weary (of His service): 2679
They celebrate His praises night and day nor do they ever flag or\n\t\t\tintermit.
Or have they taken (for worship) gods from the earth who can\n\t\t\traise (the dead)? 2680 2681

If there were in the heavens and the earth other gods besides Allah there would have been confusion in both! But glory to Allah the Lord of the Throne: (high is He) above what they attribute to Him! 2682
He cannot be questioned for His acts but they will be questioned\n\t\t\t(for theirs). 2683

Or have they taken for worship (other) gods besides Him? Say "Bring your convincing proof: this is the Message of those with me and the Message of those before me." But most of them know not the Truth and so turn away. 2684 2685
Not an apostle did We send before thee without this inspiration\n\t\t\tsent by Us to him: that there is no god but I; therefore worship\n\t\t\tand serve Me.
And they say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten offspring."\n\t\t\tGlory to Him! they are (but) servants raised to honor.\n\t\t\t2686
They speak not before He speaks and they act (in all things) by\n\t\t\tHis command. 2687
He knows what is before them and what is behind them and they offer no intercession except for those who are acceptable and they stand in awe and reverence of His (glory). 2688 2689
If any of them should say "I am a god besides Him" such a god We\n\t\t\tshould reward with Hell: thus do We reward those who do wrong.

Do not the Unbelievers see that the heavens and the earth were joined together (as one unit of Creation) before We clove them asunder? We made from water every living thing. Will they not then believe? 2690 2691

And We have set on the earth mountains standing firm lest it should shake with them and We have made therein broad highways (between mountains) for them to pass through: that they may receive guidance. 2692 2693
And We have made the heavens as a canopy well-guarded: Yet do\n\t\t\tthey turn away from the Signs which these things (point to)!\n\t\t\t2694
It is He Who created the Night and the Day and the sun and the\n\t\t\tmoon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along each in its rounded\n\t\t\tcourse. 2695
We granted not to any man before thee permanent life (here): if\n\t\t\tthen thou shouldst die would they live permanently? 2696
Every soul shall have a taste of death: and We test you by evil\n\t\t\tand by good by way of trial: to Us must ye return. 2697
When the Unbelievers see thee they treat thee not except with ridicule. "Is this" (they say) "the one who talks of your gods?" And they blaspheme at the mention of (Allah) Most Gracious! 2698
Man is a creature of haste: soon (enough) will I show you My\n\t\t\tSigns: then ye will not ask Me to hasten them! 2699
They say: "When will this promise come to pass if ye are telling\n\t\t\tthe truth?"
If only the Unbelievers knew (the time) when they will not be\n\t\t\table to ward off the Fire from their faces nor yet from their\n\t\t\tbacks and (when) no help can reach them! 2700
Nay it may come to them all of a sudden and confound them: no\n\t\t\tpower will they have then to avert it nor will they (then) get\n\t\t\trespite.
Mocked were (many) apostles before thee; but their scoffers were\n\t\t\themmed in by the thing that they mocked. 2701
Say "Who can keep you safe by night and by day from (the Wrath\n\t\t\tof) (Allah) Most Gracious?" Yet they turn away from the mention\n\t\t\tof their Lord. 2702
Or have they gods that can guard them from Us? They have no power\n\t\t\tto aid themselves nor can they be defended from Us. 2703

Nay We gave the good things of this life to these men and their fathers until the period grew long for them; see they not that we gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? Is it then they who will win? 2704 2705
Say "I do but warn you according to revelation": but the deaf\n\t\t\twill not hear the call (even) when they are warned! 2706
If but a breath of the Wrath of thy Lord do touch them they will\n\t\t\tthen say "Woe to us! we did wrong indeed!"

We shall set up scales of justice for the Day of Judgment so that not a soul will be dealt with unjustly in the least. And if there be (no more than) the weight of a mustard seed We will bring it (to account): and enough are We to take account. 2707 2708
In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the Criterion (for\n\t\t\tjudgment) and a Light and a Message for those who would do right\n\t\t\t2709
Those who fear their Lord in their most secret thoughts and who\n\t\t\thold the Hour (of Judgment) in awe. 2710
And this is a blessed Message which We have sent down: will ye\n\t\t\tthen reject it? 2711
We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct and\n\t\t\twell were We acquainted with him. 2712 2713
Behold! he said to his father and his people "What are these\n\t\t\timages to which ye are (so assiduously) devoted?" 2714
They said "We found our father worshipping them."
He said "Indeed ye have been in manifest error-ye and your\n\t\t\tfathers."
They said "Have you brought us the Truth or are you one of those\n\t\t\twho jest?" 2715
He said "Nay your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth\n\t\t\tHe Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this\n\t\t\t(truth). 2716
And by Allah I have a plan for your idols after ye go away and\n\t\t\tturn your backs"... 2717
So he broke them to pieces (all) but the biggest of them that\n\t\t\tthey might turn (and address themselves) to it. 2718
They said "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some\n\t\t\tman of impiety!"
They said "We heard a youth talk of them: he is called Abraham."\n\t\t\t2719
They said "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they\n\t\t\tmay bear witness:"
They said "Art thou the one that did this with our gods O\n\t\t\tAbraham?" 2720
He said: "Nay this was done by this is their is their biggest\n\t\t\tone! Ask them if they can speak intelligently!"
So they turned to themselves and said "Surely ye are the ones in\n\t\t\tthe wrong!" 2721
Then were they confounded with shame: (they said) "Thou knowest\n\t\t\tfull well that these (idols) do not speak!" 2722
(Abraham) said "Do ye then worship besides Allah things that can\n\t\t\tneither be of any good to you nor do you harm?
"Fie upon you and upon the things that ye worship besides Allah!\n\t\t\thave ye no sense?"... 2723
They said "Burn him and protect your gods if ye do (anything at\n\t\t\tall)!"
We said "O fire! be thou cool and (a means of)) safety for\n\t\t\tAbraham!" 2724 2725
Then they sought a stratagem against him: but We made them the\n\t\t\tones that lost most! 2726
But We delivered him and (his nephew) Lut (and directed them) to\n\t\t\tthe land which We have blessed for the nations. 2727
And We bestowed on him Isaac and as an additional gift (a\n\t\t\tgrandson) Jacob and We made righteous men of every one (of them).\n\t\t\t2728

And We made them leaders guiding (men) by Our Command and We sent them inspiration to do good deeds to establish regular prayers and to practice regular charity; and they constantly served Us (and Us only). 2729
And to Lut too we gave Judgment and Knowledge and We saved him\n\t\t\tfrom the town which practiced abominations: truly they were a\n\t\t\tpeople given to Evil a rebellious people. 2730
And We admitted him to Our Mercy: for he was one of the\n\t\t\tRighteous.
(Remember) Noah when he cried (to Us) aforetime: We listened to\n\t\t\this (prayer) and delivered him and his family from great\n\t\t\tdistress. 2731
We helped him against people who rejected Our Signs: truly they\n\t\t\twere a people given to Evil: so We drowned them (in the Flood)\n\t\t\tall together.
And remember David and Solomon when they gave judgment in the\n\t\t\tmatter of the field into which the sheep of certain people had\n\t\t\tstrayed by night: We did witness their judgment.

To Solomon We inspired the (right) understanding of the matter: to each (of them) We gave Judgment and Knowledge; it was Our power that made the hills and the birds celebrate Our praises with David: it was We Who did (these things). 2732 2733
It was We Who taught him the making of coats of mail for your\n\t\t\tbenefit to guard you from each others violence: will ye then be\n\t\t\tgrateful? 2734 2735
(It was Our power that made) the violent (unruly) wind flow\n\t\t\t(tamely) for Solomon to his order to the land which We had\n\t\t\tblessed: for We do know all things. 2736 2737
And of the evil ones were some who dived for him and did other\n\t\t\twork besides; and lit was We Who guarded them. 2738
And (remember) Job when he cried to his Lord "Truly distress has\n\t\t\tseized me but Thou art the Most Merciful of those that are\n\t\t\tmerciful." 2739

So We listened to him: We removed the distress that was on him and We restored his people to him and doubled their number as a Grace from Ourselves and a thing for commemoration for all who serve Us. 2740
And (remember) Ismail Idris and Zul-kifl all (men) of constancy\n\t\t\tand patience; 2741 2742 2743
We admitted them to Our Mercy: for they were of the Righteous\n\t\t\tones.

And remember Zun-nun when he departed in wrath: he imagined that We had no power over him! But he cried through the depths of darkness "There is no god but Thou: Glory to Thee: I was indeed wrong!" 2744
So We listened to him: and delivered him from distress: and thus\n\t\t\tdo We deliver those who have faith.
And (remember) Zakariya when he cried to his Lord: "O my Lord!\n\t\t\tleave me not without offspring though Thou art the best of\n\t\t\tinheritors. 2745 2746

So We listened to him: and We granted him Yahya: We cured his wife's (barrenness) for him. These three were ever quick in emulation in good works: they used to call on Us with love and reverence and humble themselves before Us. 2747
And (remember) her who guarded her chastity: We breathed into her\n\t\t\tof Our Spirit and We made her and her son a Sign for all peoples.\n\t\t\t2748
Verily this Brotherhood of yours is a single Brotherhood and I am\n\t\t\tyour Lord and Cherisher: therefore serve Me (and no other).\n\t\t\t2749
But (later generations) cut off their affair (of unity) one from\n\t\t\tanother: (yet) will they all return to Us. 2750
Whoever works any act of righteousness and has Faith his endeavor\n\t\t\twill not be rejected: We shall record it in his favor.\n\t\t\t2751
But there is a ban on any population which We have destroyed:\n\t\t\tthat they shall not return. 2752
Until the Gog and Magog (people) are let through (their barrier)\n\t\t\tand they swiftly swarm from every hill. 2753

Then will the True Promise draw nigh (of fulfillment): then behold! the eyes of the Unbelievers will fixedly stare in horror: "Ah! woe to us! we were indeed heedless of this; nay we truly did wrong!" 2754
Verily ye (Unbelievers) and the (false) gods that ye worship\n\t\t\tbesides Allah are (but) fuel for Hell! To it will ye (surely)\n\t\t\tcome!
If these had been gods they would not have got there! But each\n\t\t\tone will abide therein. 2755
There sobbing will be their lot nor will they there hear (aught\n\t\t\telse).
Those for whom the Good (Record) from Us has gone before will be\n\t\t\tremoved far therefrom. 2756
Not the slightest sound will they hear of Hell: what their souls\n\t\t\tdesired in that will they dwell.
