The Great Terror will bring them no grief: but the angels will\n\t\t\tmeet them (with mutual greetings): "This is your Day (the Day)\n\t\t\tthat ye were promised." 2757

The Day that we roll up the heavens like a scroll rolled up for books (completed) even as We produced the first Creation so shall We produce a new one: a promise We have undertaken: truly shall We fulfil it. 2758
Before this We wrote in the Psalms after the Message (given to\n\t\t\tMoses): My servants the righteous shall inherit the earth."\n\t\t\t2759 2760
Verily in the (Qur'an) is a Message for people who would (truly)\n\t\t\tworship Allah. 2761
We sent thee not but as a mercy for all creatures. 2762
Say: "What has come to me by inspiration is that your Allah is\n\t\t\tOne Allah: will ye therefore bow to His Will (in Islam)?"\n\t\t\t2763
But if they turn back say: "I have proclaimed the Message to you\n\t\t\tall alike and in truth; but I know not whether that which ye are\n\t\t\tpromised is near or far. 2764
"It is He Who knows what is open in speech and what ye hide (in\n\t\t\tyour hearts). 2765
"I know not but that it may be a trial for you and a grant of\n\t\t\t(worldly) livelihood (to you) for a time. 2766
Say: "O my Lord! judge Thou in truth!" "Our Lord Most Gracious is\n\t\t\tthe One Whose assistance should be sought against the blasphemies\n\t\t\tye utter!" 2767 2768 2769
O mankind! fear your Lord! For the convulsion of the Hour (of\n\t\t\tJudgment) will be a thing terrible! 2770

The Day ye shall see it every mother giving suck shall forget her suckling-babe and every pregnant female shall drop her load (unformed): thou shalt see mankind as in a drunken riot yet not drunk: but dreadful will be the Wrath of Allah. 2771
And yet among men there are such as dispute about Allah without\n\t\t\tknowledge and follow every evil one obstinate in rebellion!
About the (Evil One) it is decreed that whoever turns to him for\n\t\t\tfriendship him will he lead astray and he will guide him to the\n\t\t\tPenalty of the Fire. 2772

O mankind! if ye have a doubt about the Resurrection (consider) that We created you out of dust then out of sperm then out of a leech-like clot then out a morsel of flesh partly formed and partly unformed in order that We may manifest (Our Power) to you; and We cause whom We will to rest in the wombs for an appointed term then do We bring you out as babes then (foster you) that ye may reach your age of full strength; and some of you are called to die and some are sent back to the feeblest old age so that they know nothing after having known (much). And (further) thou seest the earth barren and lifeless but when We pour down rain on it it is stirred (to life) it swells and it puts forth every kind of beautiful growth (in pairs). 2773 2774 2775 2776 2777
This is so because Allah is the Reality: it is He Who gives life\n\t\t\tto the dead and it is He Who has power over all things.\n\t\t\t2778
And verily the Hour will come: there can be no doubt about it or\n\t\t\tabout (the fact) that Allah will raise up all who are in the\n\t\t\tgraves.
Yet there is among men such a one as disputes about Allah without\n\t\t\tknowledge without guidance and without a Book of Enlightenment\n\t\t\t2779

(Disdainfully) bending his side in order to (lead men) astray from the Path of Allah; for him there is disgrace in this life and on the Day of Judgment we shall make him taste the Penalty of burning (Fire). 2780
(It will be said): "This is because of the deeds which thy hands\n\t\t\tsent forth for verily Allah is not unjust to His servants.\n\t\t\t2781

There are among men some who serve Allah as it were on the verge: if good befalls them they are therewith well content; but if a trial comes to them they turn on their faces: they lose both this world and the Hereafter: that is loss for all to see! 2782
They call on such deities besides Allah as can neither hurt nor\n\t\t\tprofit them: that is straying far indeed (from the Way)!\n\t\t\t2783
(Perhaps) they call on one whose hurt is nearer than his profit:\n\t\t\tevil indeed is the patron and evil the companion (for help)!\n\t\t\t2784
Verily Allah will admit those who believe and work righteous\n\t\t\tdeeds to Gardens beneath which rivers flow: for Allah carries out\n\t\t\tall that He plans. 2785

If any think that Allah will not help him (His Apostle) in this world and the Hereafter let him stretch out a rope to the ceiling and cut (himself) off: then let him see whether his plan will remove that which enrages (him)! 2786
Thus have We sent down Clear Signs; and verily Allah doth guide\n\t\t\twhom He will! 2787

Those who believe (in the Qur'an) those who follow the Jewish (scriptures) and the Sabians Christians Magians and Polytheists Allah will judge between them on the Day of Judgment: for Allah is witness of all things. 2788 2789

Seest thou not that to Allah bow down in worship all things that are in the heavens and on earth the sun the moon the stars; the hills the trees the animals; and a great number among mankind? But a great number are (also) such as are fit for Punishment: and such as Allah shall disgrace none can rise to honor: for Allah carries out all that He wills. 2790 2791
These two antagonists dispute with each other about their Lord: but those who deny (their Lord) for them will be cut out a garment of Fire: over their heads will be poured out boiling water. 2792
With it will be scalded what is within their bodies as well as\n\t\t\t(their) skins. 2793
In addition there will be maces of iron (to punish) them.\n\t\t\t2794
Every time they wish to get away therefrom from anguish they will\n\t\t\tbe forced back therein and (it will be said) "Taste ye the\n\t\t\tPenalty of Burning!"

Allah will admit those who believe and work righteous deeds to Gardens beneath which rivers flow: they shall be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls; and their garments there will be of silk. 2795
For they have been guided (in this life) to the purest of\n\t\t\tspeeches; they have been guided to the Path of Him Who is worthy\n\t\t\tof (all) praise.

As to those who have rejected (Allah) and would keep back (men) from the Way of Allah and from the Sacred Mosque which We have made (open) to (all) men equal is the dweller there and the visitor from the country and any whose purpose therein is profanity or wrong-doing them will We cause to taste of a most grievous Penalty. 2796

Behold! We gave the site to Abraham of the (Sacred) House (saying): "Associate not any thing (in worship) with Me; and sanctify My House for those who compass it round or stand up or bow or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer). 2797 2798
"And proclaim the Pilgrimage among men: they will come to thee on foot and (mounted) on every kind of camel lean on account of journeys through deep and distant mountain highways; 2799

"That they may witness the benefits (provided) for them and celebrate the name of Allah through the Days appointed over the cattle which He has provided for them (for sacrifice): then eat ye thereof and feed the distressed ones in want. 2800 2801 2802
"Then let them complete the rites prescribed for them perform\n\t\t\ttheir vows and (again) circumambulate the Ancient House."\n\t\t\t2803 2804

Such (is the Pilgrimage): whoever honors the sacred rites of Allah for him it is good in the sight of his Lord. Lawful to you (for food in pilgrimage) are cattle except those mentioned to you (as exceptions): but shun the abomination of idols and shun the word that is false 2805

Being true in faith to Allah and never assigning partners to Him: if anyone assigns partners to Allah he is as if he had fallen from heaven and been snatched up by birds or the wind had swooped (like a bird on its prey) and thrown him into a far-distant place. 2806
Such (is his state): and whoever holds in honor the Symbols of\n\t\t\tAllah (in the sacrifice of animals) such (honor) should come\n\t\t\ttruly from piety of heart. 2807
In them ye have benefits for a term appointed: in the end their\n\t\t\tplace of sacrifice is near the Ancient House. 2808\n\t\t\t2809

To every people did We appoint rites (of sacrifice) that they might celebrate the name of Allah over the sustenance He gave them from animals (fit for food) but your Allah is one Allah: submit then your wills to Him (in Islam) and give thou the Good News to those who humble themselves 2810 2811

To those whose hearts when Allah is mentioned are filled with fear who show patient perseverance over their afflictions keep up regular prayer and spend (in charity) out of what we have bestowed upon them. 2812

The sacrificial camels we have made for you as among the Symbols from Allah: in them is (much) good for you: then pronounce the name of Allah over them as they line up (for sacrifice): when they are down on their sides (after slaughter) eat ye thereof and feed such as (beg not but) live in contentment and such as beg with due humility: thus have we made animals subject to you that ye may be grateful. 2813 2814

It is not their meat nor their blood that reaches Allah: it is your piety that reaches Him: He has thus made them subject to you that ye may glorify Allah for His guidance to you: and proclaim the Good News to all who do right. 2815
Verily Allah will defend (from ill) those who believe: verily\n\t\t\tAllah loveth not any that is a traitor to faith or shows\n\t\t\tingratitude.
To those against whom war is made permission is given (to fight)\n\t\t\tbecause they are wronged and verily Allah is Most powerful for\n\t\t\ttheir aid 2816

(They are) those who have been expelled from their homes in defiance of right (for no cause) except that they say "Our Lord is Allah." Did not Allah check one set of people by means of another there would surely have been pulled down monasteries churches synagogues and mosques in which the name of Allah is commemorated in abundant measure. Allah will certainly aid those who aid His (cause); for verily Allah is Full of Strength Exalted in Might (Able to enforce His Will). 2817 2818

(They are) those who if We establish them in the land establish regular prayer and give regular charity enjoin the right and forbid wrong: with Allah rests the end (and decision) of (all) affairs. 2819
If they treat thy (mission) as false so did the Peoples before\n\t\t\tthem (with their prophets) the People of Noah and `Ad and Thamud;\n\t\t\t2820
Those of Abraham and Lut;

And the Companions of the Madyan people: and Moses was rejected (in the same way). But I granted respite to the Unbelievers and (only) after that did I punish them: but how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)! 2821 2822
How many populations have We destroyed which were given to wrong-doing! They tumbled down on their roofs. And how many wells are lying idle and neglected and castles lofty and well-built! 2823 2824

Do they not travel through the land so that their hearts (and mind) may thus learn wisdom and their ears may thus learn to hear? Truly it is not their eyes that are blind but their hearts which are in their breasts. 2825
Yet they ask thee to hasten on the Punishment! But Allah will not\n\t\t\tfail in His promise. Verily a day in the sight of thy Lord is\n\t\t\tlike a thousand years of your reckoning. 2826
And to how many populations did I give respite which were given\n\t\t\tto wrong-doing? In the end I punished them. To Me is the\n\t\t\tdestination (of all). 2827
Say: "O men! I am (sent) to you only to give a clear warning:\n\t\t\t2828
"Those who believe and work righteousness for them is forgiveness\n\t\t\tand a sustenance most generous. 2829
"But those who strive against Our Signs to frustrate them they\n\t\t\twill be Companions of the Fire." 2830

Never did We send an apostle or a prophet before thee but when he framed a desire Satan threw some (vanity) into his desire: but Allah will cancel anything (vain) that Satan throws in and Allah will confirm (and establish) His Signs: for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom: 2831 2832

That He may make the suggestions thrown in by Satan but a trial for those in whose hearts is a disease and who are hardened of heart: verily the wrongdoers are in a schism far (from the Truth): 2833 2834

And that those on whom knowledge has been bestowed may learn that the (Qur'an) is the Truth from thy Lord and that they may believe therein and their hearts may be made humbly (open) to it: for verily Allah is the Guide of those who believe to the Straight Way. 2835
Those who reject Faith will not cease to be in doubt concerning (Revelation) until the Hour (of Judgment) comes suddenly upon them or there comes to them the Penalty of a Day of Disaster. 2836
On that Day the Dominion will be that of Allah: He will judge\n\t\t\tbetween them: so those who believe and work righteous deeds will\n\t\t\tbe in Gardens of Delight. 2837
And for those who reject Faith and deny Our Signs there will be a\n\t\t\thumiliating Punishment.
Those who leave their homes in the cause of Allah and are then\n\t\t\tslain or die on them will Allah bestow verily a goodly Provision:\n\t\t\ttruly Allah is He Who bestows the best Provision. 2838
Verily He will admit them to a place with which they shall be\n\t\t\twell pleased: for Allah is All-Knowing Most Forbearing.\n\t\t\t2839

That (is so). And if one has retaliated to no greater extent than the injury he received and is again set upon inordinately Allah will help him: for Allah is One that blots out (sins) and forgives (again and again). 2840
That is because Allah merges Night into Day and He merges Day\n\t\t\tinto Night and verily it is Allah Who hears and sees (all\n\t\t\tthings). 2841
That is because Allah He is the Reality: and those besides Him\n\t\t\twhom they invoke they are but vain Falsehood: verily Allah is He\n\t\t\tMost High Most Great. 2842 2843

Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky and forthwith the earth becomes clothed with green? For Allah is He Who understands the finest mysteries and is well-acquainted (with them). 2844
To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: for\n\t\t\tverily Allah He is Free of all wants Worthy of all praise.\n\t\t\t2845

Seest thou not that Allah has made subject to you (men) all that is on the earth and the ships that sail through the sea by His command? He withholds the sky (rain) from falling on the earth except by His leave: for Allah is Most Kind and Most Merciful to man. 2846 2847
It is He Who gave you life will cause you to die and will again\n\t\t\tgive you life: truly man is a most ungrateful creature!

To every People have we appointed rites and ceremonies which they must follow let them not then dispute with thee on the matter but do thou invite (them) to thy Lord: for thou art assuredly on the Right Way. 2848
If they do wrangle with thee say "Allah knows best what it is ye\n\t\t\tare doing." 2849
"Allah will judge between you on the Day of Judgment concerning\n\t\t\tthe matters in which ye differ." 2850
Knowest thou not that Allah knows all that is in heaven and on\n\t\t\tearth? Indeed it is all in a record and that is easy for Allah.\n\t\t\t2851
Yet they worship besides Allah things for which no authority has been sent down to them and of which they have (really) no knowledge: for those that do wrong there is no helper. 2852

When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them thou wilt notice a denial on the faces of the Unbelievers! They nearly attack with violence those who rehearse Our Signs to them. Say "Shall I tell you of something (far) worse than these Signs? It is the fire (of Hell)! Allah has promised it to the Unbelievers! And evil is that destination!" 2853 2854

O men! Here is a parable set forth! Listen to it! Those on whom besides Allah ye call cannot create (even) a fly if they all met together for the purpose! And if the fly should snatch away anything from them they would have no power to release it from the fly: feeble are those who petition and those whom they petition! 2855
No just estimate have they made of Allah: for Allah is He Who is\n\t\t\tstrong and able to carry out His Will. 2856
Allah chooses Messengers from angels and from men: for Allah is\n\t\t\tHe Who hears and sees (all things). 2857 2858
He knows what is before them and what is behind them: and to\n\t\t\tAllah go back all questions (for decision). 2859
O ye who believe! bow down prostrate yourselves and adore your\n\t\t\tLord; and do good; that ye may prosper. 2860

And strive in His cause as ye ought to strive (with sincerity and under discipline): He has chosen you and has imposed no difficulties on you in religion; it is the cult of your father Abraham. It is He Who has named you Muslims both before and in this (Revelation); that the Apostle may be a witness for you and ye be witnesses for mankind! So establish regular Prayer give regular Charity and hold fast to Allah! He is your Protector the Best to protect and the Best to help! 2861 2862 2863 2864
The Believers must (eventually) win through 2865
Those who humble themselves in their prayers; 2866
Who avoid vain talk;
Who are active in deeds of charity;
Who abstain from sex 2867
Except with those joined to them in the marriage bond or (the\n\t\t\tcaptives) whom their right hands possess for (in their case) they\n\t\t\tare free from blame 2868
But those whose desires exceed those limits are transgressors
Those who faithfully observe their trust and their covenants;\n\t\t\t2869
And who (strictly) guard their prayers 2870
Those will be the heirs 2871
Who will inherit Paradise: they will dwell therein (forever).
Man We did create from a quintessence (of clay); 2872
Then We placed him as (a drop of) sperm in a place of rest firmly\n\t\t\tfixed; 2873

Then We made the sperm into a clot of congealed blood; then of that clot We made a (foetus) lump; then We made out of that lump bones and clothed the bones with flesh; then We developed out of it another creature: so blessed be Allah the Best to create! 2874
After that at length ye will die. 2875
Again on the Day of Judgment will ye be raised up.
And We have made above you seven tracts; and We are never\n\t\t\tunmindful of (Our) Creation. 2876 2877
And We send down water from the sky according to (due) measure\n\t\t\tand We cause it to soak in the soil; and We certainly are able to\n\t\t\tdrain it off (with ease). 2878
With it We grow for you gardens of date-palms and vines: in them\n\t\t\thave ye abundant fruits: and of them ye eat (and have enjoyment)\n\t\t\t2879
Also a tree springing out of Mount Sinai which produces oil and\n\t\t\trelish for those who use it for food. 2880

And in cattle (too) ye have an instructive example: from within their bodies We produce (milk) for you to drink; there are in them (besides) numerous (other) benefits for you; and of their (meat) ye eat; 2881
And on them as well as in ships ye ride.
(Further We sent a long line of prophets for your instruction.) We sent Noah to his people: he said "O my people! worship Allah! Ye have no other god but Him: will ye not fear (Him)?" 2882 2883 2884

The chiefs of the Unbelievers among his people said: "He is no more than a man like yourselves: his wish is to assert his superiority over you: if Allah had wished (to send messengers) He could have sent down angels: never did we hear such a thing (as he says) among our ancestors of old." 2885
(And some said:) "He is only a man possessed: wait (and have\n\t\t\tpatience) with him for a time." 2886
(Noah) said: "O my Lord! help me: for that they accuse me of\n\t\t\tfalsehood!"

So We inspired him (with this message): "Construct the Ark within Our sight and under Our guidance: then when comes Our command and the fountains of the earth gush forth take thou on board pairs of every species male and female and thy family except those of them against whom the Word has already gone forth: and address Me not in favor of the wrongdoers; for they shall be drowned (in the Flood). 2887 2888 2889 2890
And when thou hast embarked on the Ark thou and those with thee \n\t\t\tsay: "Praise be to Allah Who has saved us from the people who do\n\t\t\twrong." 2891
And say: "O my Lord! enable me to disembark with Thy blessing:\n\t\t\tfor Thou art the Best to enable (us) to disembark." 2892
Verily in this there are Signs (for men to understand); (thus) do\n\t\t\tWe try (men). 2893
Then We raised after them another generation;
And We sent to them an apostle from among themselves (saying)\n\t\t\t"Worship Allah! ye have no other god but Him. Will ye not fear\n\t\t\t(Him)?" 2894

And the chiefs of his people who disbelieved and denied the
			Meeting in the Hereafter and on whom We had bestowed the good
			things of this life said: "He is no more than a man like
			yourselves; he eats of that of which ye eat and drinks of what ye
			drink.
"If ye obey a man like yourselves behold it is certain ye will be\n\t\t\tlost. 2895
"Does he promise that when ye die and become dust and bones ye\n\t\t\tshall be brought forth (again)?
"Far very far is that which ye are promised!
"There is nothing but our life in this world! We shall die and we\n\t\t\tlive! But we shall never be raised up again! 2896
"He is only a man who invents a lie against Allah but we are not\n\t\t\tthe ones to believe in him!" 2897
(The prophet) said: "O my Lord! help me: for that they accuse me\n\t\t\tof falsehood." 2898
(Allah) said: "In but a little while they are sure to be sorry!"\n\t\t\t2899
Then the Blast overtook them with justice and We made them as\n\t\t\trubbish of dead leaves (floating on the stream of Time)! So away\n\t\t\twith the people who do wrong! 2900 2901
Then We raised after them other generations.
No people can hasten their term nor can they delay (it).

Then sent We Our apostles in succession: every time there came to a people their apostle they accused him of falsehood: so We made them follow each other (in punishment): We made them as a tale (that is told): so away with a people that will not believe! 2902
Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our Signs and\n\t\t\tauthority manifest 2903
To Pharaoh and his Chiefs: but these behaved insolently: they\n\t\t\twere arrogant people.
They said: "Shall we believe in two men like ourselves? And their\n\t\t\tpeople are subject to us!" 2904
So they accused them of falsehood and they became of those who\n\t\t\twere destroyed.
And We gave Moses the Book in order that they might receive\n\t\t\tguidance. 2905
And We made the son of Mary and his mother as a Sign: We gave\n\t\t\tthem both shelter on high ground affording rest and security and\n\t\t\tfurnished with springs. 2906 2907
O ye apostles! enjoy (all) things good and pure and work\n\t\t\trighteousness: for I am well-acquainted with (all) that ye do.\n\t\t\t2908
And verily this Brotherhood of yours is a single Brotherhood and\n\t\t\tI am your Lord and Cherisher: therefore fear Me (and no other).\n\t\t\t2909
But people have cut off their affair (of unity) between them into\n\t\t\tsects: each party rejoices in that which is with itself.\n\t\t\t2910
But leave them in their confused ignorance for a time.
Do they think that because We have granted them abundance of\n\t\t\twealth and sons
We would hasten them on in every good? Nay they do not\n\t\t\tunderstand. 2911
Verily those who live in awe for fear of their Lord;
Those who believe in the Signs of their Lord;
Those who join not (in worship) partners with their Lord;
And those who dispense their charity with their hearts full of\n\t\t\tfear because they will return to their Lord 2912
It is these who hasten in every good work and these who are\n\t\t\tforemost in them.
On no soul do We place a burden greater than it can bear: before\n\t\t\tUs is a record which clearly shows the truth: they will never be\n\t\t\twronged. 2913 2914
But their hearts are in confused ignorance of this; and there are\n\t\t\tbesides that deeds of theirs which they will (continue) to do\n\t\t\t2915 2916
Until when We seize in Punishment those of them who received the\n\t\t\tgood things of this world behold they will groan in supplication!
It will be said: "Groan not in supplication this day; for ye\n\t\t\tshall certainly not be helped by Us.
"My Signs used to be rehearsed to you but ye used to turn back on\n\t\t\tyour heels
"In arrogance: talking nonsense about the (Qur'an) like one\n\t\t\ttelling fables by night." 2917
Do they not ponder over the Word (of Allah) or has anything (new)\n\t\t\tcome to them that did not come to their fathers of old?\n\t\t\t2918
Or do they not recognize their Apostle that they deny him?
Or do they say "He is possessed"? Nay he has brought them the\n\t\t\tTruth but most of them hate the Truth.

If the Truth had been in accord with their desires truly the heavens and the earth and all beings therein would have been in confusion and corruption! Nay We have sent them their admonition but they turn away from their admonition. 2919
Or is it that thou askest them for some recompense? But the\n\t\t\trecompense of thy Lord is best: He is the Best of those who give\n\t\t\tsustenance. 2920
But verily thou callest them to the Straight Way;
And verily those who believe not in the Hereafter are deviating\n\t\t\tfrom that Way.
If We had mercy on them and removed the distress which is on them\n\t\t\tthey would obstinately persist in their transgression wandering\n\t\t\tin distraction to and fro. 2921
We inflicted Punishment on them but they humbled not themselves\n\t\t\tto their Lord nor do they submissively entreat (Him)!\n\t\t\t2922
Until We open on them a gate leading to a severe Punishment: then\n\t\t\tLo! they will be plunged in despair therein! 2923
It is He Who has created for you (the faculties of) hearing sight \n\t\t\tfeeling and understanding little thanks it is ye give! \n\t\t\t2924
And He has multiplied you through the earth and to Him shall ye\n\t\t\tbe gathered back.
It is He Who gives life and death and to Him (is due) the\n\t\t\talternation of Night and Day: will ye not then understand?\n\t\t\t2925
On the contrary they say things similar to what the ancients\n\t\t\tsaid. 2926
They say: "What! when we die and become dust and bones could we\n\t\t\treally be raised up again?
"Such things have been promised to us and to our fathers before!\n\t\t\tThey are nothing but tales of the ancients!"
Say: "To whom belong the earth and all beings therein? (Say) if\n\t\t\tye know!"
They will say "To Allah!" Say: "Yet will ye not receive\n\t\t\tadmonition?" 2927
Say: "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the\n\t\t\tThrone (of Glory) Supreme?" 2928
They will say "(They belong) to Allah." Say: "Will ye not then be\n\t\t\tfilled with awe?" 2929
Say: "Who is it in whose hands is the governance of all things\n\t\t\twho protects (all) but is not protected (of any)? (Say) if ye\n\t\t\tknow."
They will say "(It belongs) to Allah." Say: "Then how are ye\n\t\t\tdeluded?" 2930
We have sent them the Truth: but they indeed practice Falsehood!

No son did Allah beget nor is there any god along with Him: (if there were many gods) behold each god would have taken away what he had created and some would have lorded it over others! Glory to Allah (He is free) from the (sort of) things they attribute to Him! 2931
He knows what is hidden and what is open: too high is He for the\n\t\t\tpartners they attribute to Him! 2932
Say: "O my Lord! if Thou wilt show me (in my lifetime) that which\n\t\t\tthey are warned against 2933
"Then O my Lord! put me not amongst the people who do wrong!"
And We are certainly able to show thee (in fulfillment) that\n\t\t\tagainst which they are warned.
Repel evil with that which is best: We are well-acquainted with\n\t\t\tthe things they say. 2934
And say: "O my Lord! I seek refuge with Thee from the suggestions\n\t\t\tof the Evil Ones; 2935
"And I seek refuge with Thee O my Lord! lest they should come\n\t\t\tnear me."
(In Falsehood will they be) until when death comes to one of them\n\t\t\the says: "O my Lord! send me back (to life) 2936\n\t\t\t2937
"In order that I may work righteousness in the things I neglected." "By no means! it is but a word he says before them is a Partition till the Day they are raised up. 2938 2939 2940
Then when the Trumpet is blown there will be no more\n\t\t\trelationships between them that day nor will one ask after\n\t\t\tanother! 2941
Then those whose balance (of good deeds) is heavy they will\n\t\t\tattain salvation: 2942
But those whose balance is light will be those who have lost\n\t\t\ttheir souls; in Hell will they abide. 2943
The Fire will burn their faces and they will therein grin with\n\t\t\ttheir lips displaced. 2944
"Were not My Signs rehearsed to you and ye did but treat them as\n\t\t\tfalsehoods?"
They will say: "Our Lord! our misfortune overwhelmed us and we\n\t\t\tbecame a people astray! 2945
"Our Lord! bring us out of this: if ever we return (to evil) then\n\t\t\tshall we be wrongdoers indeed!"
He will say: "Be ye driven into it (with ignominy)! and speak ye\n\t\t\tnot to Me! 2946
"A part of My servants there was who used to pray `Our Lord! we\n\t\t\tbelieve; then do Thou forgive us and have mercy upon us: for Thou\n\t\t\tart the best of those Who show mercy!'
"But ye treated them with ridicule so much so that (ridicule of)\n\t\t\tthem made you forget My Message while ye were laughing at them!\n\t\t\t2947
"I have rewarded them this day for their patience and constancy:\n\t\t\tthey are indeed the ones that have achieved Bliss..."
He will say: "What number of years did ye stay on earth?"\n\t\t\t2948
They will say: "We stayed a day or part of a day: but ask those\n\t\t\twho keep account." 2949
He will say: "Ye stayed not but a little if ye had only known!
"Did ye then think that We had created you in jest and that ye\n\t\t\twould not be brought back to Us (for account)?" 2950
Therefore exalted be Allah the King the Reality; there is no god\n\t\t\tbut He the Lord of the Throne of Honor!
If anyone invokes besides Allah any other god he has no authority therefor; and his reckoning will be only with his Lord! And verily the Unbelievers will fail to win through! 2951 2952
So say: "O my Lord! grant thou forgiveness and mercy! for Thou\n\t\t\tart the Best of those who show mercy!"
A Surah which We have sent down and which We have ordained: in it\n\t\t\thave We sent down Clear Signs in order that ye may receive\n\t\t\tadmonition. 2953

The woman and the man guilty of adultery or fornication flog each of them with a hundred stripes: let not compassion move you in their case in a matter prescribed by Allah if ye believe in Allah and the Last Day: and let a party of the Believers witness their punishment. 2954 2955 2956

Let no man guilty of adultery or fornication marry any but a woman similarly guilty or an Unbeliever nor let any but such a man or an Unbeliever marry such a woman: to the Believers such a thing is forbidden. 2957

And those who launch a charge against chaste women and produce not four witnesses (to support their allegation) flog them with eighty stripes: and reject their evidence ever after: for such men are wicked transgressors 2958
Unless they repent thereafter and mend (their conduct): for Allah\n\t\t\tis Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. 2959

And for those who launch a charge against their spouses and have (in support) no evidence but their own their solitary evidence (can be received) if they bear witness four times (with an oath) by Allah that they are solemnly telling the truth; 2960
And the fifth (oath) (should be) that they solemnly invoke the\n\t\t\tcurse of Allah on themselves if they tell a lie.
But it would avert the punishment from the wife if she bears\n\t\t\twitness four times (with an oath) by Allah that (her husband) is\n\t\t\ttelling a lie;
And the fifth (oath) should be that she solemnly invokes the\n\t\t\twrath of Allah on herself if (her accuser) is telling the truth.
If it were not for Allah's grace and mercy on you and that Allah\n\t\t\tis Oft-Returning Full of Wisdom (ye would be ruined indeed).\n\t\t\t2961

Those who brought forward the lie are a body among yourselves: think it not to be an evil to you: on the contrary it is good for you: to every man among them (will come the punishment) of the sin that he earned and to him who took on himself the lead among them will be a Penalty grievous. 2962 2963 2964
Why did not Believers men and women when ye heard of the affair \n\t\t\tput the best construction on it in their own minds and say "This\n\t\t\t(charge) is an obvious lie"? 2965
Why did they not bring four witnesses to prove it? When they have\n\t\t\tnot brought the witnesses such men in the sight of Allah (stand\n\t\t\tforth) themselves as liars! 2966
Were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah on you in this world\n\t\t\tand the Hereafter a grievous penalty would have seized you in\n\t\t\tthat ye rushed glibly into this affair. 2967
Behold ye received it on your tongues and said out of your mouths things of which ye had no knowledge; and ye thought it to be a light matter while it was most serious in the sight of Allah. 2968
And why did ye not when ye heard it say "It is not right of us to\n\t\t\tspeak of this: Glory to Allah! this is a most serious slander!"\n\t\t\t2969
Allah doth admonish you that ye may never repeat such (conduct)\n\t\t\tif ye are (true) Believers.
And Allah makes the Signs plain to you: for Allah is full of\n\t\t\tknowledge and wisdom.
Those who love (to see) scandal published broadcast among the\n\t\t\tBelievers will have a grievous Penalty in this life and in the\n\t\t\tHereafter: Allah knows and ye know not. 2970
Were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah on you and that\n\t\t\tAllah is full of kindness and mercy (ye would be ruined indeed).\n\t\t\t2971

O ye who believe! follow not Satan's footsteps: if any will follow the footsteps of Satan he will (but) command what is shameful and wrong: and were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah on you not one of you would ever have been pure: but Allah doth purify whom He pleases: and Allah is One Who hears and knows (all things). 2972 2973

Let not those among you who are endued with grace and amplitude of means resolve by oath against helping their kinsmen those in want and those who have left their homes in Allah's cause: let them forgive and overlook: do you not wish that Allah should forgive you? For Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. 2974
Those who slander chaste women indiscreet but believing are\n\t\t\tcursed in this life and in the Hereafter: for them is a grievous\n\t\t\tPenalty 2975
On the Day when their tongues their hands and their feet will\n\t\t\tbear witness against them as to their actions. 2976
On that Day Allah will pay them back (all) their just dues and\n\t\t\tthey will realize that Allah is the (very) Truth that makes all\n\t\t\tthings manifest. 2977

Women impure are for men impure and men impure are for women impure; and women of purity are for men of purity and men of purity are for women of purity: these are not affected by what people say: for them there is forgiveness and a provision honorable. 2978 2979
O ye who believe! enter not houses other than your own until ye\n\t\t\thave asked permission and saluted those in them: that is best for\n\t\t\tyou in order that ye may heed (what is seemly). 2980
If ye find no one in the house enter not until permission is given to you: if ye are asked to go back go back: that makes for greater purity for yourselves: and Allah knows well all that ye do. 2981
It is no fault on your part to enter houses not used for living\n\t\t\tin which serve some (other) use for you: and Allah has knowledge\n\t\t\tof what ye reveal and what ye conceal. 2982
Say to the believing men that they should lower their gaze and\n\t\t\tguard their modesty: that will make for greater purity for them:\n\t\t\tand Allah is well acquainted with all that they do. 2983

And say to the believing women that they should lower their gaze and guard their modesty; that they should not display their beauty and ornaments except what (must ordinarily) appear thereof; that they should draw their veils over their bosoms and not display their beauty except to their husbands their fathers their husbands' fathers their sons their husbands' sons their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women or the slaves whom their right hands possess or male servants free of physical needs or small children who have no sense of the shame of sex; and that they should not strike their feet in order to draw attention to their hidden ornaments. And O ye Believers! turn ye all together towards Allah that ye may attain Bliss. 2984 2985 2986 2987

Marry those among you who are single or the virtuous ones among your slaves male or female: if they are in poverty Allah will give them means out of His grace: for Allah encompasseth all and He knoweth all things. 2988 2989

Let those who find not the wherewithal for marriage keep themselves chaste until Allah gives them means out of His grace. And if any of your slaves ask for a deed in writing (to enable them to earn their freedom for a certain sum) give them such a deed if ye know any good in them; yea give them something yourselves out of the means which Allah has given to you. But force not your maids to prostitution when they desire chastity in order that ye may make a gain in the goods of this life. But if anyone compels them yet after such compulsion is Allah Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful (to them). 2990 2991 2992 2993 2994
We have already sent down to you verses making things clear an\n\t\t\tillustration from (the story of) people who passed away before\n\t\t\tyou and an admonition for those who fear (Allah). 2995

Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The parable of His Light is as if there were a Niche and within it a lamp: the Lamp enclosed in Glass: the glass as it were a brilliant star: lit from a blessed Tree an Olive neither of the East nor of the West whose Oil is well-nigh luminous though fire scarce touched it: Light upon Light! Allah doth guide whom He will to His Light. Allah doth set forth Parables for men: and Allah doth know all things. 2996 2997 2998 2999 3000 3001 3002 3003

(Lit is such a light) in houses which Allah hath permitted to be raised to honor; for the celebration in them of His name: in them is He glorified in the mornings and in the evenings (again and again) 3004 3005 3006

By men whom neither traffic nor merchandise can divert from the Remembrance of Allah nor from regular Prayer nor from the practice of regular Charity: their (only) fear is for the Day when hearts and eyes will be transformed (in a world wholly new) 3007 3008
That Allah may reward them according to the best of their deeds\n\t\t\tand add even more for them out of His Grace: for Allah doth\n\t\t\tprovide for those whom He will without measure. 3009

But the Unbelievers their deeds are like a mirage in sandy deserts which the man parched with thirst mistakes for water; until when he comes up to it he finds it to be nothing: but he finds Allah (ever) with him and Allah will pay him his account: and Allah is swift in taking account. 3010 3011 3012

Or (the Unbelievers' state) is like the depths of darkness in a vast deep ocean overwhelmed with billow topped by billow topped by (dark) clouds: depths of darkness one above another: if a man stretches out his hand he can hardly see it! for any to whom Allah giveth not light there is no light! 3013 3014 3015

Seest thou not that it is Allah Whose praises all beings in the heavens and on earth do celebrate and the birds (of the air) with wings outspread? Each one knows its own (mode of) prayer and praise. And Allah knows well all that they do. 3016 3017
Yea to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth;\n\t\t\tand to Allah is the final goal (of all). 3018

Seest thou not that Allah makes the clouds move gently then joins them together then makes them into a heap? then wilt thou see rain issue forth from their midst. And He sends down from the sky mountain masses (of clouds) wherein is hail: He strikes therewith whom He pleases and He turns it away fro whom He pleases. The vivid flash of His lightning well-nigh blinds the sight. 3019
It is Allah Who alternates the Night and the Day: verily in these\n\t\t\tthings is an instructive example for those who have vision!\n\t\t\t3020

And Allah has created every animal from water: of them there are some that creep on their bellies; some that walk on two legs; and some that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills: for verily Allah has power over all things. 3021 3022 3023
We have indeed sent down Signs that make things manifest: and\n\t\t\tAllah guides whom He wills to a way that is straight.
They say "We believe in Allah and in the Apostle and we obey":\n\t\t\tbut even after that some of them turn away: they are not (really)\n\t\t\tBelievers. 3024
When they are summoned to Allah and His Apostle in order that He\n\t\t\tmay judge between them behold some of them decline (to come).
But if the right is on their side they come to him with all\n\t\t\tsubmission. 3025
Is it that there is a disease in their hearts? Or do they doubt\n\t\t\tor are they in fear that Allah and His Apostle will deal unjustly\n\t\t\twith them? Nay it is they themselves who do wrong. 3026

The answer of the Believers when summoned to Allah and His Apostle in order that He may judge between them is no other than this: they say "We hear and we obey": it is such as these that will attain felicity. 3027 3028
It is such as obey Allah and His Apostle and fear Allah and do\n\t\t\tright that will win (in the end).

They swear their strongest oaths by Allah that if only thou wouldst command them they would leave (their homes). Say: "Swear ye not; obedience is (more) reasonable: verily Allah is well-acquainted with all that ye do." 3029

Say: "Obey Allah and obey the Apostle: but if ye turn away he is only responsible for the duty placed on him and ye for that placed on you. If ye obey him ye shall be on right guidance. The Apostle's duty is only to preach the clear (Message)." 3030

Allah has promised to those among you who believe and work righteous deeds that He will of a surety grant them in the land inheritance (of power) as He granted it to those before them; that He will establish in authority their religion the one which He has chosen for them; and that He will change (their state) after the fear in which they (lived) to one of security and peace: `They will worship Me (alone) and not associate aught with Me.' If any do reject faith after this they are rebellious and wicked. 3031 3032
So establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity: and obey\n\t\t\tthe Apostle; that ye may receive mercy.
Never think thou that the Unbelievers are going to frustrate\n\t\t\t(Allah's Plan) on earth: their abode is the Fire and it is indeed\n\t\t\tan evil refuge!

O ye who believe! let those whom your right hands possess and the (children) among you who have not come of age ask your permission (before they come to your presence) on three occasions before morning prayer; the while ye doff your clothes for the noonday heat; and after the late-night prayer: these are your three times of undress: outside those times it is not wrong for you or for them to move about attending to each other: thus does Allah make clear the Signs to you: for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom. 3033 3034 3035 3036

But when the children among you come of age let them (also) ask for permission as do those senior to them (in age): thus does Allah make clear His Signs to you: for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom. 3037 3038 3039

Such elderly women as are past the prospect of marriage there is no blame on them if they lay aside their (outer) garments provided they make not a wanton display of their beauty: but it is best for them to be modest: and Allah is One Who sees and knows all things. 3040 3041

it is no fault in the blind nor in one born lame nor in one afflicted with illness nor in yourselves that ye should eat in your own houses or those of your fathers or your mothers or your brothers or your sisters or your father's brothers or your father's sisters or your mother's brothers or your mother's sisters or in houses of which the keys are in your possession or in the house of a sincere friend of yours: there is no blame on you whether ye eat in company or separately. But if ye enter houses salute each other a greeting or blessing and purity as from Allah. Thus does Allah make clear the Signs to you: that ye may understand. 3042 3043 3044

Only those are Believers who believe in Allah and His Apostle: when they are with him on a matter requiring collective action they do not depart until they have asked for his leave: those who ask for thy leave are those who believe in Allah and His Apostle; so when they ask for thy leave for some business of theirs give leave to those of them whom thou wilt and ask Allah for their forgiveness: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. 3045 3046 3047

Deem not the summons of the Apostle among yourselves like the summons of one of you to another: Allah doth know those of you who slip away under shelter of some excuse: then let those beware who withstand the Apostle's order lest some trial befall them or a grievous Penalty be inflicted on them. 3048 3049

Be quite sure that to Allah doth belong whatever is in the heavens and on earth. Well doth He know what ye are intent upon: and one day they will be brought back to Him and He will tell them the truth of what they did: for Allah doth know all things. 3050 3051
Blessed is He Who sent down the Criterion to His servant that it\n\t\t\tmay be an admonition to all creatures 3052 3053\n\t\t\t3054
He to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: no son has He begotten nor has He a partner in His dominion: it is He Who created all things and ordered them in due proportions. 3055
Yet have they taken besides Him gods that can create nothing but are themselves created; that have no control of hurt or good to themselves; nor can they control Death nor Life nor Resurrection. 3056
But the Misbelievers say: "Naught is this but a lie which he has\n\t\t\tforged and others have helped him at it." In truth it is they who\n\t\t\thave put forward an iniquity and a falsehood. 3057
And they say: "Tales of the ancients which he has caused to be\n\t\t\twritten: and they are dictated before him morning and evening."\n\t\t\t3058
Say: "The (Qur'an) was sent down by Him Who knows the Mystery\n\t\t\t(that is) in the heavens and the earth: verily He is\n\t\t\tOft-Forgiving Most Merciful." 3059
And they say: "What sort of an apostle is this who eats food and\n\t\t\twalks through the streets? Why has not an angel been sent down to\n\t\t\thim to give admonition with him? 3060
"Or (why) has not a treasure been bestowed on him or why has he\n\t\t\t(not) a garden for enjoyment?" The wicked say: "Ye follow none\n\t\t\tother than a man bewitched." 3061 3062
See what kinds of companions they make for thee! But they have\n\t\t\tgone astray and never a way will they be able to find!\n\t\t\t3063
Blessed is He Who if that were His will could give thee better (things) than those Gardens beneath which rivers flow; and He could give thee Palaces (secure to dwell in). 3064 2065
Nay they deny the Hour (of the Judgment to come): but We have\n\t\t\tprepared a Blazing Fire for such as deny the Hour: 3066
When it sees them from a place far off they will hear its fury\n\t\t\tand its raging sigh. 3067
And when they are cast bound together into a constricted place\n\t\t\ttherein they will plead for destruction there and then!\n\t\t\t3068
"This day plead not for a single destruction: plead for\n\t\t\tdestruction oft-repeated!"
Say: "Is that best or the eternal Garden promised to the\n\t\t\trighteous? For them that is a reward as well as a goal (of\n\t\t\tattainment). 3069 3070
"For them there will be therein all that they wish for: they will\n\t\t\tdwell (there) for aye: a promise to be prayed for from thy Lord."\n\t\t\t3071
The Day He will gather them together as well as those whom they worship besides Allah He will ask: "Was it ye who led these my servants astray or did they stray from the Path themselves?" 3072

They will say: "Glory to Thee! not meet was it for us that we should take for protectors others besides Thee: but Thou didst bestow on them and their fathers good things (in life) until they forgot the Message: for they were a people (worthless and) lost. 3073

(Allah will say): "Now have they proved you liars in what ye say: so ye cannot avert (your penalty) nor (get) help." And whoever among you does wrong him shall We cause to taste of a grievous Penalty. 3074

And the apostles whom We sent before thee were all (men) who ate food and walked through the streets: We have made some of you as a trial for others: will ye have patience? For Allah is One Who sees (all things). 3075 3076

Such as fear not the meeting with Us (for Judgment) say: "Why are not the angels sent down to us or (why) do we not see our Lord?" Indeed they have an arrogant conceit of themselves and mighty is the insolence of their impiety! 3077 3078
The Day they see the angels no joy will there be to the sinners\n\t\t\tthat Day: the (angels) will say: "There is a barrier forbidden\n\t\t\t(to you) altogether!" 3079
And We shall turn to whatever deeds they did (in this life) and\n\t\t\tWe shall make such deeds as floating dust scattered about.\n\t\t\t3080
The Companions of the Garden will be well that Day in their abode\n\t\t\tand have the fairest of places for repose. 3081
The Day the heaven shall be rent asunder with clouds and angels\n\t\t\tshall be sent down descending (in ranks) 3082
That Day the dominion as of right and truth shall be (wholly) for\n\t\t\t(Allah) Most Merciful: it will be a day of dire difficulty for\n\t\t\tthe Misbelievers. 3083
The Day that the wrongdoer will bite at his hands He will say\n\t\t\t"Oh! would that I had taken a (straight) path with the Apostle!\n\t\t\t3084
"Ah! woe is me! would that I had never taken such a one for a\n\t\t\tfriend!
"He did lead me astray from the Message (of Allah) after it had\n\t\t\tcome to me! Ah! the Evil One is but a traitor to man!\n\t\t\t3085
Then the Apostle will say: "O my Lord! truly my people took this\n\t\t\tQur'an for just foolish nonsense." 3086
Thus have We made for every prophet an enemy among the sinners:\n\t\t\tbut enough is thy Lord to guide and to help. 3087

Those who reject Faith say: "Why is not the Qur'an revealed to him all at once?" Thus (is it revealed) that We may strengthen thy heart thereby and We have rehearsed it to thee in slow well-arranged stages gradually. 3088
And no question do they bring to thee but We reveal to thee the\n\t\t\ttruth and the best explanation (thereof). 3089
Those who will be gathered to Hell (prone) on their faces they\n\t\t\twill be in an evil plight and as to Path most astray.\n\t\t\t3090 3091
Before this We sent Moses the Book and appointed his brother\n\t\t\tAaron with him as Minister; 3092
And We commanded: "Go ye both to the people who have rejected Our\n\t\t\tSigns": and those (people) We destroyed with utter destruction.
And the people of Noah when they rejected the apostles We drowned\n\t\t\tthem and We made them as a Sign for mankind; and We have prepared\n\t\t\tfor (all) wrongdoers a grievous Penalty 3093
As also `Ad and Thamud and the Companions of the Rass and many a\n\t\t\tgeneration between them. 3094
To teach one We set forth parables and examples; and each one We\n\t\t\tbroke to utter annihilation (for their sins).
And the (Unbelievers) must indeed have passed by the town on which was rained a shower of evil: did they not then see it (with their own eyes)? But they fear not the Resurrection. 3095
When they see thee they treat thee no otherwise than in mockery:\n\t\t\t"Is this the one whom Allah has sent as an apostle?"
"He indeed would well-nigh have misled us from our gods had it not been that we were constant to them!" Soon will they know when they see the Penalty who it is that is most misled in Path! 3096
Seest thou such a one as taketh for his god his own passion (or\n\t\t\timpulse)? Couldst thou be a disposer of affairs for him?\n\t\t\t3097
Or thinkest thou that most of them listen or understand? They are\n\t\t\tonly like cattle; nay they are worse astray in Path.
Hast thou not turned thy vision to thy Lord? how He doth prolong\n\t\t\tthe Shadow! If He willed He could make it stationary! Then do We\n\t\t\tmake the sun its guide: 3098 3099 3100
Then We draw it in towards Ourselves a contraction by easy\n\t\t\tstages. 3101 3102
And He it is Who makes the Night as a Robe for you; and Sleep as\n\t\t\tRepose and makes the Day (as it were) a Resurrection.\n\t\t\t3103
And He it is Who sends the Winds as heralds of glad tidings going\n\t\t\tbefore His Mercy and We send down purifying water from the sky\n\t\t\t3104 3105
That with it We may give life to a dead land and slake the thirst\n\t\t\tof things We have created cattle and men in great numbers.\n\t\t\t3106
And We have distributed the (water) amongst them in order that\n\t\t\tthey may celebrate (Our) praises but most men are averse (to\n\t\t\taught) but (rank) ingratitude. 3107 3108
Had it been Our Will We could have sent a warner to every center\n\t\t\tof population 3109
Therefore listen not to the Unbelievers but strive against them\n\t\t\twith the utmost strenuousness with the (Qur'an). 3110

It is He Who has let free the two bodies of flowing water: one palatable and sweet and the other salt and bitter; yet has He made a barrier between them a partition that is forbidden to be passed. 3111 3112
It is He Who has created man from water: then has He established\n\t\t\trelationships of lineage and marriage: for thy Lord has power\n\t\t\t(over all things). 3113 3114
Yet do they worship besides Allah things that can neither profit\n\t\t\tthem nor harm them: and the Misbeliever is a helper (of Evil)\n\t\t\tagainst his own Lord! 3115
But thee We only sent to give glad tidings and admonition.
Say: "No reward do I ask of you for it but this: that each one\n\t\t\twho will may take a (straight) Path to his Lord."
And put thy trust in Him Who lives and dies not; and celebrate\n\t\t\tHis praise; and enough is He to be acquainted with the faults of\n\t\t\tHis servants 3116

He Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between in six days and is firmly established on the Throne (of authority): Allah Most Gracious: ask thou then about Him of any acquainted (with such things). 3117 3118 3119

When it is said to them "Adore ye (Allah) Most Gracious!" they say "And what is (Allah) Most Gracious? Shall we adore that which thou commandest us?" and it increases their flight (from the Truth). 3120
Blessed is He Who made Constellations in the skies and placed\n\t\t\ttherein a Lamp and a Moon giving light; 3121
And it is He Who made the Night and the Day to follow each other:\n\t\t\tfor such as have the will to celebrate His praises or to show\n\t\t\ttheir gratitude. 3122
And the servants of (Allah) Most Gracious are those who walk on\n\t\t\tthe earth in humility and when the ignorant address them they say\n\t\t\t"Peace!" 3123
Those who spend the night in adoration of their Lord prostrate\n\t\t\tand standing; 3124
Those who say "Our Lord! avert from us the Wrath of Hell for its\n\t\t\tWrath is indeed an affliction grievous 3125
"Evil indeed is it as an abode and as a place to rest in";\n\t\t\t3126
Those who when they spend are not extravagant and not niggardly\n\t\t\tbut hold a just (balance) between those (extremes); 3127
Those who invoke not with Allah any other god nor slay such life as Allah has made sacred except for just cause not commit fornication and any that does this (not only) meets punishment 3128
(But) the Penalty on the Day of Judgment will be doubled to him\n\t\t\tand he will dwell therein in ignominy 3129
Unless he repents believes and works righteous deeds for Allah\n\t\t\twill change the evil of such persons into good and Allah is\n\t\t\tOft-Forgiving Most Merciful 3130
And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to Allah with\n\t\t\tan (acceptable) conversion
Those who witness no falsehood and if they pass by futility they\n\t\t\tpass by it with honorable (avoidance); 3131\n\t\t\t3132
Those who when they are admonished with the Signs of their Lord\n\t\t\tdroop not down at them as if they were deaf or blind:\n\t\t\t3133
And those who pray "Our Lord! grant unto us wives and offspring\n\t\t\twho will be the comfort of our eyes and give us (the grace) to\n\t\t\tlead the righteous." 3134 3135
Those are the ones who will be rewarded with the highest place in\n\t\t\theaven because of their patient constancy; therein shall they be\n\t\t\tmet with salutations and peace
Dwelling therein how beautiful an abode and place of rest!
Say (to the rejecters): "My Lord is not uneasy because of you if\n\t\t\tye call not on Him but ye have indeed rejected (Him) and soon\n\t\t\twill come the inevitable (punishment)!" 3136
Ta Sin Mim. 3137
These are Verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.\n\t\t\t3138
It may be thou frettest thy soul with grief that they do not\n\t\t\tbecome Believers. 3139
If (such) were Our Will We could send down to them from the sky a\n\t\t\tSign to which they would bend their necks in humility.\n\t\t\t3140
But there comes not to them a newly-revealed message from (Allah)\n\t\t\tMost Gracious but they turn away therefrom.
They have indeed rejected (the Message): so they will know soon\n\t\t\t(enough) the truth of what they mocked at! 3141
Do they not look at the earth how many noble things of all kinds\n\t\t\twe have produced therein? 3142
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.\n\t\t\t3143
Behold thy Lord called Moses: "Go to the people of iniquity\n\t\t\t3144
"The people of Pharaoh: will they not fear Allah?"
He said: "O my Lord! I do fear that they will charge me with\n\t\t\tfalsehood:
"My breast will be straitened and my speech may not go\n\t\t\t(smoothly): so send unto Aaron. 3145
"And (further) they have a charge of crime against me; and I fear\n\t\t\tthey may slay me." 3146
Allah said: "By no means! proceed then both of you with Our\n\t\t\tSigns; We are with you and will listen (to your call).
"So go forth both of you to Pharaoh and say: `We have been sent\n\t\t\tby the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds;
" `Send thou with us the Children of Israel.' "
(Pharaoh) said: "Did we not cherish thee as a child among us and\n\t\t\tdidst thou not stay in our midst many years of thy life?\n\t\t\t3147
"And thou didst a deed of thine which (thou knowest) thou didst\n\t\t\tand thou art an ungrateful (wretch)!" 3148
Moses: "I did it then when I was in error. 3149
"So I fled from you (all) when I feared you; but my Lord has\n\t\t\t(since) invested me with judgment (and wisdom) and appointed me\n\t\t\tas one of the apostles. 3150
"And this is the favor with which thou dost reproach me that thou\n\t\t\thast enslaved the Children of Israel" 3151
Pharaoh said: "And what is the `Lord and Cherisher of the\n\t\t\tWorlds?' " 3152
(Moses) said: "The Lord and Cherisher of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth and all between if ye want to be quite sure."
(Pharaoh) said to those around: "Do ye not listen (to what he\n\t\t\tsays)?" 3153
(Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the\n\t\t\tbeginning!"
(Pharaoh) said: "Truly your apostle who has been sent to you is a\n\t\t\tveritable madman!" 3154
(Moses) said: "Lord of the East and the West and all between! If\n\t\t\tye only had sense!"
(Pharaoh) said: "If thou dost put forward any god other than me I\n\t\t\twill certainly put thee in prison!" 3155
(Moses) said: "Even if I showed you something clear (and)\n\t\t\tconvincing?" 3156
(Pharaoh) said: "Show it then if thou tellest the truth!"
So (Moses) threw his rod and behold it was a serpent plain (for\n\t\t\tall to see)!
And he drew out his hand and behold it was white to all\n\t\t\tbeholders! 3157
(Pharaoh) said to the Chiefs around him: "This is indeed a\n\t\t\tsorcerer well-versed: 3158
"His plan is to get you out of your land by his sorcery; then\n\t\t\twhat is it ye counsel?"
They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while)\n\t\t\tand dispatch to the Cities heralds to collect
"And bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed."
So the sorcerers were got together for the appointment of a day\n\t\t\twell-known 3159
And the people were told: "Are ye (now) assembled?
"That we may follow the sorcerers (in religion) if they win?"\n\t\t\t3160
So when the sorcerers arrived they said to Pharaoh: "Of course \n\t\t\tshall we have a (suitable) reward if we win?" 3161
He said: "Yea (and more) for ye shall in that case be (raised to\n\t\t\tposts) nearest (to my person)."
Moses said to them: "Throw ye that which ye are about to throw!"\n\t\t\t3162
So they threw their ropes and their rods and said: "By the might\n\t\t\tof Pharaoh it is we who will certainly win!" 3163
Then Moses threw his rod when behold it straightway swallows up\n\t\t\tall the falsehoods which they fake! 3164
Then did the sorcerers fall down prostrate in adoration
Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds
"The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

Said (Pharaoh): "Believe ye in him before I give you permission? Surely he is your leader who has taught you sorcery! But soon shall ye know! "But sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides and I will cause you all to die on the cross!" 3165
They said: "No matter! for us we shall but return to our Lord!
"Only our desire is that our Lord will forgive us our faults that\n\t\t\twe may become foremost among the Believers!" 3166
By inspiration We told Moses: "Travel by night with My servants;\n\t\t\tfor surely ye shall be pursued." 3167
Then Pharaoh sent heralds to (all) the Cities
(Saying): "These (Israelites) are but a small band
"And they are raging furiously against us;
"But we are a multitude amply fore-warned."
So We expelled them from gardens springs 3168
Treasures and every kind of honorable position;
Thus it was but We made the Children of Israel inheritors of such\n\t\t\tthings. 3169
So they pursued them at sunrise. 3170
And when the two bodies saw each other the people of Moses said:\n\t\t\t"We are sure to be overtaken."
(Moses said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide\n\t\t\tme! 3171
Then We told Moses by inspiration: "Strike the sea with thy rod."\n\t\t\tSo it divided and each separate part become like the huge firm\n\t\t\tmass of a mountain.
And We made the other party approach thither. 3172
We delivered Moses and all who were with him;
But We drowned the others.
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.\n\t\t\t3173
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.\n\t\t\t3174
And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham's story.\n\t\t\t3175
Behold he said to his father and his people: "What worship ye?"
They said: "We worship idols and we remain constantly in\n\t\t\tattendance on them." 3176
He said: "Do they listen to you when ye call (on them)
"Or do you good or harm?"
They said: "Nay but we found our fathers doing thus (what we\n\t\t\tdo)."
He said: "Do ye then see whom ye have been worshipping
"Ye and your fathers before you?
"For they are enemies to me; not so the Lord and Cherisher of the\n\t\t\tWorlds; 3177
"Who created me and it is He Who guides me;
"Who gives me food and drink
"And when I am ill it is He Who cures me;
"Who will cause me to die and then to live (again);
"And Who I hope will forgive me my faults on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment...
O my Lord! bestow wisdom on me and join me with the righteous;\n\t\t\t3178
"Grant me honorable mention on the tongue of truth among the\n\t\t\tlatest (generations); 3179
"Make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss;
"Forgive my father for that he is among those astray;
"And let me not be in disgrace on the Day when (men) will be\n\t\t\traised up
The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail 3180
"But only he (will prosper) that brings to Allah a sound heart;
"To the righteous the Garden will be brought near 3181
"And to those straying in Evil the Fire will be placed in full\n\t\t\tview;
"And it shall be said to them: `Where are the (gods) ye\n\t\t\tworshipped
" `Besides Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?'
"Then they will be thrown headlong into the (Fire) they and those\n\t\t\tstraying in Evil 3182
"And the whole hosts of Iblis together.
"They will say there in their mutual bickerings:
" `By Allah we were truly in an error manifest 3183
" `When we held you as equals with the Lord of the Worlds;
" `And our seducers were only those who were steeped in guilt.\n\t\t\t3184
" `Now then we have none to intercede (for us)
" `Nor a single friend to feel (for us).
" `Now if we only had a chance of return we shall truly be of\n\t\t\tthose who believe!' " 3185
Verily in this is a Sign but most of them do not believe.
And verily the Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The people of Noah rejected the apostles.
Behold their brother Noah said to them: "Will ye not fear\n\t\t\t(Allah)? 3186
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust: 3187
"So fear Allah and obey me.
"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the\n\t\t\tLord of the Worlds:
"So fear Allah and obey me." 3188
They said: "Shall we believe in thee when it is the meanest that\n\t\t\tfollow thee?" 3189
He said: "And what do I know as to what they do?
"Their account is only with my Lord if ye could (but) understand.
"I am not one to drive away those who believe. 3190
"I am sent only to warn plainly in public."
They said: "If thou desist not O Noah! thou shalt be stoned (to\n\t\t\tdeath)." 3191
He said: "O my Lord! truly my people have rejected me.
"Judge thou then between me and them openly and deliver me and\n\t\t\tthose of the Believers who are with me."
So we delivered him and those with him in the Ark filled (with\n\t\t\tall creatures). 3192
Thereafter We drowned those who remained behind.
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.\n\t\t\t3193
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The `Ad (people) rejected the apostles. 3194
Behold their brother Hud said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust. 3195
"So fear Allah and obey me.
"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the\n\t\t\tLord of the Worlds.
"Do ye build a landmark on every high place to amuse yourselves?\n\t\t\t3196
"And do ye get for yourselves fine buildings in the hope of\n\t\t\tliving therein (forever)?
"And when ye exert your strong hand do ye do it like men of\n\t\t\tabsolute power? 3197
"Now fear Allah and obey me. 3198
"Yea fear Him Who has bestowed on you freely all that ye know.\n\t\t\t3199
"Freely has He bestowed on you cattle and sons
And Gardens and Springs.
"Truly I fear for you the Penalty of a Great Day." 3200
They said: "It is the same to us whether thou admonish us or be\n\t\t\tnot among (our) Admonishers! 3201
"This is no other than a customary device of the ancients\n\t\t\t3202
"And we are not the ones to receive Pains and Penalties!"
So they rejected him and We destroyed them verily in this is a\n\t\t\tSign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The Thamud (people) rejected the apostles. 3203
Behold their brother Salih said to them: "Will you fear (Allah)?
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.
"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the\n\t\t\tLord of the Worlds.
"Will ye be left secure in (the enjoyment of) all that ye have\n\t\t\there?--
"Gardens and Springs
"And corn-fields and date-palms with spathes near breaking (with\n\t\t\tthe weight of fruit)? 3204
"And ye carve house out of (rocky) mountains with great skill.
"But fear Allah and obey me;
"And follow not the bidding of those who are extravagant\n\t\t\t3205
"Who make mischief in the land and mend not (their ways)."
They said: "Thou art only one of those bewitched! 3206
"Thou art no more than a mortal like us: then bring us a Sign if\n\t\t\tthou tellest the truth!"
He said: "Here is a she-camel: she has a right of watering and ye\n\t\t\thave a right of watering (severally) on a day appointed.\n\t\t\t3207
"Touch her not with harm lest the Penalty of a Great Day seize\n\t\t\tyou."
But they hamstrung her: then did they become full of regrets.\n\t\t\t3208
But the Penalty seized them.  Verily in this is a Sign: but most\n\t\t\tof them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The people of Lut rejected the apostles. 3209
Behold their brother Lut said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.
"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the\n\t\t\tLord of the Worlds.
"Of all the creatures in the world will ye approach males.
"And leave those whom Allah has created for you to be your mates?\n\t\t\tNay ye are a people transgressing (all limits)!"
They said: "If thou desist not O Lut! thou wilt assuredly be cast\n\t\t\tout!" 3210
He said: "I do detest your doings." 3211
"O my Lord! deliver me and my family from such things as they\n\t\t\tdo!"
So We delivered him and his family all
Except an old woman who lingered behind. 3212
But the rest We destroyed utterly.
We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): and evil was the\n\t\t\tshower on those who were admonished (but heeded not)!\n\t\t\t3213
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The Companions of the Wood rejected the apostles. 3214
Behold Shuaib said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?\n\t\t\t3215
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.
"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the\n\t\t\tLord of the Worlds.
"Give just measure and cause no loss (to others by fraud).\n\t\t\t3216
"And weigh with scales true and upright.
"And withhold not things justly due to men nor do evil in the\n\t\t\tland working mischief.
"And fear Him Who created you and (Who created) the generations\n\t\t\tbefore (you).
They said: "Thou art only one of those bewitched!
"Thou art no more than a mortal like us and indeed we think thou\n\t\t\tart a liar! 3217
"Now cause a piece of the sky to fall on us if thou art\n\t\t\ttruthful!" 3218
He said: "My Lord knows best what ye do." 3219
But they rejected him.\tThen the punishment of a day of\n\t\t\tovershadowing gloom seized them and that was the Penalty of a\n\t\t\tGreat Day. 3220 3221
Verily in that is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He. The Exalted in Might Most Merciful.\n\t\t\t3222
Verily this is a Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds:\n\t\t\t3223
With it came down the Spirit of Faith and Truth 3224
To thy heart and mind that thou mayest admonish 3225
In the perspicuous Arabic tongue.
Without doubt it is (announced) in the mystic Books of former\n\t\t\tpeoples. 3226
Is it not a Sign to them that the learned of the Children of\n\t\t\tIsrael knew it (as true)? 3227
Had We revealed it to any of the non-Arabs
And had he recited it to them they would not have believed in it.\n\t\t\t3228
Thus have We caused it to enter the hearts of the Sinners.\n\t\t\t3229
They will not believe in it until they see the grievous Penalty;
But the (Penalty) will come to them of a sudden while they\n\t\t\tperceive it not;
Then they will say: "Shall we be respited?"
Do they then ask for Our Penalty to be hastened on? 3230
Seest thou? If We do let them enjoy (this life) for a few years
Yet there comes to them at length the (Punishment) which they\n\t\t\twere promised!
It will profit them not that they enjoyed (this life)!
Never did We destroy a population but had its warners
By way of reminder; and We never are unjust. 3231
No evil ones have brought down this (Revelation): 3232
It would neither suit them nor would they be able (to produce\n\t\t\tit).
Indeed they have been removed far from even (a chance of) hearing\n\t\t\tit.
So call not on any other god with Allah or thou wilt be among\n\t\t\tthose under the Penalty.
And admonish thy nearest kinsmen
And lower thy wing to the Believers who follow thee.\n\t\t\t3233
Then if they disobey thee say: "I am free (of responsibility) for\n\t\t\twhat ye do!" 3234
And put thy trust on the Exalted in Might the Merciful
Who seeth thee standing forth (in prayer)
And thy movements among those who prostrate themselves.\n\t\t\t3235
For it is He Who heareth and knoweth all things.
Shall I inform you (O people!) on whom it is that the evil ones\n\t\t\tdescend? 3236
They descend on every lying wicked person
(Into whose ears) they pour hearsay vanities and most of them are\n\t\t\tliars.
And the Poets it is those straying in Evil who follow them:\n\t\t\t3237
Seest thou not that they wander distracted in every valley?
And that they say what they practice not?

Except those who believe work righteousness engage much in the remembrance of Allah and defend themselves only after they are unjustly attacked. And soon will the unjust assailants know what vicissitudes their affairs will take! 3238 3239
Ta Sin. These are verses of the Qur'an a Book that makes\n\t\t\t(things) clear; 3240
A Guide; and Glad Tidings for the Believers 3241
Those who establish regular prayers and give in regular charity\n\t\t\tand also have (full) assurance of the Hereafter.
As to those who believe not in the Hereafter We have made their\n\t\t\tdeeds pleasing in their eyes; and so they wander about in\n\t\t\tdistraction. 3242
Such are they for whom a grievous Penalty is (waiting): and in\n\t\t\tthe Hereafter theirs will be the greatest loss. 3243
As to thee the Qur'an is bestowed upon thee from the presence of\n\t\t\tOne Who is Wise and All-Knowing.
Behold! Moses said to his family: "I perceive a fire; soon will I bring you from there some information or I will bring you a burning brand to light our fuel that ye may warm yourselves." 3244
But when he came to the (Fire) a voice was heard: "Blessed are\n\t\t\tthose in the Fire and those around: and Glory to Allah the Lord\n\t\t\tof the Worlds! 3245
"O Moses! verily I am Allah the Exalted in Might the Wise!...

"Now do thou throw thy rod!" But when he saw it moving (of its own accord) as if it had been a snake he turned back in retreat and retraced not his steps: "O Moses" (it was said) "fear not: truly in My presence those called as apostles have no fear 3246 3247
"But if any have done wrong and have thereafter substituted good\n\t\t\tto take the place of evil truly I am Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.\n\t\t\t3248

"Now put thy hand into thy bosom and it will come forth white without stain (or harm): (these are) among the nine Signs (thou wilt take) to Pharaoh and his people: for they are a people rebellious in transgression. 3249 3250
But when our Signs came to them that should have opened their\n\t\t\teyes they said: "This is sorcery manifest!" 3251
And they rejected those Signs in iniquity and arrogance though\n\t\t\ttheir souls were convinced thereof: so see what was the end of\n\t\t\tthose who acted corruptly!
We gave (in the past) knowledge to David and Solomon: and they\n\t\t\tboth said: "Praise be to Allah Who has favored us above many of\n\t\t\tHis servants who believe!" 3252 3253

And Solomon was David's heir. He said: "O ye people! we have been taught the speech of Birds and on us has been bestowed (a little) of all things: this is indeed Grace manifest (from Allah)." 3254 3255 3256
And before Solomon were marshalled his hosts of Jinns and men and\n\t\t\tbirds and they were all kept in order and ranks. 3257
At length when they came to a (lowly) valley of ants one of the ants said: "O ye ants get into your habitations lest Solomon and his hosts crush you (under foot) without knowing it." 3258

So he smiled amused at her speech; and he said: "O my Lord! so order me that I may be grateful for Thy favors which Thou hast bestowed on me and on my parents and that I may work the righteousness that will please Thee: and admit me by Thy Grace to the ranks of Thy righteous Servants." 3259 3260 3261
And he took a muster of the Birds; and he said: "Why is it I see\n\t\t\tnot the Hoopoe? Or is he among the absentees? 3262
"I will certainly punish him with a severe Penalty or execute him\n\t\t\tunless he bring me a clear reason (for absence)."
But the Hoopoe tarried not far: he compassed (territory) which\n\t\t\tthou hast not compassed and I have come to thee from Saba with\n\t\t\ttidings true. 3263
"I found (there) a woman ruling over them and provided with every\n\t\t\trequisite; and she has a magnificent throne. 3264\n\t\t\t3265
"I found her and her people worshipping the sun besides Allah: Satan has made their deeds seem pleasing in their eyes and has kept them away from the Path so they receive no guidance 3266
"(Kept them away from the Path) that they should not worship\n\t\t\tAllah Who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth and knows what ye hide and what ye reveal. 3267
"Allah! there is no god but He! Lord of the Throne Supreme!"\n\t\t\t3268
(Solomon) said: "Soon shall we see whether thou hast told the\n\t\t\ttruth or lied! 3269
"Go thou with this letter of mine and deliver it to them: then\n\t\t\tdraw back from them and (wait to) see what answer they return"...
(The Queen) said: "Ye chiefs! here is delivered to me a letter\n\t\t\tworthy of respect.
"It is from Solomon and is (as follows): `In the name of Allah\n\t\t\tMost Gracious Most Merciful: 3270
" `Be ye not arrogant against me but come to me in submission to\n\t\t\tthe true Religion.' "
She said: "Ye chiefs! advise me in (this) my affair: no affair\n\t\t\thave I decided except in your presence."
They said: "We are endued with strength and given to vehement\n\t\t\twar: but the command is with thee; so consider what thou wilt\n\t\t\tcommand."
She said: "Kings when they enter a country despoil it and make\n\t\t\tthe noblest of its people its meanest: thus do they behave.\n\t\t\t3271
"But I am going to send him a present and (wait) to see with what\n\t\t\t(answer) return (my) ambassadors."

How when (the embassy) came to Solomon he said: "Will ye give me abundance in wealth? But that which Allah has given me is better than that which He has given you! Nay it is ye who rejoice in your gift! 3272
"Go back to them and be sure we shall come to them with such\n\t\t\thosts as they will never be able to meet: we shall expel them\n\t\t\tfrom there in disgrace and they will feel humbled (indeed)."
He said (to his own men): "Ye Chiefs! which of you can bring me\n\t\t\ther throne before they come to me in submission?" 3273
Said an Ifrit of the Jinns: "I will bring it to thee before thou\n\t\t\trise from thy Council: indeed I have full strength for the\n\t\t\tpurpose and may be trusted." 3274

Said one who had knowledge of the Book: "I will bring it to thee within the twinkling of an eye!" Then when (Solomon) saw it placed firmly before him he said: "This is by the grace of my Lord! to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful! And if any is grateful truly his gratitude is (a gain) for his own soul; but if any is ungrateful truly my Lord is Free of All Needs Supreme in Honor!" 3275 3276 3277
He said: "Transform her throne out of all recognition by her: let\n\t\t\tus see whether she is guided (to the truth) or is one of those\n\t\t\twho receive no guidance." 3278
So when she arrived she was asked "Is this thy throne?" She said "It was just like this; and knowledge was bestowed on us in advance of this and we have submitted to Allah (in Islam)." 3279
And he diverted her from the worship of others besides Allah: for\n\t\t\tshe was (sprung) of a people that had no faith. 3280
