She was asked to enter that lofty Palace: but when she saw it she thought it was a lake of water and she (tucked up her skirts) uncovering her legs. He said. "This is but a palace paved smooth with slabs of glass." She said: "O my Lord! I have indeed wronged my soul: I do (now) submit (in Islam) with Solomon to the Lord of the Worlds." 3281 3282
We sent (aforetime) to the Thamud their brother Salih saying\n\t\t\t"Serve Allah": but behold they became two factions quarrelling\n\t\t\twith each other. 3283
He said: "O my people! why ask ye to hasten on the evil in\n\t\t\tpreference to the good? If only ye ask Allah for forgiveness ye\n\t\t\tmay hope to receive mercy." 3284
They said: "Ill omen do we augur from thee and those that are\n\t\t\twith thee." He said: "Your ill omen is with Allah; yea ye are a\n\t\t\tpeople under trial." 3285
There were in the City nine men of a family who made mischief in\n\t\t\tthe land and would not reform. 3286

They said: "Swear a mutual oath by Allah that we shall make a secret night attack on him and his people and that we shall then say to his heir (when he seeks vengeance): `We were not present at the slaughter of his people and we are positively telling the truth.' " 3287
They plotted and planned but We too planned even while they\n\t\t\tperceived it not. 3288
Then see what was the end of their plot! this, that we destroyed\n\t\t\tthem and their people all (of them).
Now such were their houses in utter ruin because they practiced\n\t\t\twrongdoing Verily in this is a Sign for people of knowledge.
And We saved those who believed and practiced righteousness.
We also sent Lut (as an apostle): behold he said to his people\n\t\t\t"Do ye do what is shameful though ye see (its iniquity)?\n\t\t\t3289
"Would ye really approach men in your lusts rather than women?\n\t\t\tNay ye are a people (grossly) ignorant!" 3290
But his people gave no other answer but this: they said "Drive\n\t\t\tout the followers of Lut from your city: these are indeed men who\n\t\t\twant to be clean and pure!" 3291
But We saved him and his family except his wife: her We destined\n\t\t\tto be of those who lagged behind.
And We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): and evil was\n\t\t\tthe shower on those who were admonished (but heeded not)!
Say: Praise be to Allah and Peace on His servants whom He has\n\t\t\tchosen (for his Message). (Who) is better? Allah or the false\n\t\t\tgods they associate with Him? 3292

Or who has created the heaven and the earth and who sends you down rain from the sky? Yea with it We cause to grow well-planted orchards full of beauty and delight: it is not in your power to cause the growth of the trees in them. (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Nay they are a people who swerve from justice. 3293 3294

Or who has made the earth firm to live in; made rivers in its midst; set thereon mountains immovable; and made a separating bar between the two bodies of flowing water? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Nay most of them know not. 3295 3296

Or who listens to the (soul) distressed when it calls on Him and who relieves its suffering and makes you (mankind) inheritors of the earth? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Little it is that ye heed! 3297 3298

Or who guides you through the depths of darkness on land and sea and who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings going before His mercy? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? high is Allah above what they associate with Him! 3299

Or who originates Creation then repeats it and who gives you sustenance from heaven and earth? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Say "Bring forth your argument if ye are telling the truth!" 3300 3301 3302
Say: None in the heavens or on earth except Allah knows what is\n\t\t\thidden: nor can they perceive when they shall be raised up (for\n\t\t\tJudgment). 3303
Still less can their knowledge comprehend the Hereafter: nay they\n\t\t\tare in doubt and uncertainty thereanent; nay they are blind\n\t\t\tthereunto! 3304
The Unbelievers say: "What! when we become dust we and our\n\t\t\tfathers--shall we really be raised (from the dead)?
"It is true we were promised this we and our fathers before (us):\n\t\t\tthese are nothing but tales of the ancients."
Say: "Go ye through the earth and see what has been the end of\n\t\t\tthose guilty (of sin)." 3305
But grieve not over them nor distress thyself because of their\n\t\t\tplots. 3306
They also say: "When will this promise (come to pass)? (Say) if\n\t\t\tye are truthful."
Say: "It may be that some of the events which ye wish to hasten\n\t\t\ton may be (close) in your pursuit!" 3307
But verily thy Lord is full of grace to mankind: yet most of them\n\t\t\tare ungrateful.
And verily thy Lord knoweth all that their hearts do hide as well\n\t\t\tas all that they reveal.
Nor is there aught of the Unseen in heaven or earth but is\n\t\t\t(recorded) in a clear record. 3308
Verily this Qur'an doth explain to the Children of Israel most of\n\t\t\tthe matters in which they disagree. 3309
And it certainly is a Guide and Mercy to those who believe.
Verily thy Lord will decide between them by His Decree: and He is\n\t\t\tExalted in Might All-Knowing. 3310
So put thy trust in Allah: for thou art on (the Path of) manifest\n\t\t\tTruth.
Truly thou canst not cause the Dead to listen nor canst thou\n\t\t\tcause the Deaf to hear the call (especially) when they turn back\n\t\t\tin retreat. 3311
Nor canst thou be a guide to the Blind (to prevent them) from\n\t\t\tstraying; only those wilt thou get to listen who believe in Our\n\t\t\tSigns and they will bow in Islam.

And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust) We shall produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: he will speak to them for that mankind did not believe with assurance in our Signs. 3312 3313
One Day We shall gather together from every people a troop of\n\t\t\tthose who reject Our Signs and they shall be kept in ranks
Until when they come (before the Judgment-Seat) Allah will say:\n\t\t\t"Did ye reject My Signs though ye comprehended them not in\n\t\t\tknowledge or what was it ye did?" 3314
And the Word will be fulfilled against them because of their\n\t\t\twrongdoing and they will be unable to speak (in plea).\n\t\t\t3315
See they not that We have made the Night for them to rest in and\n\t\t\tthe Day to give them light? Verily in this are Signs for any\n\t\t\tpeople that believe! 3316

And the Day that the Trumpet will be sounded then will be smitten with terror those who are in the heavens and those who are on earth except such as Allah will please (to exempt): and all shall come to His (Presence) as beings conscious of their lowliness. 3317

Thou seest the mountains and thinkest them firmly fixed: but they shall pass away as the clouds pass away: (such is) the artistry of Allah Who disposes of all things in perfect order: for He is well-acquainted with all that ye do. 3318 3319
If any do good good will (accrue) to them therefrom; and they\n\t\t\twill be secure from terror that Day.
And if any do evil their faces will be thrown headlong into the\n\t\t\tFire: "Do ye receive a reward other than that which ye have\n\t\t\tearned by your deeds?" 3320 3321
For me I have been commanded to serve the Lord of this City Him Who has sanctified it and to Whom (belong) all things: and I am commanded to be of those who bow in Islam to Allah's Will 3322
And to rehearse the Qur'an: and if any accept guidance they do it\n\t\t\tfor the good of their own souls and if any stray say: "I am only\n\t\t\ta Warner." 3323
And say: "Praise be to Allah Who will soon show you His Signs so\n\t\t\tthat ye shall know them"; and thy Lord is not unmindful of all\n\t\t\tthat ye do. 3324 3325
Ta. Sin. Mim. 3326
These are Verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.\n\t\t\t3327
We rehearse to thee some of the story of Moses and Pharaoh in\n\t\t\tTruth for people who believe. 3328

Truly Pharaoh elated himself in the land and broke up its people into sections depressing a small group among them: their sons he slew but he kept alive their females: for he was indeed a maker of mischief. 3329
And We wished to be gracious to those who were being depressed in\n\t\t\tthe land to make them leaders (in faith) and make them heirs\n\t\t\t3330
To establish a firm place for them in the land and to show Pharaoh Haman and their hosts at their hands the very things against which they were taking precautions. 3331 3332

So We sent this inspiration to the mother of Moses: "Suckle (thy child) but when thou hast fears about him cast him into the river but fear not nor grieve: for We shall restore him to thee and We shall make him one of Our apostles." 3333

Then the people of Pharaoh picked him up (from the river): (it was intended) that (Moses) should be to them an adversary and a cause of sorrow: for Pharaoh and Haman and (all) their hosts were men of sin. 3334

The wife of Pharaoh said: "(Here is) a joy of the eye for me and for thee: slay him not. It may be that he will be of use to us or we may adopt him as a son." And they perceived not (what they were doing)! 3335 3336

But there came to be a void in the heart of the mother of Moses: she was going almost to disclose his (case) had We not strengthened her heart (with faith) so that she might remain a (firm) believer. 3337
And she said to the sister of (Moses) "Follow him." So she (the\n\t\t\tsister) watched him in the character of a stranger and they knew\n\t\t\tnot.

And We ordained that he refused suck at first until (his sister came up and) said: "Shall I point out to you the people of a house that will nourish and bring him up for you and be sincerely attached to him?"... 3338
Thus did We restore him to his mother that her eye might be comforted that she might not grieve and that she might know that the promise of Allah is true: but most of them do not understand. 3339
When he reached full age and was firmly established (in life) We\n\t\t\tbestowed on him wisdom and knowledge: for thus do We reward those\n\t\t\twho do good. 3340

And he entered the City at a time when its people were not watching: and he found there two men fighting one of his own religion and the other of his foes. Now the man of his own religion appealed to him against his foe and Moses struck him with his fist and made an end of him. He said: "This is a work of Evil (Satan): for he is an enemy that manifestly misleads!" 3341 3342
He prayed: "O my Lord! I have indeed wronged my soul! Do Thou\n\t\t\tthen forgive me!" So (Allah) forgave him: for He is the\n\t\t\tOft-Forgiving Most Merciful.
He said: "O my Lord! for that Thou hast bestowed Thy Grace on me\n\t\t\tnever shall I be a help to those who sin!" 3343

So he saw the morning in the City looking about in a state of fear when behold the man who had the day before sought his help called aloud for his help (again). Moses said to him: "Thou art truly it is clear a quarrelsome fellow!" 3344

Then when he decided to lay hold of the man who was an enemy to both of them that man said: "O Moses! is it thy intention to slay me as thou slewest a man yesterday? Thy intention is none other than to become a powerful violent man in the land and not to be one who sets things right!" 3345 3346

And there came a man running from the furthest end of the City. He said: "O Moses! the Chiefs are taking counsel together about thee to slay thee: so get thee away for I do give thee sincere advice." 3347
He therefore got away therefrom looking about in a state of fear.\n\t\t\tHe prayed: "O my Lord! save me from people given to wrongdoing."\n\t\t\t3348
Then when he turned his face towards (the land of) Madyan he\n\t\t\tsaid: "I do hope that my Lord will show me the smooth and\n\t\t\tstraight Path." 3349

And when he arrived at the watering (place) in Madyan he found there a group of men watering (their flocks) and besides them he found two women who were keeping back (their flocks). He said: "What is the matter with you?" They said: "We cannot water (our flocks) until the shepherds take back (their flocks): and our father is a very old man." 3350 3351
So he watered (their flocks) for them; then he turned back to the\n\t\t\tshade and said: "O my Lord! truly am I in (desperate) need of any\n\t\t\tgood that thou dost send me!"... 3352

Afterwards one of the (damsels) came (back) to him walking bashfully. She said: "My father invites thee that he may reward thee for having watered (our flocks) for us." So when he came to him and narrated the story he said: "Fear thou not: (well) hast thou escaped from unjust people." 3353 3354
Said one of the (damsels): "O my (dear) father! engage him on\n\t\t\twages: truly the best of men for thee to employ is the (man) who\n\t\t\tis strong and trusty"... 3355 3356

He said: "I intended to wed one of these my daughters to thee on condition that thou serve me for eight years; but if thou complete ten years it will be (grace) from thee. But I intend not to place thee under a difficulty: thou wilt find me indeed if Allah wills one of the righteous." 3357
He said: "Be that (the agreement) between me and thee: whichever\n\t\t\tof the two terms I fulfil let there be no ill-will to me. Be\n\t\t\tAllah a witness to what we say." 3358

Now when Moses had fulfilled the term and was travelling with his family he perceived a fire in the direction of Mount Tur. He said to his family: "Tarry ye; I perceive a fire; I hope to bring you from there some information or a burning firebrand that ye may warm yourselves." 3359 3360
But when he came to the (Fire) a voice was heard from the right\n\t\t\tbank of the valley from a tree in hallowed ground: "O Moses!\n\t\t\tverily I am Allah the Lord of the Worlds... 3361

"Now do thou throw thy rod!" But when he saw it moving (of its own accord) as if it had been a snake He turned back in retreat and retraced not his steps: "O Moses!" (It was said) "draw near and fear not: for thou art of those who are secure. 3362

"Move thy hand into thy bosom and it will come forth white without stain (or harm) and draw thy hand close to thy side (to guard) against fear. Those are the two credentials from thy Lord to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: for truly they are a people rebellious and wicked." 3363
He said: "O my Lord! I have slain a man among them and I fear\n\t\t\tlest they slay me. 3364
"And my brother Aaron he is more eloquent in speech than I: so\n\t\t\tsend him with me as a helper to confirm (and strengthen) me; for\n\t\t\tI fear that they may accuse me of falsehood."

He said: "We will certainly strengthen thy arm through thy brother and invest you both with authority so they shall not be able to touch you: with Our Signs shall ye triumph you two as well as those who follow you." 3365 3366
When Moses came to them with Our Clear Signs they said: "This is\n\t\t\tnothing but sorcery faked up: never did we hear the like among\n\t\t\tour fathers of old!" 3367 3368
Moses said: "My Lord knows best who it is that comes with guidance from Him and whose End will be best in the Hereafter: certain it is that the wrongdoers will not prosper." 3369

Pharaoh said: "O Chiefs! no god do I know for you but myself: therefore O Haman! light me a (kiln to bake bricks) out of clay and build me a lofty palace that I may mount up to the god of Moses: but as far as I am concerned I think (Moses) is a liar!" 3370 3371
And he was arrogant and insolent in the land beyond reason he and\n\t\t\this hosts: they thought that they would not have to return to Us!\n\t\t\t3372
So We seized him and his hosts and We flung them into the sea:\n\t\t\tnow behold what was the End of those who did wrong! 3373
And We made them (but) leaders inviting to the Fire; and on the\n\t\t\tDay of Judgment no help shall they find.
In this world We made a Curse to follow them: and on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment they will be among the loathed (and despised).\n\t\t\t3374
We did reveal to Moses the Book after We had destroyed the\n\t\t\tearlier generations (to give) Insight to men and Guidance and\n\t\t\tMercy that they might receive admonition. 3375
Thou wast not on the Western Side when We decreed the commission\n\t\t\tto Moses nor wast thou a witness (of those events). 3376

But We raised up (new) generations and long were the ages that passed over them; but thou wast not a dweller among the people of Madyan rehearsing Our Signs to them; but it is We Who send apostles (with inspiration). 3377 3378

Nor wast thou at the side of (the Mountain of) Tur when We called (to Moses) Yet (art thou sent) as a Mercy from thy Lord to give warning to a people to whom no warner had come before thee: in order that they may receive admonition. 3379

If (We had) not (sent thee to the Quraish) in case a calamity should seize them for (the deeds) that their hands have sent forth they might say: "Our Lord! why didst Thou not send us an apostle? We should then have followed the Signs and been amongst those who believe!" 3380

But (now) when the Truth has come to them from Ourselves they say "Why are not (Signs) sent to him like those which were sent to Moses?" Do they not then reject (the Signs) which were formerly sent to Moses? They say: "Two kinds of sorcery each assisting the other!" And they say: "For us we reject all (such things)!" 3381 3382
Say: "Then bring ye a Book from Allah which is a better Guide\n\t\t\tthan either of them that I may follow it! (Do) if ye are\n\t\t\ttruthful!"

But if they hearken not to thee know that they only follow their own lusts: and who is more astray than one who follows his own lusts devoid of guidance from Allah? For Allah guides not people given to wrongdoing. 3383
Now have We caused the word to reach them themselves in order\n\t\t\tthat they may receive admonition. 3384
Those to whom We sent the Book before this they do believe in\n\t\t\tthis (Revelation);
And when it is recited to them they say: "We believe therein for\n\t\t\tit is the Truth from our Lord: indeed we have been Muslims\n\t\t\t(bowing to Allah's Will) from before this." 3385
Twice will they be given their reward for that they have\n\t\t\tpersevered that they avert Evil with Good and that they spend (in\n\t\t\tcharity) out of what We have given them. 3386
And when they hear vain talk they turn away therefrom and say:\n\t\t\t"To us our deeds and to you yours; peace be to you: we seek not\n\t\t\tthe ignorant." 3387
It is true thou wilt not be able to guide everyone whom thou\n\t\t\tlovest: but Allah guides those whom He will and He knows best\n\t\t\tthose who receive guidance. 3388

They say: "If we were to follow the guidance with thee we should be snatched away from our land." Have We not established for them a secure Sanctuary to which are brought as tribute fruits of all kinds? a provision from Ourselves? But most of them understand not. 3389
And how many populations We destroyed which exulted in their life (of ease and plenty)! Now those habitations of theirs after them are deserted all but a (miserable) few! and We are their heirs! 3390

Nor was thy Lord the one to destroy a population until He had
			sent to its Center an apostle rehearsing to them Our Signs: nor
			are We going to destroy a population except when its members
			practice iniquity.
The (material) things which ye are given are but the conveniences of this life and the glitter thereof; but that which is with Allah is better and more enduring: will ye not then be wise? 3391

Are (these two) alike? one to whom We have made a goodly promise and who is going to reach its (fulfillment) and one to whom we have given the good things of this life but who on the Day of Judgment is to be among those brought up (for punishment)? 3392
That Day Allah will call to them and say: "Where are my\n\t\t\t`partners'?  whom ye imagined (to be such)?"

Those against whom the charge will be proved will say: "Our Lord! these are the ones whom we led astray: we led them astray as we were astray ourselves: we free ourselves (from them) in Thy presence! It was not us they worshipped." 3393 3394

It will be said (to them): "Call upon your `partners' (for
			help)": they will call upon them but they will not listen to
			them; and they will see the Penalty (before them); (how they will
			wish) `If only they had been open to guidance!'
That Day (Allah) will call to them and say: "What was the answer\n\t\t\tye gave to the apostles?" 3395
Then the (whole) story that day will seem obscure to them (like\n\t\t\tlight to the blind) and they will not be able (even) to question\n\t\t\teach other. 3396
But any that (in this life) had repented believed and worked\n\t\t\trighteousness will have hopes to be among those who achieve\n\t\t\tsalvation.
Thy Lord does create and choose as He pleases: no choice have\n\t\t\tthey (in the matter): Glory to Allah! and far is He above the\n\t\t\tpartners they ascribe (to Him)! 3397
And thy Lord knows all that their hearts conceal and all that\n\t\t\tthey reveal. 3398
And He is Allah: there is no god but He.  To him be praise at the\n\t\t\tfirst and at the last: for Him is the Command and to Him shall ye\n\t\t\t(all) be brought back.
Say: see ye? If Allah were to make the Night perpetual over you\n\t\t\tto the Day of Judgment what god is there other than Allah who can\n\t\t\tgive you enlightenment? Will ye not then hearken? 3399
Say: see ye? If Allah were to make the Day perpetual over you to the Day of Judgment what god is there other than Allah who can give you a Night in which ye can rest? Will ye not then see? 3400
It is out of His Mercy that He has made for you Night and Day\n\t\t\tthat ye may rest therein and that ye may seek of His Grace and in\n\t\t\t;order that ye may be grateful.
The Day that He will call on them He will say: "Where are My\n\t\t\t`partners' whom ye imagined (to be such)?" 3401

And from each people shall We draw a witness and We shall say: "Produce your Proof": then shall they know that the Truth is in Allah (alone) and the (lies) which they invented will leave them in the lurch." 3402 3403

Qarun was doubtless of the people of Moses; but he acted insolently towards them: such were the treasures We had bestowed on him that their very keys would have been a burden to a body of strong men: Behold his people said to him: "Exult not for Allah loveth not those who exult (in riches). 3404 3405 3406

"But seek with the (wealth) which Allah has bestowed on thee the Home of the Hereafter nor forget thy portion in this world: but do thou good as Allah has been good to thee and seek not (occasions for) mischief in the land: for Allah loves not those who do mischief." 3407

He said: "This has been given to me because of a certain knowledge which I have." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him (whole) generations which were superior to him in strength and greater in amount (of riches) they had collected? But the wicked are not called (immediately) to account for their sins. 3408 3409

So he went forth among his people in the (pride of his worldly) glitter. Said those whose aim is the Life of this World: "Oh that we had the like of what Qarun has got! For he is truly a lord of mighty good fortune." 3410

But those who had been granted (true) knowledge said: "Alas for
			you! the reward of Allah (in the Hereafter) is best for those who
			believe and work righteousness: but this none shall attain save
			those who steadfastly persevere (in good)."
Then We caused the earth to swallow him up and his house; and he\n\t\t\thad not (the least little) party to help him against Allah nor\n\t\t\tcould he defend himself. 3411

And those who had envied his position the day before began to say on the morrow: "Ah! it is indeed Allah Who enlarges the provision or restricts it to any of His servants He pleases! Had it not been that Allah was gracious to us He could have caused the earth to swallow us up! Ah! those who reject Allah will assuredly never prosper." 3412
That House of the Hereafter We shall give to those who intend not\n\t\t\thigh-handedness or mischief on earth: and the End is (best) for\n\t\t\tthe righteous. 3413
If any does good the reward to him is better than his deed; but\n\t\t\tif any does evil the doers of evil are only punished (to the\n\t\t\textent) of their deeds. 3414
Verily He Who ordained the Qur'an for thee will bring thee back to the Place of Return. Say: "My Lord knows best who it is that brings true guidance and who is in manifest error." 3415 3416 3617
And thou hadst not expected that the Book would be sent to thee except as a Mercy from thy Lord: therefore lend not thou support in any way to those who reject (Allah's Message). 3418 3419
And let nothing keep thee back from the Signs of Allah after they have been revealed to thee: and invite (men) to thy Lord and be not of the company of those who join gods with Allah. 3420
And call not besides Allah on another god. There is no god but He. Everything (that exists) will perish except His own Face. To him belongs the Command and to him will ye (all) be brought back. 3421
Alif Lam Mim. 3422
Do men think that they will be left alone on saying "We believe"\n\t\t\tand that they will not be tested? 3423
We did test those before them and Allah will certainly know those\n\t\t\twho are true from those who are false. 3424
Do those who practice evil think that they will get the better of\n\t\t\tus? Evil is their judgment! 3425
For those whose hopes are in the meeting with Allah (in the Hereafter let them strive); for the Term (appointed) by Allah is surely coming: and He hears and knows (all things). 3426 3427
And if any strive (with might and main) they do so for their own\n\t\t\tsouls: for Allah is free of all needs from all creation.\n\t\t\t3428
Those who believe and work righteous deeds from them shall We\n\t\t\tblot out all evil (that may be) in them and We shall reward them\n\t\t\taccording to the best of their deeds. 3429

We have enjoined on man kindness to parents: but if they (either of them) strive (to force) thee to join with Me (in worship) anything of which thou hast no knowledge obey them not. Ye have (all) to return to Me and I will tell you (the truth) of all that ye did. 3430 3431
And those who believe and work righteous deeds them shall We\n\t\t\tadmit to the company of the Righteous. 3432

Then there are among men such as say "We believe in Allah"; but when they suffer affliction in (the cause of) Allah they treat men's oppression as if it were the Wrath of Allah! and if help comes (to thee) from thy Lord they are sure to say "We have (always) been with you!" Does not Allah know best all that is in the hearts of all Creation? 3433
And Allah most certainly knows those who believe and as certainly\n\t\t\tthose who are Hypocrites. 3434
And the Unbelievers say to those who believe: "Follow our path and we will bear (the consequences) of your faults." Never in the least will they bear their faults: in fact they are liars! 3435
They will bear their own burdens and (other) burdens along with\n\t\t\ttheir own and on the Day of Judgement they will be called to\n\t\t\taccount for their falsehoods. 3436
We (once) sent Noah to his people and he tarried among them a\n\t\t\tthousand years less fifty: but the Deluge overwhelmed them while\n\t\t\tthey (persisted in) sin. 3437
But We saved him and the Companions of the Ark and We made the\n\t\t\t(Ark) a Sign for all Peoples!
And (We also saved) Abraham: Behold he said to his people "Serve\n\t\t\tAllah and fear Him: that will be best for you if ye understand!\n\t\t\t3438

"For ye do worship idols besides Allah and ye invent falsehood. The things that ye worship besides Allah have no power to give you sustenance: then seek ye sustenance from Allah serve Him and be grateful to Him: to Him will be your return. 3439
"And if ye reject (the Message) so did generations before you:\n\t\t\tand the duty of the apostle is only to preach publicly (and\n\t\t\tclearly)."
See they not how Allah originates creation then repeats it: truly\n\t\t\tthat is easy for Allah. 3440
Say: "Travel through the earth and see how Allah did originate\n\t\t\tcreation: so will Allah produce a later creation: for Allah has\n\t\t\tpower over all things. 3441
"He punishes whom He pleases and He grants mercy to whom He\n\t\t\tpleases and towards Him are ye turned. 3442
"Not on earth nor in heaven will ye be able (fleeing) to\n\t\t\tfrustrate (His plan) nor have ye besides Allah any protector or\n\t\t\thelper."
Those who reject the Signs of Allah and the Meeting with Him (in\n\t\t\tthe Hereafter) it is they who shall despair of My mercy: it is\n\t\t\tthey who will (suffer) a most grievous Penalty. 3443
So naught was the answer of (Abraham's) people except that they said: "Slay him or burn him." But Allah did save him from the fire: verily in this are Signs for people who believe. 3444

And He said: "For you ye have taken (for worship) idols besides Allah out of mutual love and regard between yourselves in this life; but on the Day of Judgement ye shall disown each other and curse each other: and your abode will be the Fire and ye shall have none to help. 3445
But Lut had faith in Him: he said: "I will leave home for the\n\t\t\tsake of my Lord: for He is Exalted in Might and Wise."\n\t\t\t3446

And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous. 3447 3448
And (remember) Lut; behold he said to his people: "Ye do commit\n\t\t\tlewdness such as no people in Creation (ever) committed before\n\t\t\tyou. 3449

"Do ye indeed approach men and cut off the highway? And practice wickedness (even) in your councils?" But his people gave no answer but this: they said: "Bring us the Wrath of Allah if thou tellest the truth." 3450 3451
He said: "O my Lord! Help Thou me against people who do\n\t\t\tmischief!"
When Our Messengers came to Abraham with the good news they said:\n\t\t\t"We are indeed going to destroy the people of this township: for\n\t\t\ttruly they are (addicted to) crime." 3452 3453
He said: "But there is Lut there." They said: "Well do we know\n\t\t\twho is there: we will certainly save him and his following except\n\t\t\this wife: she is of those who lag behind!" 3454

And when Our Messengers came to Lut he was grieved on their account and felt himself powerless (to protect) them: but they said "Fear thou not nor grieve: we are (here) to save thee and thy following except thy wife: she is of those who lag behind. 3455
"For we are going to bring down on the people of this township a\n\t\t\tPunishment from heaven because they have been wickedly\n\t\t\trebellious." 3456
And We have left thereof an evident Sign for any people who (care\n\t\t\tto) understand. 3457
To the Madyan (people) (We sent) their brother Shu`aib.  Then he\n\t\t\tsaid: "O my people! serve Allah and fear the Last Day: nor commit\n\t\t\tevil on the earth with intent to do mischief."
But they rejected him: then the mighty Blast seized them and they\n\t\t\tlay prostrate in their homes by the morning. 3458

Remember also the `Ad and the Thamud (people): clearly will appear to you from (the traces) of their buildings (their fate): the Evil One made their deeds alluring to them and kept them back from the Path though they were gifted with Intelligence and Skill. 3459 3460
(Remember also) Qarun Pharaoh and Haman: there came to them Moses\n\t\t\twith Clear Signs but they behaved with insolence on the earth;\n\t\t\tyet they could not overreach (Us) . 3461

Each one of them We seized for his crime: of them against some We sent a violent tornado (with showers of stones); some were caught by a (mighty) Blast; some We caused the earth to swallow up; and some We drowned (in the waters): it was not Allah Who injured (or oppressed) them: they injured (and oppressed) their own souls. 3462 3463 3464 3465
The parable of those who take protectors other than Allah is that of the Spider who builds (to itself) a house; but truly the flimsiest of houses is the Spider's house if they but knew. 3466 3467
Verily Allah doth know of (everything) whatever that they call\n\t\t\tupon besides Him: and He is Exalted (in power) Wise.\n\t\t\t3468
And such are the Parables We set for mankind but only those\n\t\t\tunderstand them who have Knowledge. 3469
Allah created the heavens and the earth in true (proportions):\n\t\t\tverily in that is a Sign for those who believe. 3470

Recite what is sent of the Book by inspiration to thee and establish Regular Prayer: for Prayer restrains from shameful and unjust deeds; and remembrance of Allah is the greatest (thing in life) without doubt. And Allah knows the (deeds) that ye do. 3471

And dispute ye not with the People of the Book except with means better (than mere disputation) unless it be with those of them who inflict wrong (and injury): but say "We believe in the Revelation which has come down to us and in that which came down to you; Our Allah and your Allah is one; and it is to Him we bow (in Islam)." 3472 3473 3474
And thus (it is) that We have sent down the Book to thee. So the People of the Book believe therein as also do some of these (pagan Arabs): and none but Unbelievers reject Our Signs. 3475 3476 3477
And thou wast not (able) to recite a Book before this (Book came) nor art thou (able) to transcribe it with thy right hand: in that case indeed would the talkers of vanities have doubted. 3478
Nay here are Signs self-evident in the hearts of those endowed\n\t\t\twith knowledge: and none but the unjust reject Our Signs.\n\t\t\t3479 3480
Yet they say: "Why are not Signs sent down to him from his Lord?"\n\t\t\tSay: "The Signs are indeed with Allah: and I am indeed a clear\n\t\t\tWarner." 3481
And is it not enough for them that We have sent down to thee the\n\t\t\tBook which is rehearsed to them? Verily in it is Mercy and\n\t\t\tReminder to those who believe. 3482

Say: "Enough is Allah for a Witness between me and you: He knows what is in the heavens and on earth. And it is those who believe in vanities and reject Allah that will perish (in the end)." 3483 3484

They ask thee to hasten on the Punishment (for them): had it not been for a term (of respite) appointed the Punishment would certainly have come to them: and it will certainly reach them of a sudden while they perceive not! 3485
They ask thee to hasten on the Punishment but of a surety Hell\n\t\t\twill encompass the rejecters of Faith! 3486
On the Day that the Punishment shall cover them from above them\n\t\t\tand from below them and (a Voice) shall say: "Taste ye (the\n\t\t\tfruits) of your deeds!" 3487 3488
O My servants who believe! truly spacious is My Earth: therefore\n\t\t\tserve ye Me (and Me alone)! 3489
Every soul shall have a taste of death: in the end to Us shall ye\n\t\t\tbe brought back. 3490

But those who believe and work deeds of righteousness to them shall We give a Home in Heaven lofty mansions beneath which flow rivers--to dwell therein for aye; an excellent reward for those who do (good)! 3491
Those who persevere in patience and put their trust in their Lord\n\t\t\tand Cherisher.
How many are the creatures that carry not their own sustenance?\n\t\t\tIt is Allah Who feeds (both) them and you: for He hears and knows\n\t\t\t(all things). 3492

If indeed thou ask them who has created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon (to His Law); they will certainly reply "Allah." How are they then deluded away (from the truth)? 3493 3494
Allah enlarges the sustenance (which He gives) to whichever of His servants He pleases; and He (similarly) grants by (strict) measure (as He pleases): for Allah has full knowledge of all things. 3495

And if indeed thou ask them who it is that sends down rain from the sky and gives life therewith to the earth after its death they will certainly reply "Allah!" Say "Praise be to Allah!" But most of them understand not. 3496
What is the life of this world but amusement and play? But verily\n\t\t\tthe Home in the Hereafter that is life indeed if they but knew.\n\t\t\t3497

Now if they embark on a boat they call on Allah making their devotion sincerely (and exclusively) to Him; but when He had delivered them safely to (dry) land Behold they give a share (of their worship to others)! 3498
Disdaining ungratefully Our gifts and giving themselves up to\n\t\t\t(worldly) enjoyment! But soon will they know. 3499
Do they not then see that We have made a Sanctuary secure and that men are being snatched away from all around them? Then do they believe in that which is vain and reject the Grace of Allah? 3500
And who does more wrong than he who invents a lie against Allah\n\t\t\tor rejects the Truth when it reaches Him? Is there not a home in\n\t\t\tHell for those who reject Faith? 3501
And those who strive in Our (Cause) We will certainly guide them\n\t\t\tto Our Paths: for verily Allah is with those who do right.\n\t\t\t3502 3503
Alif Lam Mim. 3504
The Roman Empire has been defeated 3505
In a land close by; but they (even) after (this) defeat of theirs\n\t\t\twill soon be victorious 3506
Within a few years. With Allah is the Decision in the Past and\n\t\t\tin the Future: on that Day shall the Believers rejoice\n\t\t\t3507 3508
With the help of Allah. He helps whom He will and He is Exalted\n\t\t\tin Might Most Merciful. 3509
(It is) the promise of Allah. Never does Allah depart from His\n\t\t\tpromise: but most men understand not. 3510
They know but the outer (things) in the life of this world: but\n\t\t\tof the End of things they are heedless. 3511\n\t\t\t3512

Do they not reflect in their own minds? Not but for just ends and for a term appointed did Allah create the heavens and the earth and all between them: yet are there truly many among men who deny the meeting with their Lord (at the Resurrection)! 3513 3514

Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of those before them? They were superior to them in strength: they tilled the soil and populated it in greater numbers than these have done: there came to them their apostles with Clear (Signs) (which they rejected to their own destruction): it was not Allah Who wronged them but they wronged their own souls. 3515
In the long run evil in the extreme will be the End of those who\n\t\t\tdo evil; for that they rejected the Signs of Allah and held them\n\t\t\tup to ridicule. 3516
It is Allah Who begins (the process of) creation; then repeats\n\t\t\tit; then shall ye be brought back to Him. 3517
On the Day that the Hour will be established the guilty will be\n\t\t\tstruck dumb with despair. 3518
No intercessor will they have among their "Partners" and they\n\t\t\twill (themselves) reject their "Partners." 3519
On the Day that the Hour will be established that Day shall (all\n\t\t\tmen) be sorted out. 3520
Then those who have believed and worked righteous deeds shall be\n\t\t\tmade happy in a Mead of Delight.
And those who have rejected Faith and falsely denied Our Signs\n\t\t\tand the meeting of the Hereafter such shall be brought forth to\n\t\t\tPunishment.
So (give) glory to Allah when ye reach eventide and when ye rise\n\t\t\tin the morning; 3521
Yea To Him be praise in the heavens and on earth; and in the late\n\t\t\tafternoon and when the day begins to decline.
It is He Who brings out the living from the dead and brings out the dead from the living and Who gives life to the earth after it is dead: and thus shall ye be brought out (from the dead). 3522 3523
Among His Signs is this that He created you from dust; and then\n\t\t\tBehold ye are men scattered (far and wide)! 3524

And among His Signs is this that He created for you mates from among yourselves that ye may dwell in tranquillity with them and He has put love and mercy between your (hearts); verily in that are Signs for those who reflect. 3525 3526
And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth\n\t\t\tand the variations in your languages and your colors: verily in\n\t\t\tthat are Signs for those who know. 3527
And among His Signs is the sleep that ye take by night and by day and the quest that ye (make for livelihood) out of His Bounty: verily in that are Signs for those who hearken. 3528 3529

And among His Signs He shows you the lightning by way both of fear and of hope and He sends down rain from the sky and with it gives life to the earth after it is dead: verily in that are Signs for those who are wise. 3530
And among His Signs is this that heaven and earth stand by His\n\t\t\tCommand: then when He calls you by a single call from the earth\n\t\t\tbehold ye (straightway) come forth. 3531
To Him belongs every being that is in the heavens and on earth:\n\t\t\tall are devoutly obedient to Him. 3532

It is He Who begins (the process of) creation; then repeats it; and for Him it is most easy. To Him belongs the loftiest similitude (We can think of) in the heavens and the earth: for He is Exalted in Might Full of Wisdom. 3533 3534

He does propound to you a similitude from your own (experience): do ye have partners among those whom your right hands possess to share as equals in the wealth We have bestowed on you? Do ye fear them as ye fear each other? Thus do We explain the Signs in detail to a people that understand. 3535 3536 3537 3538
Nay the wrong-doers (merely) fellow their own lusts being devoid\n\t\t\tof knowledge. But who will guide those whom Allah leaves astray?\n\t\t\tTo them there will be no helpers. 3539

So set thou thy face steadily and truly to the Faith: (Establish) Allah's handiwork according to the pattern on which He has made mankind: no change (let there be) in the work (wrought) by Allah: that is the standard Religion: but most among mankind understand not. 3540 3541 3542
Turn ye back in repentance to Him and fear Him: establish regular\n\t\t\tprayers and be not ye among those who join gods with Allah,\n\t\t\t3543
Those who split up their Religion and become (mere) Sects each\n\t\t\tparty rejoicing in that which is with itself! 3544

When trouble touches men they cry to their Lord turning back to Him in repentance: but when He gives them a taste of Mercy as from Himself behold some of them pay part-worship to other gods besides their Lord. 3545
(As if) to show their ingratitude for the (favors) We have\n\t\t\tbestowed on them! Then enjoy (your brief day); but soon will ye\n\t\t\tknow (your folly). 3546
Or have We sent down authority to them which points out to them\n\t\t\tthe things to which they pay part-worship? 3547
When We give men a taste of Mercy they exult thereat: and when\n\t\t\tsome evil afflicts them because of what their (own) hands have\n\t\t\tsent forth behold they are in despair! 3548
See they not that Allah enlarges the provision and restricts it\n\t\t\tto whomsoever He pleases? Verily in that are Signs for those who\n\t\t\tbelieve. 3549
So give what is due to kindred the needy and the wayfarer. That\n\t\t\tis best for those who seek the Countenance of Allah and it is\n\t\t\tthey who will prosper. 3550 3551

That which ye lay out for increase through the property of (other) people will have no increase with Allah: but that which ye lay out for charity seeking the Countenance of Allah (will increase): it is these who will get a recompense multiplied. 3552 3553

It is Allah Who has created you: further He has provided for your sustenance; then He will cause you to die; and again He will give you life. Are there any of your (false) "Partners" who can do any single one of these things? Glory to Him! and High is He above the partners they attribute (to Him)! 3554 3555

Mischief has appeared on land and sea because of (the meed) that the hands of men have earned that (Allah) may give them a taste of some of their deeds: in order that they may turn back (from Evil). 3556 3557
Say: "Travel through the earth and see what was the End of those\n\t\t\tbefore (you): most of them worshipped others besides Allah."\n\t\t\t3558
But set thou thy face to the right Religion before there come\n\t\t\tfrom Allah the Day which there is no chance of averting: on that\n\t\t\tDay shall men be divided (in two). 3559 3560
Those who reject Faith will suffer from that rejection: and those\n\t\t\twho work righteousness will spread their couch (of repose) for\n\t\t\tthemselves (in heaven):
That He may reward those who believe and work righteous deeds out\n\t\t\tof His Bounty: for He loves not those who reject Faith.\n\t\t\t3561 3562

Among His Signs is this that He sends the Winds as heralds of Glad Tidings giving you a taste of His (Grace and) Mercy that the ships may sail (majestically) by His Command and that ye may seek of His Bounty: in order that ye may be grateful. 3563 3564 3565

We did indeed send before thee apostles to their (respective)
			peoples and they came to them with Clear Signs: then to those who
			transgressed We meted out Retribution: and it was due from us to
			aid those who believed.

It is Allah Who sends the Winds and they raise the Clouds: then does He spread them in the sky as He wills and break them into fragments until thou seest rain-drops issue from the midst thereof: then when He has made them reach such of his servants as He wills behold they do rejoice! 3566 3567
Even though before they received (the rain) just before this they\n\t\t\twere dumb with despair!

Then contemplate (O man!) the memorials of Allah's Mercy! How He gives life to the earth after its death: verily the Same will give life to the men who are dead: for He has power over all things. 3568
And if We (but) send a Wind from which they see (their tilth)\n\t\t\tturn yellow behold they become thereafter ungrateful\n\t\t\t(Unbelievers)! 3569
So verily thou canst not make the dead to hear nor canst thou\n\t\t\tmake the deaf to hear the call when they show their backs and\n\t\t\tturn away. 3570
Nor canst thou lead back the blind from their straying: only\n\t\t\tthose wilt thou make to hear who believe in Our Signs and submit\n\t\t\t(their wills in Islam). 3571

It is Allah Who created you in a state of (helpless) weakness then gave (you) strength after weakness then after strength give (you) weakness and a hoary head: He creates as He wills and it is He Who has all knowledge and power. 3572
On the Day that the Hour (of reckoning) will be established the\n\t\t\ttransgressors will swear that they tarried not but an hour: thus\n\t\t\twere they used to being deluded! 3573
But those endued with knowledge and faith will say: "Indeed ye did tarry within Allah's Decree to the Day of Resurrection and this is the Day of Resurrection: but ye ye were not aware!" 3574
So on that Day no excuse of theirs will avail the Transgressors\n\t\t\tnor will they be invited (then) to seek grace (by repentance).\n\t\t\t3575
Verily We have propounded for men in this Qur'an every kind of\n\t\t\tParable: but if thou bring to them any Sign the Unbelievers are\n\t\t\tsure to say "Ye do nothing but talk vanities." 3576
Thus does Allah seal up the hearts of those who understand not.\n\t\t\t3577
So patiently persevere: for verily the promise of Allah is true:\n\t\t\tnor let those shake thy firmness who have (themselves) no\n\t\t\tcertainty of faith. 3578
Alif Lam Mim. 3579
These are Verses of the Wise Book, 3580
A Guide and a Mercy to the Doers of Good, 3581
Those who establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity and\n\t\t\thave (in their hearts) the assurance of the Hereafter.\n\t\t\t3582
These are on (true) guidance from their Lord; and these are the\n\t\t\tones who will prosper. 3583

But there are among men those who purchase idle tales without knowledge (or meaning) to mislead (men) from the Path of Allah and throw ridicule (on the Path): for such there will be a humiliating Penalty. 3584
When Our Signs are rehearsed to such a one he turns away in\n\t\t\tarrogance as if he heard them not as if there were deafness in\n\t\t\tboth his ears: announce to him a grievous Penalty. 3585
For those who believe and work righteous deeds there will be\n\t\t\tGardens of Bliss.
To dwell therein. The promise of Allah is true: and He is\n\t\t\tExalted in power Wise. 3586

He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature in pairs. 3587 3588 3589 3590 3591
Such is the Creation of Allah: now show Me what is there that\n\t\t\tothers besides Him have created: nay but the Transgressors are in\n\t\t\tmanifest error. 3592

We bestowed (in the past) wisdom on Luqman: "Show (thy) gratitude to Allah." Any who is (so) grateful does so to the profit of his own soul: but if any is ungrateful verily Allah is free of all wants worthy of all praise. 3593 3594
Behold Luqman said to his son by way of instruction: "O my son!\n\t\t\tJoin not in worship (others) with Allah: for false worship is\n\t\t\tindeed the highest wrong-doing." 3595

And We have enjoined on man (to be good) to his parents: in travail upon travail did his mother bear him and in years twain was his weaning: (hear the command) "Show gratitude to Me and to thy parents: to Me is (thy final) Goal. 3596

"But if they strive to make the join in worship with Me things of which thou hast no knowledge obey them not; Yet bear them company in this life with justice (and consideration) and follow the way of those who turn to Me (in love): in the End the return of you all is to Me and I will tell you the truth (and meaning) of all that ye did." 3597 3598 3599

"O my son!" (said Luqman) "If there be (but) the weight of a mustard-seed and it were (hidden) in a rock or (anywhere) in the heavens or on earth Allah will bring it forth: for Allah understands the finest mysteries (and) is well-acquainted (with them). 3600 3601 3602

"O my son! establish regular prayer enjoin what is just and
			forbid what is wrong: and bear with patient constancy whatever
			betide thee; for this is firmness (of purpose) in (the conduct
			of) affairs.
"And swell not thy cheek (for pride) at men nor walk in insolence\n\t\t\tthrough the earth; for Allah loveth not any arrogant boaster.\n\t\t\t3603
"And be moderate in thy pace and lower thy voice; for the\n\t\t\tharshest of sounds without doubt is the braying of the ass."\n\t\t\t3604

Do ye not see that Allah has subjected to your (use) all things in the heavens and on earth and has made His bounties flow to you in exceeding measure (both) seen and unseen? Yet there are among men those who dispute about Allah without knowledge and without guidance and without a Book to enlighten them! 3605 3606 3607

When they are told to follow the (revelation) that Allah has sent down they say: "Nay we shall follow the ways that we found our fathers (following)." What! even if it is Satan beckoning them to the Penalty of the (Blazing) Fire! 3608
Whoever submits his whole self to Allah and is a doer of good has grasped indeed the most trustworthy hand-hold: and with Allah rests the End and Decision of (all) affairs. 3609 3610

But if any reject Faith let not his rejection grieve thee: to Us\n\t\t\tis their return and We shall tell them the truth of their deeds:\n\t\t\tfor Allah knows well all that is in (men's) hearts. 3611
We grant them their pleasure for a little while: in the end shall\n\t\t\tWe drive them to a chastisement unrelenting. 3612
If thou ask them who it is that created the heavens and the earth\n\t\t\tthey will certainly say "Allah." Say: "Praise be to Allah!" But\n\t\t\tmost of them understand not. 3613 3614
To Allah belong all things in heaven and earth: verily Allah is\n\t\t\tHe (that is) free of all wants worthy of all praise.\n\t\t\t3615

And if all the trees on earth were pens and the Ocean (were ink) with seven Oceans behind it to add to its (supply) yet would not the Words of Allah be exhausted (in the writing): for Allah is Exalted in power Full of Wisdom. 3616
And your creation or your resurrection is in no wise but as an\n\t\t\tindividual soul: for Allah is He Who hears and sees (all things).\n\t\t\t3617

Seest thou not that Allah merges Night into Day and He merges Day into Night; that He has subjected the sun and the moon (to His Law) each running its course for a term appointed: and that Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do? 3618
That is because Allah is the (only) Reality and because whatever\n\t\t\telse they invoke besides Him is Falsehood; and because Allah He\n\t\t\tis the Most High Most Great. 3619
Seest thou not that the ships sail through the Ocean by the grace of Allah? That He may show you of His Signs? Verily in this are Signs for all who constantly persevere and give thanks. 3620

When a wave covers them like the canopy (of clouds) they call to Allah offering Him sincere devotion. But when He has delivered them safely to land there are among them those that halt between (right and wrong). But none reject Our Signs except only a perfidious ungrateful (wretch)! 3621 3622

O mankind! do your duty to your Lord and fear (the coming of) a Day when no father can avail aught for his son nor a son avail aught for his father. Verily the promise of Allah is true: let not then this present life deceive you nor let the Chief Deceiver deceive you about Allah. 3623 3624

Verily the knowledge of the Hour is with Allah (alone). It is He Who sends down rain and He Who knows what is in the wombs. Nor does anyone know what it is that he will earn on the morrow: nor does anyone know in what land he is to die. Verily with Allah is full knowledge and He is acquainted (with all things). 3625 3626 3627
Alif Lam Mim. 3628
(This is) the revelation of the Book in which there is no doubt, \n\t\t\tfrom the Lord of the Worlds. 3629
Or do they say "He has forged it"? Nay it is the Truth from the Lord that thou mayest admonish a people to whom no warner has come before thee: in order that they may receive guidance. 3630 3631

It is Allah Who has created the heavens and the earth and all between them in six Days and is firmly established on the Throne (of authority): ye have none besides Him to protect or intercede (for you): will ye not then receive admonition? 3632 3633
He rules (all) affairs from the heavens to the earth: in the end\n\t\t\twill (all affairs) go up to Him on a Day the space whereof will\n\t\t\tbe (as) a thousand years of your reckoning. 3634
Such as He the knower of all things hidden and open the Exalted\n\t\t\t(in power) the Merciful; 3635
He Who has made everything which He has created most Good. He\n\t\t\tbegan the creation of man with (nothing more than) clay\n\t\t\t3636 3637
And made his progeny from a quintessence of the nature of a fluid\n\t\t\tdespised: 3638

But He fashioned him in due proportion and breathed into him something of His spirit. And He gave you (the faculties of) hearing and sight and feeling (and understanding): little thanks do ye give! 3639 3640
And they say: "What! when we lie hidden and lost in the earth\n\t\t\tshall we indeed be in a creation renewed?" Nay they deny the\n\t\t\tmeeting with their Lord! 3641
Say: "The Angel of Death put in charge of you will (duly) take\n\t\t\tyour souls: then shall ye be brought back to your Lord."\n\t\t\t3642

If only thou couldst see when the guilty ones will bend low their heads before their Lord (saying:) "Our Lord! We have seen and we have heard: now then send us back (to the world): we will work righteousness: for we do indeed (now) believe." 3643
If We had so willed We could certainly have brought every soul its true guidance: but the Word from Me will come true. "I will fill Hell with Jinns and men all together." 3644 3645
"Taste ye then for ye forgot the meeting of this day of yours and\n\t\t\tWe too will forget you taste ye the Penalty of Eternity for your\n\t\t\t(evil) deeds!" 3646
Only those believe in Our Signs who when they are recited to them\n\t\t\tfall down in adoration and celebrate the praises of their Lord\n\t\t\tnor are they (ever) puffed up with pride. 3647
Their limbs do forsake their beds of sleep the while they call on their Lord in Fear and Hope: and they spend (in charity) out of the sustenance which We have bestowed on them. 3648 3649
Now no person knows what delights of the eye are kept hidden (in\n\t\t\treserve) for them as a reward for their (good) Deeds.\n\t\t\t3650
Is then the man who believes no better than the man who is\n\t\t\trebellious and wicked? No equal are they. 3651
For those who believe and do righteous deeds are Gardens as\n\t\t\thospitable homes for their (good) deeds. 3652

As to those who are rebellious and wicked their abode will be the Fire: every time they wish to get away therefrom they will be forced thereinto and it will be said to them: "taste ye the Penalty of the Fire the which ye were wont to reject as false. 3653
And indeed We will make them taste of the Penalty of this (life)\n\t\t\tprior to the supreme Penalty in order that they may (repent and)\n\t\t\treturn. 3654
And who does more wrong than one to whom are recited the Signs of\n\t\t\this Lord and who then turns away therefrom? Verily from those who\n\t\t\ttransgress We shall exact (Due) Retribution. 3655
We did indeed aforetime give the Book to Moses: be not then in\n\t\t\tdoubt of its reaching (thee): and We made it a guide to the\n\t\t\tChildren of Israel. 3656 3657
And We appointed from among them Leaders giving guidance under\n\t\t\tOur command so long as they persevered with patience and\n\t\t\tcontinued to have faith in Our Signs. 3658
Verily thy Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgement\n\t\t\tin the matters wherein they differ (among themselves).\n\t\t\t3659
Does it not teach them a lesson how many generations We destroyed before them in whose dwellings they (now) go to and fro? Verily in that are Signs: do they not then listen? 3660 3661
And do they not see that We do drive Rain to parched soil (bare of herbage) and produce therewith crops providing food for their cattle and themselves? Have they not the vision? 3662 3663
They say: "When will this decision be if ye are telling the\n\t\t\ttruth?" 3664
Say: "On the Day of Decision no profit will it be to Unbelievers\n\t\t\tif they (then) believe! Nor will they be granted a respite."
So turn away from them and wait: they too are waiting.\n\t\t\t3665
O Prophet! Fear Allah and hearken not to the Unbelievers and the\n\t\t\tHypocrites: verily Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom.\n\t\t\t3666
But follow that which comes to thee by inspiration from thy Lord:\n\t\t\tfor Allah is well acquainted with (all) that ye do. 3667
And put thy trust in Allah and enough is Allah as a Disposer of\n\t\t\taffairs. 3668

Allah has not made for any man two hearts in his (one) body: nor has He made your wives whom ye divorce by Zihar your mothers: nor has He made your adopted sons your sons. Such is (only) your (manner of) speech by your mouths. But Allah tells (you) the Truth and He shows the (right) Way. 3669 3670 3671

Call them by (the names) of their fathers: that is juster in the sight of Allah but if ye know not their father's (names call them) your Brothers in faith or your Maulas. But there is no blame on you if ye make a mistake therein: (what counts is) the intention of your hearts: and Allah is Oft-Returning Most Merciful. 3672 3673

The Prophet is closer to the Believers than their own selves and his wives are their mothers. Blood-relations among each other have closer personal ties in the Decree of Allah than (the Brotherhood of) Believers and Muhajirs: nevertheless do ye what is just to your closest friends: such is the writing in the Decree (of Allah). 3674 3675 3676
And remember We took from the Prophets their Covenant as (We did)\n\t\t\tfrom thee: from Noah Abraham Moses and Jesus the son of Mary: We\n\t\t\ttook from them a solemn Covenant: 3677
That (Allah) may question the (Custodians) of Truth concerning\n\t\t\tthe Truth they (were charged with): and He has prepared for the\n\t\t\tUnbelievers a grievous Penalty. 3678

O ye who believe! Remember the Grace of Allah (bestowed) on you when there came down on you hosts (to overwhelm you): but We sent against them a hurricane and force that ye saw not. But Allah sees (clearly) all that ye do. 3679 3680 3681
Behold! they came on you from above you and from below you and behold the eyes became dim and the hearts gaped up to the throats and ye imagined various (vain) thoughts about Allah! 3682
In that situation were the Believers tried: they were shaken as\n\t\t\tby a tremendous shaking.
And behold! the Hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease\n\t\t\t(even) say: "Allah and His Apostle promised us nothing but\n\t\t\tdelusion!" 3683

Behold! a party among them said: "Ye men of Yathrib! Ye cannot stand (the attack)! Therefore go back!" and a band of them ask for leave of the Prophet saying "Truly our houses are bare and exposed" though they were not exposed: they intended nothing but to run away. 3684
And if an entry had been effected to them from the sides of the (City) and they had been incited to sedition they would certainly have brought it to pass with none but a brief delay! 3685
And yet they had already covenanted with Allah not to turn their\n\t\t\tbacks and a covenant with Allah must (surely) be answered for.\n\t\t\t3686
Say: "Running away will not profit you if ye are running away\n\t\t\tfrom death or slaughter; and even if (ye do escape) no more than\n\t\t\ta brief (respite) will ye be allowed to enjoy!" 3687
Say: "Who is it that can screen you from Allah if it be His wish to give you Punishment or to give you Mercy?" Nor will they find for themselves besides Allah any protector or helper. 3688
Verily Allah knows those among you who keep back (men) and those\n\t\t\twho say to their brethren "Come along to us" but come not to the\n\t\t\tfight except for just a little while.

Covetous over you. Then when fear comes thou wilt see them looking to thee their eyes revolving like (those of) one over whom hovers death: but when the fear is past they will smite you with sharp tongues covetous of goods. Such men have no faith and so Allah has made their deeds of none effect: and that is easy for Allah. 3689 3690 3691 3692

They think that the Confederates have not withdrawn; and if the Confederates should come (again) they would wish they were in the deserts (wandering) among the Bedouins and seeking news about you (from a safe distance); and if they were in your midst they would fight but little. 3693
Ye have indeed in the Apostle of Allah a beautiful pattern of (conduct) for anyone whose hope is in Allah and the Final Day and who engages much in the praise of Allah. 3694 3695

When the Believers saw the Confederate forces they said: "This is what Allah and His Apostle had promised us and Allah and his Apostle told us what was true." And it only added to their faith and their zeal in obedience. 3696

Among the Believers are men who have been true to their Covenant with Allah: of them some have completed their vow to (the extreme) and some (still) wait: but they have never changed (their determination) in the least: 3697
That Allah may reward the men of Truth for their Truth and punish\n\t\t\tthe Hypocrites if that be His Will or turn to them in Mercy: for\n\t\t\tAllah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. 3698

And Allah turned back the Unbelievers for (all) their fury: no advantage did they gain and enough is Allah for the Believers in their fight. And Allah is full of Strength Able to enforce His Will. 3699 3700

And those of the people of the Book who aided them Allah did take them down from their strongholds and cast terror into their hearts (so that) some ye slew and some ye made prisoners. 3701 3702 3703 3704
And He made you heirs of their lands their houses and their goods\n\t\t\tand of a land which ye had not frequented (before). And Allah\n\t\t\thas power over all things. 3705
O Prophet! say to thy Consorts: "If it be that ye desire the life\n\t\t\tof this world and its glitter then come! I will provide for your\n\t\t\tenjoyment and set you free in a handsome manner." 3706
But if ye seek Allah and His Apostle and the Home of the\n\t\t\tHereafter verily Allah has prepared for the well-doers amongst\n\t\t\tyou a great reward. 3707
O Consorts of the Prophet! if any of you were guilty of evident\n\t\t\tunseemly conduct the Punishment would be doubled to her and that\n\t\t\tis easy for Allah. 3708 3709
But any of you that is devout in the service of Allah and His Apostle and works righteousness to her shall We grant her reward twice: and We have prepared for her a generous Sustenance. 3710 3711

O Consorts of the Prophet! ye are not like any of the (other) women: if ye do fear (Allah) be not too complaisant of speech lest one in whose heart is a disease should be moved with desire: but speak ye a speech (that is) just. 3712 3713

And stay quietly in your houses and make not a dazzling display like that of the former Times of Ignorance; and establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity; and obey Allah and His Apostle. And Allah only wishes to remove all abomination from you ye Members of the Family and to make you pure and spotless. 3714 3715
And recite what is rehearsed to you in your homes of the Signs of\n\t\t\tAllah and His wisdom: for Allah understands the finest mysteries\n\t\t\tand is well-acquainted (with them). 3716 3717

For Muslim men and women for believing men and women for devout men and women for true men and women for men and women who are patient and constant for men and women who humble themselves for men and women who give in charity for men and women who fast (and deny themselves) for men and women who guard their chastity and for men and women who engage much in Allah's praise for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and great reward. 3718 3719 3720

It is not fitting for a Believer man or woman when a matter has been decided by Allah and His Apostle to have any option about their decision: if anyone disobeys Allah and His Apostle he is indeed on a clearly wrong Path. 3721

Behold! thou didst say to one who had received the grace of Allah and thy favor: "Retain thou (in wedlock) thy wife and fear Allah." But thou didst hide in thy heart that which Allah was about to make manifest: thou didst fear the people but it is more fitting that thou shouldst fear Allah. Then when Zaid had dissolved (his marriage) with her with the necessary (formality) We joined her in marriage to thee: in order that (in future) there may be no difficulty to the Believers in (the matter of) marriage with the wives of their adopted sons when the latter have dissolved with the necessary (formality) (their marriage) with them: and Allah's command must be fulfilled. 3722 3723 3724 3725 3726

There can be no difficulty to the Prophet in what Allah has indicated to him as a duty. It was the practice (approved) of Allah amongst those of old that have passed away and the command of Allah is a decree determined. 3727 3728 3729
(It is the practice of those) who preach the Messages of Allah\n\t\t\tand fear Him and fear none but Allah: and enough is Allah to call\n\t\t\t(men) to account. 3730
Muhammad is not the father of any of your men but (he is) the\n\t\t\tApostle of Allah and the Seal of the Prophets: and Allah has full\n\t\t\tknowledge of all things. 3731
O ye who believe! celebrate the praises of Allah and do this\n\t\t\toften;
And glorify Him morning and evening.
He it is Who sends blessings on you as do His angels that He may\n\t\t\tbring you out from the depths of Darkness into Light: and He is\n\t\t\tFull of Mercy to the Believers. 3732 3733
Their salutation on the Day they meet Him will be "peace!": and\n\t\t\tHe has prepared for them a generous Reward.
O Prophet! Truly We have sent thee as a Witness a Bearer of Glad\n\t\t\tTidings and a Warner 3734
And as one who invites to Allah's (Grace) by His leave and as a\n\t\t\tLamp spreading Light. 3735
Then give the glad tidings to the Believers that they shall have\n\t\t\tfrom Allah a very great Bounty. 3736
And obey not (the behests) of the Unbelievers and the Hypocrites\n\t\t\tand heed not their annoyances but put thy trust in Allah for\n\t\t\tenough is Allah as a Disposer of affairs. 3737

O ye who believe! when ye marry believing women and then divorce them before ye have touched them no period of `Iddah have ye to count in respect of them: so give them a present and set them free in a handsome manner. 3738 3739 3740

O prophet! We have made lawful to thee thy wives to whom thou hast paid their dowers; and those whom thy right hand possesses out of the prisoners of war whom Allah has assigned to thee; and daughters of thy paternal uncles and aunts and daughters of thy maternal uncles and aunts who migrated (from Mecca) with thee; and any believing woman who dedicates her soul to the Prophet if the Prophet wishes to wed her this only for thee and not for the Believers (at large); We know what We have appointed for them as to their wives and the captives whom their right hands possess in order that there should be no difficulty for Thee. And Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. 3741 3742 3743 3744 3745 3746 3747 3748

Thou mayest defer (the turn of) any of them that thou pleasest and thou mayest receive any thou pleasest: and there is no blame on thee if thou invite one whose (turn) thou hadst set aside. This were nigher to the cooling of their eyes the prevention of their grief and their satisfaction--that of all of them--with that which thou hast to give them: and Allah knows (all) that is in your hearts: and Allah is All-Knowing Most Forbearing. 3749 3750 3751 3752 3753

It is not lawful for thee (to marry more) women after this nor to change them for (other) wives even though their beauty attract thee except any thy right hand should possess (as handmaidens): and Allah doth watch over all things. 3754

O ye who Believe! enter not the Prophet's houses until leave is given you for a meal (and then) not (so early as) to wait for its preparation: but when ye are invited enter; and when ye have taken your meal disperse without seeking familiar talk. Such (behavior) annoys the Prophet: He is ashamed to dismiss you but Allah is not ashamed (to tell you) the truth. And when ye ask (his ladies) for anything ye want ask them from before a screen: that makes for greater purity for your hearts and for theirs. Nor is it right for you that ye should annoy Allah's Apostle or that ye should marry his widows after him at any time. Truly such a thing is in Allah's sight an enormity. 3755 3756 3757 3758
Whether ye reveal anything or conceal it verily Allah has full\n\t\t\tknowledge of all things. 3759

There is no blame (on these ladies if they appear) before their fathers or their sons their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women or the (slaves) whom their right hands possess. And (ladies) fear Allah: for Allah is Witness to all things. 3360
Allah and His angels send blessings on the Prophet: O ye that\n\t\t\tbelieve! send ye blessings on him and salute him with all\n\t\t\trespect. 3761
Those who annoy Allah and his Apostle Allah has cursed them in\n\t\t\tthis world and in the Hereafter and has prepared for them a\n\t\t\thumiliating Punishment. 3762
And those who annoy believing men and women undeservedly bear (on\n\t\t\tthemselves) a calumny and a glaring sin. 3763

O prophet! tell thy wives and daughters and the believing women that they should cast their outer garments over their persons (when abroad): that is most convenient that they should be known (as such) and not molested: and Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. 3764 3765 3766 3767

Truly if the Hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease and those who stir up sedition in the City desist not We shall certainly stir thee up against them: then will they not be able to stay in it as thy neighbors for any length of time: 3768
They shall have a curse on them: wherever they are found they\n\t\t\tshall be seized and slain (without mercy). 3769
(Such was) the practice (approved) of Allah among those who lived\n\t\t\taforetime: no change wilt thou find in the practice (approved) of\n\t\t\tAllah. 3770
Men ask thee concerning the Hour: say "The knowledge thereof is\n\t\t\twith Allah (alone)": and what will make thee understand?\n\t\t\tPerchance the Hour is nigh! 3771
Verily Allah has cursed the Unbelievers and prepared for them a\n\t\t\tBlazing Fire
To dwell therein forever: no protector will they find nor helper.
The Day that their faces will be turned upside down in the Fire\n\t\t\tthey will say: "Woe to us! would that we had obeyed Allah and\n\t\t\tobeyed the Apostle!" 3772
And they would say: "Our Lord! we obeyed our chiefs and our great\n\t\t\tones and they misled us as to the (right) path.
"Our Lord! give them Double Penalty and curse them with a very\n\t\t\tgreat Curse!" 3773
O ye who believe! be ye not like those who vexed and insulted\n\t\t\tMoses but Allah cleared him of the (calumnies) they had uttered:\n\t\t\tand he was honorable in Allah's sight. 3774
O ye who believe! fear Allah and (always) say a word directed to\n\t\t\tthe Right: 3775
That He may make your conduct whole and sound and forgive you\n\t\t\tyour sins: he that obeys Allah and His Apostle has already\n\t\t\tattained the highest Achievement. 3776

We did indeed offer the Trust to the Heavens and the Earth and the Mountains: but they refused to undertake it being afraid thereof: but man undertook it he was indeed unjust and foolish 3777 3778 3779 3780 3781 3782

(With the result) that Allah has to punish the Hypocrites men and women and the Unbelievers men and women and Allah turns in Mercy to the Believers men and women: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. 3783 3784
Praise be to Allah to Whom belong all things in the heavens and\n\t\t\ton earth: to Him be Praise in the Hereafter: and He is Full of\n\t\t\tWisdom acquainted with all things. 3785
He knows all that goes into the earth and all that comes out thereof; all that comes down from the sky and all that ascends thereto: and He is the Most Merciful the Oft-Forgiving. 3786 3787

The Unbelievers say "Never to us will come the hour": say "Nay! but most surely by my Lord it will come upon you by Him Who knows the unseen from Whom is not hidden the least little atom in the Heavens or on earth: nor is there anything less than that or greater but is in the Record Perspicuous: 3788 3789 3790
That He may reward those who believe and work deeds of\n\t\t\trighteousness: for such is Forgiveness and a Sustenance Most\n\t\t\tGenerous." 3791
But those who strive against Our Signs to frustrate them for such\n\t\t\twill be a Penalty a Punishment most humiliating. 3792
And those to whom knowledge has come see that the (Revelation) sent down to thee from thy Lord that is the Truth and that it guides to the Path of the Exalted (in Might) Worthy of all praise. 3793
The Unbelievers say (in ridicule): "Shall we point out to you a man that will tell you when ye are all scattered to pieces in disintegration that ye shall (then be raised) in a New Creation? 3794
"Has he invented a falsehood against Allah or has a spirit\n\t\t\t(seized) him?" Nay it is those who believe not in the Hereafter\n\t\t\tthat are in (real) Penalty and in farthest Error. 3795

See they not what is before them and behind them of the sky and the earth? If We wished We could cause the earth to swallow them up or cause a piece of the sky to fall upon them. Verily in this is a Sign for every devotee that turns to Allah (in repentance). 3796 3797 3798
We bestowed Grace aforetime on David from Ourselves: "O ye Mountains! sing ye back the Praises of Allah with him! and ye birds (also)! and We made the iron soft for Him 3799 3800
(Commanding) "Make thou coats of mail balancing well the rings of\n\t\t\tchain armor and work ye righteousness; for be sure I see\n\t\t\t(clearly) all that ye do." 3801 3802

And to Solomon (We made) the Wind (obedient): its early morning (stride) was a month's (journey) and its evening (stride) was a month's (journey); and We made a Font of molten brass to flow for him; and there were Jinns that worked in front of him by the leave of his Lord and if any of them turned aside from Our command We made Him taste of the Penalty of the Blazing Fire. 3803 3804 3805

They worked for him as he desired (making) Arches Images Basins as large as Reservoirs and (cooking) Cauldrons fixed (in their places): "Work ye sons of David with thanks! But few of My servants are grateful!" 3806 3807

Then when We decreed (Solomon's) death nothing showed them his death except a little worm of the earth which kept (slowly) gnawing away at his staff: so when he fell down the Jinns saw plainly that if they had known the unseen they would not have tarried in the humiliating Penalty (of their Task). 3808 3809

There was for Saba' aforetime a Sign in their homeland two Gardens to the right and to the left. Eat of the Sustenance (provided) by your Lord and be grateful to Him: a territory fair and happy and a Lord Oft-Forgiving! 3810 3811

But they turned away (from Allah) and We sent against them the flood (released) from the Dams and We converted their two Garden (rows) into "gardens" producing bitter fruit and tamarisks and some few (stunted) Lote trees. 3812 3813 3814
That was the Requital We gave them because they ungratefully\n\t\t\trejected Faith: and never do We give (such) requital except to\n\t\t\tsuch as are ungrateful rejecters. 3815

Between them and the Cities on which We had poured Our blessings We had placed Cities in prominent positions and between them We had appointed stages of journey in due proportion: "Travel therein secure by night and by day." 3816

But they said: "Our Lord! place longer distances between our journey-stages." But they wronged themselves (therein). At length We made them as a tale (that is told) and We dispersed them all in scattered fragments. Verily in this are Signs for every (soul that is) patiently constant and grateful. 3817 3818 3819
And on them did Satan prove true his idea and they followed him\n\t\t\tall but a Party that believed. 3820
But he had no authority over them except that We might test the man who believes in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt concerning it: and thy Lord doth watch over all things. 3821

Say: "Call upon other (gods) whom ye fancy besides Allah: they have no power not the weight of an atom in the heavens or on earth; no (sort of) share have they therein nor is any of them a helper to Allah. 3822 3823

"No intercession can avail in His Presence except for those for whom He has granted permission. So far (is this the case) that when terror is removed from their hearts (at the Day of Judgement then) will they say `What is it that your Lord commanded?' They will say `That which is true and just; and He is the Most High Most Great.' " 3824 3825 3826
Say: "Who gives you sustenance from the heavens and the earth?"\n\t\t\tSay: "It is Allah and certain it is that either we or ye are on\n\t\t\tright guidance or in manifest error!" 3827 3828
Say: "Ye shall not be questioned as to our sins nor shall we be\n\t\t\tquestioned as to what ye do." 3829
Say: "Our Lord will gather us together and will in the end decide\n\t\t\tthe matter between us (and you) in truth and justice: and He is\n\t\t\tthe One to decide the One Who knows all." 3830
Say: "Show me those whom ye have joined with Him as partners: by\n\t\t\tno means (can ye). Nay He is Allah the Exalted in Power the\n\t\t\tWise." 3831
We have not sent thee but as a universal (Messenger) to men\n\t\t\tgiving them glad tidings and warning them (against sin) but most\n\t\t\tmen understand not. 3832
They say: "When will this promise (come to pass) if ye are\n\t\t\ttelling the truth?"
Say: "The appointment to you is for a day which ye cannot put\n\t\t\tback for an hour nor put forward." 3833
