The Unbelievers say: "We shall neither believe in this scripture nor in (any) that (came) before it." Couldst thou but see when the wrong-doers will be made to stand before their Lord throwing back the word (of blame) on one another! Those who had been despised will say to the arrogant ones: "Had it not been for you we should certainly have been believers!" 3834 3835 3836
The arrogant ones will say to those who had been despised: "Was\n\t\t\tit we who kept you back from Guidance after it reached you? Nay\n\t\t\trather it was ye who transgressed." 3837

Those who had been despised will say to the arrogant ones: "Nay! it was a plot (of yours) by day and by night. Behold! ye (constantly) ordered us to be ungrateful to Allah and to attribute equals to Him!" They will declare (their) repentance when they see the Penalty: We shall put yokes on the necks of the Unbelievers: it would only be a requital for their (ill) deeds. 3838 3839 3840
Never did We send a Warner to a population but the wealthy ones\n\t\t\tamong them said: "We believe not in the (message) with which ye\n\t\t\thave been sent." 3841
They said: "We have more in wealth and in sons and we cannot be\n\t\t\tpunished." 3842
Say: "Verily my Lord enlarges and restricts the provision to whom\n\t\t\tHe pleases but most men understand not." 3843

It is not your wealth nor your sons that will bring you nearer to Us in degree: but only those who believe and work Righteousness these are the ones for whom there is a multiplied Reward for their deeds while secure they (reside) in the dwellings on high! 3844 3845 3846
Those who strive against Our Signs to frustrate them will be\n\t\t\tgiven over into Punishment. 3847

Say: "Verily my Lord enlarges and restricts the Sustenance to such of His servants as He pleases: and nothing do ye spend in the least (in his cause) but He replaces it: for He is the Best of those Who grant Sustenance. 3848 3849
One day He will gather them all together and say to the angels\n\t\t\t"Was it you that these men used to worship?" 3850
They will say "Glory to thee! Our (tie) is with thee as Protector\n\t\t\t not with them. Nay but they worshipped the Jinns: most of them\n\t\t\tbelieved in them." 3851 3852
So on that day no power shall they have over each other for profit or harm: and We shall say to the wrong-doers "Taste ye the penalty of the Fire the which ye were wont to deny!" 3853

When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them they say "This is only a man who wishes to hinder you from the (worship) which your fathers practiced." And they say "This is only a falsehood invented!" And the Unbelievers say of the Truth when it comes to them "This is nothing but evident magic!" 3854
But We had not given them Books which they could study nor sent\n\t\t\tapostles to them before thee as Warners. 3855
And their predecessors rejected (the Truth); these have not received a tenth of what We had granted to those: yet when they rejected My apostles how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)! 3856

Say: "I do admonish you on one point: that ye do stand up before Allah--(it may be) in pairs or (it may be) singly and reflect (within yourselves): your Companion is not possessed: he is no less than a Warner to you in face of a terrible Penalty." 3857 3858
Say: "No reward do I ask of you: it is (all) in your interest: my\n\t\t\treward is only due from Allah: and He is Witness to all things."\n\t\t\t3859
Say: "Verily my Lord doth cast the (mantle of) Truth (over His\n\t\t\tservants) He that has full knowledge of (all) that is hidden."\n\t\t\t3860
Say: "The Truth has arrived and Falsehood neither creates\n\t\t\tanything new nor restores anything." 3861
Say: "If I am astray I only stray to the loss of my own soul: but if I receive guidance it is because of the inspiration of my Lord to me: it is He Who hears all things and is (ever) near." 3862
If thou couldst but see when they will quake with terror: but\n\t\t\tthen there will be no escape (for them) and they will be seized\n\t\t\tfrom a position (quite) near. 3863
And they will say "We do believe (now) in the (truth)": but how\n\t\t\tcould they receive (faith) from a position (so) far off\n\t\t\t3864
Seeing that they did reject faith (entirely) before and that they\n\t\t\t(continually) cast (slanders) on the Unseen from a position far\n\t\t\toff? 3865
And between them and their desires is placed a barrier as was done in the past with their partisans: for they were indeed in suspicious (disquieting) doubt. 3866 3867 3868

Praise be to Allah Who created (out of nothing) the heavens and the earth Who made the angels messengers with wings two or three or four (Pairs): He adds to Creation as He pleases: for Allah has power over all things. 3869 3870 3871 3872
What Allah out of His Mercy doth bestow on mankind there is none can withhold: what He doth withhold there is none can grant apart from Him: and He is the Exalted in Power Full of Wisdom. 3873

O men! call to mind the grace of Allah unto you! Is there a Creator other than Allah to give you Sustenance from heaven or earth? There is no god but He: how then are ye deluded away from the Truth? 3874
And if they reject thee so were apostles rejected before thee: to\n\t\t\tAllah go back for decision all affairs. 3875
O men! certainly the promise of Allah is true.\tLet not then this\n\t\t\tpresent life deceive you nor let the Chief Deceiver deceive you\n\t\t\tabout Allah. 3876 3877
Verily Satan is an enemy to you: so treat him as an enemy. He\n\t\t\tonly invites his adherents that they may become Companions of the\n\t\t\tBlazing Fire. 3878
For those who reject Allah is a terrible Penalty: but for those\n\t\t\twho believe and work righteous deeds is Forgiveness and a\n\t\t\tmagnificent Reward. 3879

Is he then to whom the evil of his conduct is made alluring so that he looks upon it as good (equal to one who is rightly guided)? For Allah leaves to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So let not thy soul go out in (vainly) sighing after them: for Allah knows well all that they do! 3880

It is Allah Who sends forth the Winds so that they raise up the Clouds and We drive them to a Land that is dead and revive the earth therewith after its death: even so (will be) the Resurrection! 3881

If any do seek for glory and power to Allah belong all glory and power. To Him mount up (all) Words of Purity: it is He Who exalts each Deed of Righteousness. Those that lay Plots of Evil for them is a Penalty terrible; and the plotting of such will be void (of result). 3882 3883

And Allah did create you from dust; then from a sperm-drop; then He made you in pairs. And no female conceives or lays down (her load) but with His knowledge. Nor is a man long-lived granted length of days nor is a part cut off from his life but is in a Decree (ordained). All this is easy for Allah. 3884 3885 3886 3887

Nor are the two bodies of flowing water alike the one palatable sweet and pleasant to drink and the other salty and bitter. Yet from each (kind of water) do ye eat flesh fresh and tender and ye extract ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough the waves that ye may seek (thus) of the Bounty of Allah that ye may be grateful. 3888 3889 3890

He merges Night into Day and He merges Day into Night and He has subjected the sun and the moon (to His Law): each one runs its course for a term appointed. Such is Allah your Lord: to Him belongs all Dominion. And those whom ye invoke besides Him have not the least power. 3891 3892 3893 3894

If ye invoke them they will not listen to your call and if they were to listen they cannot answer your (prayer). On the Day of Judgement they will reject your "Partnership." And none (O man!) can tell thee (the Truth) like the One Who is acquainted with all things. 3895 3896 3897
O ye men! it is ye that have need of Allah: but Allah is the One\n\t\t\tFree of all wants Worthy of all praise. 3898
If He so pleased He could blot you out and bring in a New\n\t\t\tCreation:
Nor is that (at all) difficult for Allah. 3899

Nor can a bearer of burdens bear another's burden. If one heavily laden should call another to (bear) his load not the least portion of it can be carried (by the other) even though he be nearly related. Thou canst but admonish such as fear their Lord unseen and establish regular Prayer and whoever purifies himself does so for the benefit of his own soul; and the destination (of all) is to Allah. 3900 3901 3902 3903
The blind and the seeing are not alike; 3904
Nor are the depths of Darkness and the Light;
Nor are the (chilly) shade and the (genial) heat of the sun:
Nor are alike those that are living and those that are dead. \n\t\t\tAllah can make any that He wills to hear; but thou canst not make\n\t\t\tthose to hear who are (buried) in graves. 3905
Thou art no other than a warner. 3906
Verily We have sent thee in truth as a bearer of glad tidings and\n\t\t\tas a warner: and there never was a people without a warner having\n\t\t\tlived among them (in the past). 3907
And if they reject thee so did their predecessors to whom came\n\t\t\ttheir apostles with Clear Signs Books of Dark Prophecies and the\n\t\t\tBook of Enlightenment. 3908
In the end did I punish those who rejected Faith: and how\n\t\t\t(terrible) was My rejection (of them)! 3909

Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky? With it We then bring out produce of various colors. And in the mountains are tracts white and red of various shades of color and black intense in hue. 3910 3911
And so amongst men and crawling creatures and cattle are they of various colors. Those truly fear Allah among His Servants who have knowledge: for Allah is Exalted in Might Oft-Forgiving. 3912 3913
Those who rehearse the Book of Allah establish regular Prayer and spend (in Charity) out of what We have provided for them secretly and openly hope for a Commerce that will never fail: 3914 3915
For He will pay them their meed nay He will give them (even) more\n\t\t\tout of His Bounty; for He is Oft-Forgiving Most Ready to\n\t\t\tappreciate (service). 3916 3917
That which We have revealed to thee of the Book is the Truth confirming what was (revealed) before it: for Allah is assuredly with respect to his servants well acquainted and fully-Observant. 3918

Then We have given the Book for inheritance to such of Our servants as We have chosen: but there are among them some who wrong their own souls; some who follow a middle course; and some who are by Allah's leave foremost in good deeds; that is the highest Grace. 3919 3920
Gardens of Eternity will they enter: therein will they be adorned\n\t\t\twith bracelets of gold and pearls; and their garments there will\n\t\t\tbe of silk. 3921 3922
And they will say: "Praise be to Allah Who has removed from us\n\t\t\t(all) sorrow: for Our Lord is indeed Oft-Forgiving Ready to\n\t\t\tappreciate (service): 3923
"Who has out of His bounty settled us in a Home that will last:\n\t\t\tno toil nor sense of weariness shall touch us therein."\n\t\t\t3924

But those who reject (Allah) for them will be the Fire of Hell: no term shall be determined for them so they should die nor shall its Penalty be lightened for them: thus do We reward every ungrateful one! 3925

Therein will they cry aloud (for assistance): "Our Lord! bring us out: we shall work righteousness not the (deeds) we used to do!" Did we not give you long enough life so that he that would should receive admonition? And (moreover) the warner came to you. So taste ye (the fruit of your deeds): for the Wrongdoers there is no helper." 3926 3927 3928
Verily Allah knows (all) the hidden things of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth: verily He has full knowledge of all that is in (men's)\n\t\t\thearts. 3929

He it is that has made you inheritors in the earth: if then any do reject (Allah) their rejection (works) against themselves: their rejection but adds to the odium for the Unbelievers in the sight of their Lord: their rejection but adds to (their own) undoing. 3930 3931

Say: "Have ye seen (these) `partners' of yours whom ye call upon besides Allah?" Show me what it is they have created in the (wide) earth. Or have they a share in the heavens? Or have We given them a Book from which they (can derive) clear (evidence)? Nay the wrongdoers promise each other nothing but delusions. 3932

It is Allah Who sustains the heavens and the earth lest they cease (to function): and if they should fail there is none not one can sustain them thereafter: verily He is Most Forbearing Oft-Forgiving. 3933 3934

They swore their strongest oaths by Allah that if a warner came to them they would follow his guidance better than any (other) of the Peoples: but when a warner came to them it has only increased their flight (from righteousness) 3935

On account of their arrogance in the land and their plotting of Evil. But the plotting of Evil will hem in only the authors thereof. Now are they but looking for the way the ancients were dealt with? But no change wilt thou find in Allah's way (of dealing): no turning off wilt thou find in Allah's way (of dealing). 3936 3937 3938

Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the end of those before them though they were superior to them in strength? Nor is Allah to be frustrated by anything whatever in the heavens or on earth: for He is All-Knowing All-Powerful. 3939

If Allah were to punish men according to what they deserve He would not leave on the back of the (earth) a single living creature: but He gives them respite for a stated Term: when their Term expires verily Allah has in his sight all His servants. 3940 3941 3942
Ya Sin. 3943
By the Qur'an full of Wisdom 3944
Thou art indeed one of the apostles.
On a Straight Way.
It is a Revelation sent down by (Him) the Exalted in Might Most\n\t\t\tMerciful. 3945
In order that thou mayest admonish a people whose fathers had\n\t\t\treceived no admonition and who therefore remain heedless (of the\n\t\t\tSigns of Allah). 3946
The Word is proved true against the greater part of them; for\n\t\t\tthey do not believe. 3947
We have put yokes round their necks right up to their chins so\n\t\t\tthat their heads are forced up (and they cannot see).\n\t\t\t3948
And We have put a bar in front of them and a bar behind them and\n\t\t\tfurther We have covered them up; so that they cannot see.\n\t\t\t3949
The same is it to them whether thou admonish them or thou do not\n\t\t\tadmonish them: they will not believe. 3950
Thou canst but admonish: such a one as follows the Message and fears the (Lord) Most Gracious unseen: give such a one therefore good tidings of Forgiveness and a Reward most generous. 3951 3952 3953
Verily We shall give life to the dead and We record that which they sent before and that which they leave behind and of all things have We taken account in a clear Book (of evidence). 3954 3955 3956
Set forth to them by way of a parable the (story of) the\n\t\t\tCompanions of the City. Behold there came apostles to it.\n\t\t\t3957
When We (first) sent to them two apostles they rejected them: but\n\t\t\tWe strengthened them with a third: they said "Truly we have been\n\t\t\tsent on a mission to you." 3958
The (people) said: "Ye are only men like ourselves; and (Allah)\n\t\t\tMost Gracious sends no sort of revelation: Ye do nothing but\n\t\t\tlie." 3959 3960
They said: "Our Lord doth know that we have been sent on a\n\t\t\tmission to you: 3961
"And Our duty is only to proclaim the clear Message."\n\t\t\t3962
The (people) said: "for us We augur an evil omen from you: if ye\n\t\t\tdesist not we will certainly stone you and a grievous punishment\n\t\t\tindeed will be inflicted on you by us." 3963
They said: "Your evil omens are with yourselves: (deem ye this an\n\t\t\tevil omen) if ye are admonished? Nay but ye are a people\n\t\t\ttransgressing all bounds!" 3964 3965
Then there came running from the farthest part of the City a man\n\t\t\tsaying "O my people! obey the apostles: 3966
"Obey those who ask no reward of you (for themselves) and who\n\t\t\thave themselves received Guidance. 3967
"It would not be reasonable in me if I did not serve Him Who\n\t\t\tcreated me and to Whom ye shall (all) be brought back.\n\t\t\t3968
"Shall I take (other) gods besides Him? If (Allah) Most Gracious\n\t\t\tshould intend some adversity for me of no use whatever will be\n\t\t\ttheir intercession for me nor can they deliver me. 3969
"I would indeed if I were to do so be in manifest Error.
"For me I have faith in the Lord of you (all): listen then to\n\t\t\tme!" 3970
It was said: "Enter thou the Garden." He said "Ah me! would that\n\t\t\tmy People knew (what I know)! 3971
"For that my Lord has granted me Forgiveness and has enrolled me\n\t\t\tamong those held in honor!" 3972
And We sent not down against his People after Him any hosts from\n\t\t\theaven nor was it needful for Us so to do.
It was no more than a single mighty Blast and behold! they were\n\t\t\t(like ashes) quenched and silent. 3973 3974
Ah! alas for (My) servants! There comes not an apostle to them\n\t\t\tbut they mock Him! 3975
See they not how many generations before them We destroyed? Not\n\t\t\tto them will they return: 3976
But each one of them all will be brought before Us (for\n\t\t\tjudgment).
A Sign for them is the earth that is dead; We do give it life and\n\t\t\tproduce grain therefrom of which ye do eat. 3977
And We produce therein orchards with date-palms and Vines and We\n\t\t\tcause springs to gush forth therein. 3978
That they may enjoy the fruits of this (artistry): it was not\n\t\t\ttheir hands that made this: will they not then give thanks?\n\t\t\t3979 3980
Glory to Allah Who created in pairs all things that the earth\n\t\t\tproduces as well as their own (human) kind and (other) things of\n\t\t\twhich they have no knowledge. 3981
And a Sign for them is the Night: We withdraw therefrom the Day\n\t\t\tand behold they are plunged in darkness; 3982
And the Sun runs his course for a period determined for him: that\n\t\t\tis the decree of (Him) the exalted in Might the All-Knowing.\n\t\t\t3983
And the Moon We have measured for her mansions (to traverse) till\n\t\t\tshe returns like the old (and withered) lower part of date-stalk.\n\t\t\t3984 3985
It is not permitted to the Sun to catch up the Moon nor can the\n\t\t\tNight outstrip the Day: each (just) swims along in (its own)\n\t\t\torbit (according to Law). 3986 3987
And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the\n\t\t\tflood) in the loaded Ark; 3988
And We have created for them similar (vessels) on which they\n\t\t\tride. 3989
If it were Our Will We could drown them; then would there be no\n\t\t\thelper (to hear their cry) nor could they be delivered.\n\t\t\t3990
Except by way of Mercy from Us and by way of (worldly)\n\t\t\tconvenience (to serve them) for a time. 3991
When they are told "Fear ye that which is before you and that\n\t\t\twhich will be after you in order that ye may receive Mercy" (they\n\t\t\tturn back). 3992
Not a Sign comes to them from among the Signs of their Lord but\n\t\t\tthey turn away therefrom. 3993

And when they are told "Spend ye of (the bounties) with which Allah has provided you." You Unbelievers say to those who believe: "Shall we then feed those whom if Allah had so willed He would have fed (himself)? Ye are in nothing but manifest error." 3994 3995
Further they say "When will this promise (come to pass) if what\n\t\t\tye say is true?" 3996
They will not (have to) wait for aught but a single Blast: it\n\t\t\twill seize them while they are yet disputing among themselves!
No (chance) will they then have by will to dispose (of their\n\t\t\taffairs) nor to return to their own people!
The trumpet shall be sounded when behold! from the sepulchers\n\t\t\t(men) will rush forth to their Lord! 3997
They will say: "Ah! woe unto us! Who hath raised us up from our beds of repose? (A voice will say:) "This is what (Allah) Most Gracious had promised and true was the word of the apostles!" 3998
It will be no more than a single Blast when lo! they will all be\n\t\t\tbrought up before Us! 3999
Then on that Day not a soul will be wronged in the least and ye\n\t\t\tshall but be repaid the meeds of your past Deeds. 4000
Verily the Companions of the Garden shall that Day have joy in\n\t\t\tall that they do; 4001
They and their associates will be in groves of (cool) shade\n\t\t\treclining on thrones (of dignity); 4002
(Every) fruit (enjoyment) will be there for them; they shall have\n\t\t\twhatever they call for; 4003
"Peace! a Word (of salutation) from a Lord Most Merciful!\n\t\t\t4004
And O ye in sin! get ye apart this Day! 4005
"Did I not enjoin on you O ye children of Adam that ye should not\n\t\t\tworship Satan; for that he was to you an enemy avowed?\n\t\t\t4006
"And that ye should worship Me (for that) this was the Straight\n\t\t\tWay? 4007
"But he did lead astray a great multitude of you. Did ye not then\n\t\t\tunderstand? 4008
"This is the Hell of which ye were (repeatedly) warned!\n\t\t\t4009

(Allah) said: "Then it is just and fitting and I say what is just\n\t\t\tand fitting 4236
"That I will certainly fill Hell with thee and those that follow\n\t\t\tthee--every one." 4237
Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this (Qur'an) nor am I a\n\t\t\tpretender. 4238 4239
"This is no less than a Message to (all) the Worlds.\n\t\t\t4240
"And ye shall certainly know the truth of it (all) after a\n\t\t\twhile." 4241
The revelation of this Book is from Allah the Exalted in Power\n\t\t\tFull of Wisdom. 4242
Verily it is We Who have revealed the Book to thee in Truth: so\n\t\t\tserve Allah offering Him sincere devotion.

Is it not to Allah that sincere devotion is due? But those who take for protectors other than Allah (say): "We only serve them in order that they may bring us nearer to Allah." Truly Allah will judge between them in that wherein they differ. But Allah guides not such as are false and ungrateful. 4243 4244 4245

Had Allah wished to take to Himself a son He could have chosen whom He pleased out of those whom He doth create: but Glory be to Him! (He is above such things.) He is Allah the One the Irresistible. 4246

He created the heavens and the earth in true (proportions): He makes the Night overlap the Day and the Day overlap the Night: He has subjected the sun and the moon (to His law) each one follows a course for a time appointed. Is not He the Exalted in Power He Who forgives again and again? 4247 4248

He created you (all) from a single person: then created of like nature his mate; and He sent down for you eight head of cattle in pairs: He makes you in the wombs of your mothers in stages one after another in three veils of darkness. Such is Allah your Lord and Cherisher: to Him belongs (all) dominion. There is no god but He: then how are ye turned away (from your true Center)? 4249 4250 4251 4252 4253

It ye reject (Allah) truly Allah has no need of you; but He liketh not ingratitude from His servants: if ye are grateful He is pleased with you. No bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another. In the end to your Lord is your return when He will tell you the truth of all that ye did (in this life). For He knoweth well all that is in (men's) hearts. 4254 4255

When some trouble toucheth man he crieth unto his Lord turning to Him in repentance: but when He bestoweth a favor upon him as from Himself (man) doth forget what he cried and prayed for before and he doth set up rivals unto Allah thus misleading others from Allah's Path. Say "Enjoy thy blasphemy for a little while: verily thou art (one) of the Companions of the Fire!" 4256 4257

Is one who worships devoutly during the hours of the night prostrating himself or standing (in adoration) who takes heed of the Hereafter and who places his hope in the Mercy of his Lord (like one who does not)? Say: "Are those equal those who know and those who do not know? It is those who are endued with understanding that receive admonition." 4258 4259

Say: "O ye my servants who believe! Fear your Lord: good is (the reward) for those who do good in this world. Spacious is Allah's earth! Those who patiently persevere will truly receive a reward without measure!" 4260 4261
Say: "Verily I am commanded to serve Allah with sincere devotion;
"And I am commanded to be the first of those who bow to Allah in\n\t\t\tIslam." 4262
Say: "I would if I disobeyed my Lord indeed have fear of the\n\t\t\tPenalty of a Mighty Day." 4263
Say: "It is Allah I serve with my sincere (and exclusive)\n\t\t\tdevotion:
"Serve ye what ye will besides Him." Say: "Truly those in loss are those who lose their own souls and their People on the Day of Judgement: Ah! that is indeed the (real and) evident Loss!" 4264 4265
They shall have layers of fire above them and layers (of fire)\n\t\t\tbelow them: with this doth Allah warn off His servants: "O my\n\t\t\tservants! Then fear ye Me!" 4266 4267
Those who eschew evil and fall not into its worship and turn to\n\t\t\tAllah (in repentance) for them is Good News: so announce the Good\n\t\t\tNews to My Servants 4268
Those who listen to the Word and follow the best (meaning) in it:\n\t\t\tthose are the ones whom Allah has guided and those are the ones\n\t\t\tendued with understanding. 4269
Is then one against whom the decree of Punishment is justly due\n\t\t\t(equal to one who eschews evil)? Wouldst thou then deliver one\n\t\t\t(who is) in the fire? 4270

But it is for those who fear their Lord that lofty mansions one above another have been built: beneath them flow rivers (of delight): (such is) the promise of Allah: never doth Allah fail in (His) promise. 4271 4272

Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky and leads it through springs in the earth? Then He causes to grow therewith produce of various colors: then it withers; thou wilt see it grow yellow; then He makes it dry up and crumble away. Truly in this is a Message of remembrance to men of understanding. 4273

Is one whose heart Allah has opened to Islam so that he has received enlightenment from Allah (no better than one hard-hearted)? Woe to those whose hearts are hardened against celebrating the praises of Allah! They are manifestly wandering (in error)! 4274 4275

Allah has revealed (from time to time) the most beautiful message in the form of a Book consistent with itself (Yet) repeating (its teaching in various aspects): the skins of those who fear their Lord tremble thereat; then their skins and their hearts do soften to the celebration of Allah's praises. Such is the guidance of Allah: He guides therewith whom He pleases but such as Allah leaves to stray can have none to guide. 4276 4277 4278 4279

Is then one who has to fear the brunt of the Penalty on the Day of Judgement (and receive it) on his face (like one guarded therefrom)? It will be said to the wrongdoers: "Taste ye (the fruits of) what ye earned!" 4280 4281
Those before them (also) rejected (revelation) and so the\n\t\t\tPunishment came to them from directions they did not perceive.\n\t\t\t4282
So Allah gave them a taste of humiliation in the present life but\n\t\t\tgreater is the Punishment of the Hereafter if they only knew!\n\t\t\t4283
We have put forth for men in this Qur'an every kind of Parable in\n\t\t\torder that they may receive admonition. 4284
(It is) a Qur'an in Arabic without any crookedness (therein): in\n\t\t\torder that they may guard against Evil. 4285\n\t\t\t4286

Allah puts forth a Parable a man belonging to many partners at variance with each other and a man belonging entirely to one master: are those two equal in comparison? Praise be to Allah! But most of them have no knowledge. 4287 4288
Truly thou wilt die (one day) and truly they (too) will die (one\n\t\t\tday). 4289
In the end will ye (all) on the Day of Judgement settle your\n\t\t\tdisputes in the presence of your Lord. 4290
Who then doth more wrong than one who utters a lie concerning\n\t\t\tAllah and rejects the truth when it comes to him? Is there not in\n\t\t\tHell an abode for blasphemers? 4291 4292
And he who brings the Truth and he who confirms (and supports) it\n\t\t\t such are the men who do right. 4293
They shall have all that they wish for in the presence of their\n\t\t\tLord: such is the reward of those who do good: 4294
So that Allah will turn off from them (even) the worst in their\n\t\t\tdeeds and give them their reward according to the best of what\n\t\t\tthey have done. 4295
Is not Allah enough for His servant? But they try to frighten\n\t\t\tthee with other (gods) besides him! For such as Allah leaves to\n\t\t\tstray there can be no guide. 4296
And such as Allah doth guide there can be none to lead astray is\n\t\t\tnot Allah Exalted in Power (able to enforce His Will) Lord of\n\t\t\tRetribution? 4297 4298

If indeed thou ask them who it is that created the heavens and the earth they would be sure to say "Allah." Say: "See ye then? The things that ye invoke besides Allah can they if Allah wills some Penalty for me remove His Penalty? Or if He wills some Grace for me can they keep back His Grace?" Say: "Sufficient is Allah for me! In Him trust those who put their trust." 4299 4300 4301
Say: "O my people! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): but\n\t\t\tsoon will ye know 4302
"Who it is to whom come a Penalty of ignominy and on whom\n\t\t\tdescends a Penalty that abides." 4303

Verily We have revealed the Book to thee in Truth for (instructing) mankind. He then that receives guidance benefits his own soul: but he that strays injures his own soul. Nor art thou set over them to dispose of their affairs. 4304 4305

It is Allah that takes the souls (of men) at death: and those that die not (He takes) during their sleep: those on whom He has passed the decree of death He keeps back (from returning to life) but the rest He sends (to their bodies) for a term appointed. Verily in this are Signs for those who reflect. 4306 4307 4308 4309
What! Do they take for intercessors others besides Allah? Say:\n\t\t\t"Even if they have no power whatever and no intelligence?"\n\t\t\t4310
Say: "To Allah belongs exclusively (the right to grant) Intercession: to Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: in the End it is to Him that ye shall be brought back." 4311 4312

When Allah the One and Only is mentioned the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter are filled with disgust and horror; but when (gods) other than He are mentioned behold they are filled with joy! 4313
Say: "O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of all that is hidden and open! It is Thou that wilt judge between Thy Servants in those matters about which they have differed." 4314

Even if the wrongdoers had all that there is on earth and as much more (in vain) would they offer it for ransom from the pain of the Penalty on the Day of Judgement: but something will confront them from Allah which they could never have counted upon! 4315 4316
For the evils of their Deeds will confront them and they will be\n\t\t\t(completely) encircled by that which they used to mock at!\n\t\t\t4317

Now when trouble touches man he cries to Us; but when We bestow a favor upon him as from Ourselves he says "This has been given to me because of a certain knowledge (I have)!" Nay but this is but a trial but most of them understand not! 4318 4319 4320
Thus did the (generations) before them say! But all that they did\n\t\t\twas of no profit to them.

Nay the evil results of their deeds overtook them. And the wrongdoers of this (generation) the evil results of their deeds will soon overtake them (too) and they will never be able to frustrate (Our Plan)! 4321 4322
Know they not that Allah enlarges the provision or restricts it\n\t\t\tfor any He pleases? Verily in this are signs for those who\n\t\t\tbelieve! 4323
Say: "O my Servants who have transgressed against their souls!\n\t\t\tDespair not of the Mercy of Allah: for Allah forgives all sins:\n\t\t\tfor He is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. 4324
"Turn ye to your Lord (in repentance) and bow to His (Will)\n\t\t\tbefore the Penalty comes on you: after that ye shall not be\n\t\t\thelped. 4325
"And follow the Best of (the courses) revealed to you from your\n\t\t\tLord before the Penalty comes on you of a sudden while ye\n\t\t\tperceive not!-- 4326
"Lest the soul should (then) say: Ah! woe is me! In that I\n\t\t\tneglected (my duty) towards Allah and was but among those who\n\t\t\tmocked!' 4327
"Or (lest) it should say: `If only Allah had guided me I should\n\t\t\tcertainly have been among the righteous!' 4328
"Or (lest) it should say when it (actually) sees the Penalty: `If\n\t\t\tonly I had another chance I should certainly be among those who\n\t\t\tdo good!' 4329
"(The reply will be) `Nay but there came to thee My signs and\n\t\t\tthou didst reject them: thou wast haughty and became one of those\n\t\t\twho reject Faith!' " 4330 4331
On the Day of Judgement wilt thou see those who told lies against\n\t\t\tAllah; their faces will be turned black; is there not in Hell an\n\t\t\tabode for the Haughty? 4332 4333
But Allah will deliver the righteous to their place of salvation:\n\t\t\tno evil shall touch them nor shall they grieve. 4334
Allah is the Creator of all things and He is the Guardian and\n\t\t\tDisposer of all affairs. 4335
To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth: and those\n\t\t\twho reject the Signs of Allah it is they who will be in loss.\n\t\t\t4336
Say: "Is it someone other than Allah that ye order me to worship\n\t\t\tO ye ignorant ones?" 4337

But it has already been revealed to thee as it was to those before thee "If thou wert to join (gods with Allah) truly fruitless will be thy work (in life) and thou wilt surely be in the ranks of those who lose (all spiritual good)." 4338 4339
Nay but worship Allah and be of those who give thanks.\n\t\t\t4340

No just estimate have they made of Allah such as is due to Him: on the Day of Judgement the whole of the earth will be but His handful and the heavens will be rolled up in His right hand: Glory to Him! High is He above the Partners they attribute to Him! 4341 4342

The Trumpet will (just) be sounded when all that are in the heavens and on earth will swoon except such as it will please Allah (to exempt). Then will a second one be sounded when behold they will be standing and looking on! 4343

And the Earth will shine with the glory of its Lord: the Record (of Deeds) will be placed (open); the prophets and the witnesses will be brought forward: and a just decision pronounced between them; and they will not be wronged (in the least). 4344 4345
And to every soul will be paid in full (the fruit) of its deeds;\n\t\t\tand (Allah) knoweth best all that they do. 4346

The Unbelievers will be led to Hell in crowds; until when they arrive there its gates will be opened and its Keepers will say "Did not apostles come to you from among yourselves rehearsing to you the Signs of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" The answer will be: "True: but the Decree of Punishment has been proved true against the Unbelievers!" 4347 4348 4349
(To them) will be said: "Enter ye the gates of Hell to dwell\n\t\t\ttherein: and evil is (this) abode of the arrogant!" 4350

And those who feared their Lord will be led to the Garden in crowds: until behold they arrive there; its gates will be opened: and its Keepers will say: "Peace be upon you! Well have ye done! Enter ye here to dwell therein." 4351 4352

They will say: "Praise be to Allah Who has truly fulfilled His promise to us and has given us (this) land in heritage: we can dwell in the Garden as we will: how excellent a reward for those who work (righteousness)!" 4353 4354

And thou wilt see the angels surrounding the Throne (Divine) on all sides singing Glory and Praise to their Lord. The Decision between them (at Judgment) will be in (perfect) justice. And the cry (on all sides) will be "Praise be to Allah the Lord of the Worlds!" 4355
Ha Mim. 4356
The revelation of this Book is from Allah Exalted in Power Full\n\t\t\tof Knowledge 4357
Who forgiveth Sin accepteth Repentance is strict in Punishment\n\t\t\tand hath a Long Reach (in all things).\tThere is no god but He:\n\t\t\tto Him is the Final Goal. 4358
None can dispute about the Signs of Allah but the Unbelievers. \n\t\t\tLet not then their strutting about through the land deceive thee!\n\t\t\t4359 4360

But (there were people) before them who denied (the Signs) the People of Noah and the confederates (of Evil) after them; and every People plotted against their prophet to seize him and disputed by means of vanities therewith to condemn the truth; but it was I that seized them! And how (terrible) was My Requital! 4361 4362 4363
Thus was the Decree of thy Lord proved true against the\n\t\t\tUnbelievers; that truly they are Companions of Fire!\n\t\t\t4364

Those who sustain the Throne (of Allah) and those around it sing Glory and Praise to their Lord; believe in Him; and implore forgiveness for those who believe: "Our Lord! Thy reach is over all things in Mercy and Knowledge. Forgive then those who turn in repentance and follow Thy Path: and preserve them from the Penalty of the Blazing Fire! 4365 4366

"And grant our Lord! That they enter the Gardens of Eternity which Thou hast promised to them and to the righteous among their fathers their wives and their posterity! For Thou art (He) the Exalted in Might Full of Wisdom. 4367

"And preserve them from (all) ills; and any whom thou dost preserve from ills that Day on them wilt Thou have bestowed Mercy indeed: and that will be truly (for them) the highest Achievement. 4368 4369
The Unbelievers will be addressed: "Greater was the aversion of\n\t\t\tAllah to you than (is) your aversion to yourselves seeing that ye\n\t\t\twere called to the Faith and ye used to refuse." 4370
They will say:" Our Lord! twice hast Thou made us without life\n\t\t\tand twice hast Thou given us Life! Now have we recognized our\n\t\t\tsins: is there any way out (of this)?" 4371

(The answer will be:) "This is because when Allah was invoked as the only (object of worship) ye did reject Faith but when partners were joined to Him ye believed! The command is with Allah Most High Most Great!" 4372 4373
He it is Who showeth you His Signs and sendeth down sustenance\n\t\t\tfor you from the sky: but only those receive admonition who turn\n\t\t\t(to Allah). 4374
Call ye then upon Allah with sincere devotion to Him even though\n\t\t\tthe Unbelievers may detest it. 4375

Raised high above ranks (or degrees) (He is) the Lord of the Throne (of authority): by his command doth He send the spirit (of inspiration) to any of His servants He pleases that it may warn (men) of the Day of Mutual Meeting 4376 4377 4378
The Day whereon they will (all) come forth: Not a single thing\n\t\t\tconcerning them is hidden from Allah. Whose will be the dominion\n\t\t\tthat Day? That of Allah the One the Irresistible! 4379
That Day will every soul be requited for what it earned; no\n\t\t\tinjustice will there be that Day for Allah is Swift in taking\n\t\t\taccount. 4380

Warn them of the Day that is (ever) drawing near when the Hearts will (come) right up to the Throats to choke (them); no intimate friend nor intercessor will the wrongdoers have who could be listened to. 4381 4382
(Allah) knows of (the tricks) that deceive with the eyes and all\n\t\t\tthat hearts (of men) conceal. 4383 4384
And Allah will judge with (Justice and) Truth: but those whom (men) invoke besides Him will not (be in a position) to judge at all. Verily it is Allah (alone) Who hears and sees (all things). 4385

Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of those before them? They were even superior to them in strength and in the traces (they have left) in the land: but Allah did call them to account for their sins and none had they to defend them against Allah. 4386 4387
That was because there came to them their apostles with Clear\n\t\t\t(Signs) but they rejected them: So Allah called them to account:\n\t\t\tfor He is full of Strength Strict in Punishment. 4388
Of old We sent Moses with Our Signs and Authority manifest\n\t\t\t4389
To Pharaoh Haman and Qarun; but they called (him) "a sorcerer\n\t\t\ttelling lies!"... 4390

Now when he came to them in Truth from Us they said "Slay the sons of those who believe with him and keep alive their females" but the plots of Unbelievers (end) in nothing but errors (and delusions)!"... 4391 4392
Said Pharaoh: "Leave me to slay Moses; and let him Call on his Lord! What I fear is lest he should change your religion or lest he should cause mischief to appear in the land!" 4393 4394
Moses said: "I have indeed called upon my Lord and your Lord (for\n\t\t\tprotection) from every arrogant one who believes not in the Day\n\t\t\tof Account!" 4395

A believer a man from among the people of Pharaoh who had concealed his faith said: "Will ye slay a man because he says `My Lord is Allah'? When he has indeed come to you with Clear (Signs) from your Lord? And if he be a liar on him is (the sin of) his lie: but if he is telling the Truth then will fall on you something of the (calamity) of which he warns you: truly Allah guides not one who transgresses and lies! 4396 4397 4398

"O my people! yours is the dominion this day: ye have the upper hand in the land: but who will help us from the Punishment of Allah should it befall us?" Pharaoh said: "I but point out to you that which I see (myself); nor do I guide you but to the Path of Right!" 4399 4400
Then said the man who believed: "O my People! truly I do fear for\n\t\t\tyou something like the Day (of disaster) of the Confederates (in\n\t\t\tsin)! 4401 4402
"Something like the fate of the people of Noah the `Ad and the\n\t\t\tThamud and those who came after them: but Allah never wishes\n\t\t\tinjustice to His Servants. 4403
"And O my People! I fear for you a Day when there will be mutual\n\t\t\tcalling (and wailing) 4404
A day when ye shall turn your backs and flee: no defender shall\n\t\t\tye have from Allah: any whom Allah leaves to stray there is none\n\t\t\tto guide...

"And to you there came Joseph in times gone by with Clear Signs but ye ceased not to doubt of the (mission) for which he had come: at length when he died ye said: `No apostle will Allah send after him.' Thus doth Allah leave to stray such as transgress and live in doubt 4405 4406

"(Such) as dispute about the Signs of Allah without any authority that hath reached them. Grievous and odious (is such conduct) in the sight of Allah and of the Believers. Thus doth Allah seal up every heart of arrogant and obstinate transgressors." 4407
Pharaoh said: "O Haman! Build me a lofty palace that I may attain\n\t\t\tthe ways and means 4408

"The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens and that I may mount up to the Allah of Moses; but as far as I am concerned I think (Moses) is a liar!" Thus was made alluring in Pharaoh's eyes the evil of his deeds and he was hindered from the Path; and the plot of Pharaoh led to nothing but perdition (for him). 4409 4410
The man who believed said further: "O my People! follow me: I\n\t\t\twill lead you to the Path of Right. 4411
"O my people! This life of the present is nothing but (temporary)\n\t\t\tconvenience: it is the Hereafter that is the Home that will last.\n\t\t\t4412

"He that works evil will not be requited but by the like thereof: and he that works a righteous deed whether man or woman and is a believer such will enter the Garden (of Bliss): therein will they have abundance without measure. 4413
"And O my People! how (strange) it is for me to call you to\n\t\t\tSalvation while ye call me to the Fire! 4414
"Ye do call upon me to blaspheme against Allah and to join with\n\t\t\tHim Partners of whom I have no knowledge; and I call you to the\n\t\t\tExalted in Power Who forgives again and again!" 4415
"Without doubt ye do call me to one who is not fit to be called to whether in this world or in the Hereafter; our Return will be to Allah; and the Transgressors will be Companions of the Fire! 4416
"Soon will ye remember what I say to you (now) my (own) affair I\n\t\t\tcommit to Allah: for Allah (ever) watches over His Servants."\n\t\t\t4417
Then Allah saved him from (every) ill that they plotted (against\n\t\t\thim) but the brunt of the Penalty encompassed on all sides the\n\t\t\tPeople of Pharaoh. 4418
In front of the Fire will they be brought morning and evening: and (the Sentence will be) on the Day that Judgment will be established: "Cast ye the People of Pharaoh into the severest Penalty!" 4419

Behold they will dispute with each other in the Fire! The weak ones (who followed) will say to those who had been arrogant "We but followed you: can ye then take (on yourselves) from us some share of the Fire?" 4420
Those who had been arrogant will say: "We are all in this (Fire)!\n\t\t\tTruly Allah has judged between (His) Servants!" 4421
Those in the Fire will say to the Keepers of Hell: "Pray to your\n\t\t\tLord to lighten us the Penalty for a Day (at least)!"\n\t\t\t4422

They will say: "Did there not come to you your apostles with Clear Signs?" They will say "Yes." They will reply "Then pray (as ye like) but the Prayer of those without Faith is nothing but (futile wandering) in (mazes of) error!" 4423
We will without doubt help Our apostles and those who believe\n\t\t\t(both) in this world's life and on the Day when the Witnesses\n\t\t\twill stand forth 4424
The Day when no profit will it be to Wrongdoers to present their\n\t\t\texcuses but they will (only) have the Curse and the Home of\n\t\t\tMisery. 4425
We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance and We gave\n\t\t\tthe Book in inheritance to the Children of Israel 4426
A Guide and a Message to men of understanding.
Patiently then persevere: for the Promise of Allah is true: and ask forgiveness for thy fault and celebrate the Praises of thy Lord in the evening and in the morning. 4427 4428 4429

Those who dispute about the Signs of Allah without any authority bestowed on them there is nothing in their breasts but (the quest of) greatness which they shall never attain to: seek refuge then in Allah: it is He Who hears and sees (all things). 4430
Assuredly the creation of the heavens and the earth is a greater\n\t\t\t(matter) than the creation of men: Yet most men understand not.\n\t\t\t4431
Not equal are the blind and those who (clearly) see: nor are (equal) those who believe and work deeds of righteousness and those who do evil. Little do ye learn by admonition! 4432
The Hour will certainly come: therein is no doubt: yet most men\n\t\t\tbelieve not. 4433
And your Lord says: "Call on Me; I will answer your (Prayer): But\n\t\t\tthose who are too arrogant to serve Me will surely find\n\t\t\tthemselves in Hell in humiliation!" 4434
It is Allah Who has made the Night for you that ye may rest therein and the Day as that which helps (you) to see. Verily Allah is Full of Grace and Bounty to men: yet most men give no thanks. 4435
Such is Allah your Lord the Creator of all things there is no god\n\t\t\tbut He: then how ye are deluded away from the Truth!\n\t\t\t4436
Thus are deluded those who are wont to reject the Signs of Allah.\n\t\t\t4437

It is Allah Who has made for you the earth as a resting place and the sky as a canopy and has given you shapes and made your shapes beautiful and has provided for you Sustenance of things pure and good such is Allah your Lord. So Glory to Allah the Lord of the Worlds! 4438 4439 4440 4441
He is the living (One): There is no god but He: Call upon Him\n\t\t\tgiving Him sincere devotion. Praise be to Allah Lord of the\n\t\t\tWorlds! 4442

Say: "I have been forbidden to invoke those whom ye invoke besides Allah seeing that the Clear Signs have come to me from my Lord: and I have been commanded to bow (in Islam) to the Lord of the Worlds." 4443

It is He Who has created you from dust then from a sperm-drop then from a leech-like clot; then does He get you out (into the light) as a child: then lets you (grow and) reach your age of full strength; then lets you become old though of you there are some who die before; and lets you reach a Term appointed: in order that ye may learn wisdom. 4444
It is He Who gives Life and Death; and when He decides upon an\n\t\t\taffair He says to it "Be" and it is. 4445
Seest thou not those that dispute concerning the signs of Allah?\n\t\t\tHow are they turned away (from Reality)? 4446
Those who reject the Book and the (revelations) with which We\n\t\t\tsent Our apostles: But soon shall they know 4447
When the yokes (shall be) round their necks and the chains; they\n\t\t\tshall be dragged along 4448
In the boiling fetid fluid then in the Fire shall they be burned;\n\t\t\t4449
Then shall it be said to them: "Where are the (deities) to which\n\t\t\tye gave part-worship
"In derogation of Allah?" They will reply: "They have left us in the lurch: nay we invoked not of old anything (that had real existence)." Thus does Allah leave the Unbelievers to stray. 4450
"That was because ye were wont to rejoice on the earth in things\n\t\t\tother than the Truth and that ye were wont to be insolent.\n\t\t\t4451
"Enter ye the gates of Hell to dwell therein: and evil is (this)\n\t\t\tabode of the arrogant!" 4452

So persevere in patience! For the Promise of Allah is true: and whether We show thee (in this life) some part of what We promise them or We take thy soul (to Our Mercy) (Before that) (in any case) it is to Us that they shall (all) return. 4453

We did aforetime send apostles before thee: of them there are some whose story We have related to thee and some whose story We have not related to thee. It was not (possible) for any apostle to bring a Sign except by the leave of Allah: but when the Command of Allah issued the matter was decided in truth and justice and there perished there and then those who stood on Falsehoods. 4454 4455
It is Allah Who made cattle for you that ye may use some for\n\t\t\triding and some for food; 4456
And there are (other) advantages in them for you (besides); that\n\t\t\tye may through them attain to any need (there may be) in your\n\t\t\thearts; and on them and on ships ye are carried.
And He shows you always His Signs; then which of the Signs of\n\t\t\tAllah will ye deny? 4457

Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the end of those before them? They were more numerous than these and superior in strength and in the traces (they have left) in the land: yet all that they accomplished was of no profit to them. 4458
For when their apostles came to them with Clear Signs they exulted in such knowledge (and skill) as they had; but that very (Wrath) at which they were wont to scoff hemmed them in. 4459 4460
But when they saw Our punishment they said: "We believe in Allah\n\t\t\tthe One Allah and we reject the partners we used to join with\n\t\t\tHim."

But their professing the Faith when they (actually) saw Our Punishment was not going to profit them. (Such has been) Allah's way of dealing with His servants (from the most ancient times). And even thus did the rejecters of Allah perish (utterly)! 4461
Ha Mim. 4462
A revelation from (Allah) Most Gracious Most Merciful\n\t\t\t4463
A Book whereof the verses are explained in detail a Qur'an in\n\t\t\tArabic for people who understand
Giving Good News and Admonition: yet most of them turn away and\n\t\t\tso they hear not. 4464

They say: "Our hearts are under veils (concealed) from that to which thou dost invite us and in [our ears is] a deafness and between us and thee is a screen: so do thou (what thou wilt); for us we shall do (what we will!)." 4465 4466

Say thou: "I am but a man like you: it is revealed to me by inspiration that your Allah is One Allah: so stand true to Him and ask for His forgiveness." And woe to those who join gods with Allah 4467 4468
Those who practice not Regular Charity and who even deny the\n\t\t\tHereafter.
For those who believe and work deeds of righteousness is a reward\n\t\t\tthat will never fail. 4469
Say: Is it that ye Deny Him Who created the earth in two Days?\n\t\t\tAnd do ye join equals with Him? He is the Lord of (all) the\n\t\t\tWorlds. 4470

He set on the (earth) Mountains standing firm high above it and bestowed blessings on the earth and measured therein all things to give them nourishment in due proportion in four Days in accordance with (the needs of) those who seek (sustenance). 4471 4472 4473

Moreover He Comprehended in His design the sky and it had been (as) smoke: He said to it and to the earth: "Come ye together willingly or unwillingly." They said: "We do come (together) in willing obedience." 4474 4475 4476

So He completed them as seven firmaments in two Days and He assigned to each heaven its duty and command. And We adorned the lower heaven with lights and (provided it) with guard. Such is the Decree of (Him) the Exalted in Might Full of knowledge. 4477 4478
But if they turn away say thou: "I have warned you of a stunning\n\t\t\tPunishment (as of thunder and lightning) like that which\n\t\t\t(overtook) the `Ad and the Thamud!" 4479

Behold the apostles came to them from before them and behind them (preaching): "Serve none but Allah." They said "If our Lord had so pleased He would certainly have sent down angels (to preach): now we reject your mission (altogether)." 4480 4481

Now the `Ad behaved arrogantly through the land against (all) truth and reason and said: "Who is superior to us in strength?" What! did they not see that Allah Who created them was superior to them in strength? But they continued to reject Our Signs! 4482

So We sent against them a furious Wind through days of disaster that We might give them a taste of a Penalty of humiliation in this Life; but the Penalty of the Hereafter will be more humiliating still: and they will find no help. 4483
As to the Thamud We gave them guidance but they preferred blindness (of heart) to Guidance; so the stunning Punishment of humiliation seized them because of what they had earned. 4484 4485
But We delivered those who believed and practiced righteousness.
On the Day that the enemies of Allah will be gathered together to\n\t\t\tthe Fire they will be marched in ranks. 4486
At length when they reach the (Fire) their hearing their sight\n\t\t\tand their skins will bear witness against them as to (all) their\n\t\t\tdeeds. 4487

They will say to their skins: "Why bear ye witness against us?" They will say: "Allah hath given us speech (He) Who giveth speech to everything: He created you for the first time and unto Him were ye to return. 4488
"Ye did not seek to hide yourselves lest your hearing your sight and your skins should bear witness against you! But ye did think that Allah knew not many of the things that ye used to do! 4489
"But this thought of yours which ye did entertain concerning your\n\t\t\tLord hath brought you to destruction and (now) have ye become of\n\t\t\tthose utterly lost!" 4490
If then they have patience the Fire will be a Home for them! And\n\t\t\tif they beg to be received into favor into favor will they not\n\t\t\t(then) be received. 4491

And We have destined for them intimate companions (of like nature) Who made alluring to them what was before them and behind them; and the sentence among the previous generations of Jinns and men who have passed away is proved against them; for they are utterly lost. 4492 4493 4494 4495
The Unbelievers say: "Listen not to this Qur'an but talk at\n\t\t\trandom in the midst of its (reading) that ye may gain the upper\n\t\t\thand!" 4496
But We will certainly give the Unbelievers a taste of a severe\n\t\t\tPenalty and We will requite them for the worst of their deeds.\n\t\t\t4497
Such is the requital of the enemies of Allah the Fire: therein\n\t\t\twill be for them the Eternal Home: a (fit) requital for that they\n\t\t\twere wont to reject Our Signs.
And the Unbelievers will say: "Our Lord! show us those among\n\t\t\tJinns and men who misled us: we shall crush them beneath our feet\n\t\t\tso that they become the vilest (before all)." 4498

In the case of those who say "Our Lord is Allah" and further stand straight and steadfast the angels descend on them (from time to time): "Fear ye not!" (they suggest) "nor grieve! but receive the Glad Tidings of the Garden (of Bliss) the which ye were promised! 4499
"We are your protectors in this life and in the Hereafter:\n\t\t\ttherein shall ye have all that your souls shall desire; therein\n\t\t\tshall ye have all that ye ask for! 4500 4501
"A hospitable gift from One Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful!"\n\t\t\t4502
Who is better in speech than one who calls (men) to Allah works\n\t\t\trighteousness and says "I am of those who bow in Islam"?\n\t\t\t4503
Nor can Goodness and Evil be equal. Repel (Evil) with what is\n\t\t\tbetter: then will he between whom and thee was hatred become as\n\t\t\tit were thy friend and intimate! 4504 4505
And no one will be granted such goodness except those who\n\t\t\texercise patience and self-restraint none but persons of the\n\t\t\tgreatest good fortune. 4506
And if (at any time) an incitement to discord is made to thee by\n\t\t\tthe Evil One seek refuge in Allah. He is the One Who hears and\n\t\t\tknows all things. 4507
Among His Signs are the Night and the Day and the sun and moon.\n\t\t\tAdore not the Sun and the Moon but adore Allah Who created them\n\t\t\tif it is Him ye wish to serve. 4508
But if they (Unbelievers) are arrogant (no matter): for in the presence of thy Lord are those who celebrate His praises by night and by day. And they never flag (nor feel themselves above it). 4509

And among His Signs is this: thou seest the earth barren and desolate; but when We send down rain to it it is stirred to life and yields increase. Truly He Who gives life to the (dead) earth can surely give life to (men) who are dead. For He has power over all things. 4510 4511

Those who pervert the Truth in Our Signs are not hidden from Us. Which is better? He that is cast into the Fire or he that comes safe through on the Day of Judgement? Do what ye will: Verily He seeth (clearly) all that ye do. 4512
Those who reject the Message when it comes to them (are not\n\t\t\thidden from Us); and indeed it is a Book of exalted power.\n\t\t\t4513
No falsehood can approach it from before or behind it: it is sent\n\t\t\tdown by One Full of Wisdom Worthy of all Praise. 4514
Nothing is said to thee that was not said to the apostles before\n\t\t\tthee: That thy Lord has at His command (all) Forgiveness as well\n\t\t\tas a most Grievous Penalty. 4515

Had We sent this as a Qur'an (in a language) other than Arabic they would have said: "Why are not its verses explained in detail? What! (a Book) not in Arabic and (a Messenger) an Arab?" Say: "It is a guide and a healing to those who believe; and for those who believe not there is a deafness in their ears and it is blindness in their (eyes); they are (as it were) being called from a place far distant!" 4516 4517

We certainly gave Moses the Book aforetime: but dispute arose therein. Had it not been for a word that went forth before from thy Lord (their differences) would have been settled between them: but they remained in suspicious disquieting doubt thereon. 4518
Whoever works righteousness benefits his own soul; whoever works\n\t\t\tevil it is against his own soul: nor is thy Lord ever unjust (in\n\t\t\tthe least) to His servants.

To Him is referred the Knowledge of the Hour (of Judgment: He knows all): no date-fruit comes out of its sheath nor does a female conceive (within her womb) nor bring forth (young) but by His Knowledge. The Day that (Allah) will propound to them the (question) "Where are the partners (ye attributed) to Me?" They will say "We do assure thee not one of us can bear witness!" 4519 4520
The (deities) they used to invoke aforetime will leave them in\n\t\t\tthe lurch and they will perceive that they have no way of escape.
Man does not weary of asking for good (things) but if ill touches\n\t\t\thim he gives up all hope (and) is lost in despair. 4521

When We give him a taste of some mercy from Ourselves after some adversity has touched him he is sure to say "This is due to my (merit): I think not that the Hour (of Judgment) will (ever) be established; but if I am brought back to my Lord I have (much) good (stored) in His sight!" But We will show the Unbelievers the truth of all that they did and We shall give them the taste of a severe Penalty. 4522
When We bestow favors on man he turns away and gets himself remote on his side (instead of coming to Us); and when Evil seizes him (he comes) full of prolonged prayer! 4523 4524
Say: "See ye if the (Revelation) is (really) from Allah and yet\n\t\t\tdo ye reject it? Who is more astray than one who is in schism far\n\t\t\t(from any purpose)?"

Soon will We show them Our Signs in the (furthest) regions (of
			the earth) and in their own souls until it becomes manifest to
			them that this is the Truth.  Is it not enough that thy Lord doth
			witness all things?
Ah indeed! are they in doubt concerning the Meeting with their\n\t\t\tLord? Ah indeed! it is He that doth encompass all things!\n\t\t\t4525
Ha Mim; 4526
`Ain Sin Qaf. 4527
Thus doth (He) send Inspiration to thee as (He did) to those\n\t\t\tbefore thee Allah Exalted in Power full of Wisdom. 4528
To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: and He is\n\t\t\tMost High Most Great. 4529

The heavens are almost rent asunder from above them (by His Glory): and the angels celebrate the Praises of their Lord and pray for forgiveness for (all) beings on earth: Behold! Verily Allah is He the Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. 4530 4531
And those who take as protectors others besides Him Allah doth\n\t\t\twatch over them; and thou art not the disposer of their affairs.\n\t\t\t4532

Thus have We sent by inspiration to thee an Arabic Qur'an: that thou mayest warn the Mother of Cities and all around her and warn (them) of the Day of Assembly of which there is no doubt: (when) some will be in the Garden and some in the Blazing Fire. 4533 4534 4535
If Allah had so willed He could have made them a single people;\n\t\t\tbut He admits whom He will to His Mercy; and the wrongdoers will\n\t\t\thave no protector nor helper. 4536
What! Have they taken (for worship) protectors besides Him? But\n\t\t\tit is Allah He is the Protector and it is He Who gives life to\n\t\t\tthe dead: it is He Who has power over all things. 4537
Whatever it be wherein ye differ the decision thereof is with\n\t\t\tAllah: Such is Allah my Lord: in Him I trust and to Him I turn.\n\t\t\t4538

(He is) the Creator of the heavens and the earth: He has made for you pairs from among yourselves and pairs among cattle: by this means does He multiply you: there is nothing whatever like unto Him and He is the One that hears and sees (all things). 4539
To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth: He enlarges\n\t\t\tand restricts the Sustenance to whom He will: for He knows full\n\t\t\twell all things. 4540

The same religion has He established for you as that which He enjoined on Noah--the which We have sent by inspiration to thee--and that which We enjoined on Abraham Moses and Jesus: Namely that ye should remain steadfast in Religion and make no divisions therein: to those who worship other things than Allah hard is the (way) to which thou callest them. Allah chooses to Himself those whom He pleases and guides to Himself those who turn (to Him). 4541 4542 4543

And they became divided only after knowledge reached them through selfish envy as between themselves. Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord (tending) to a Term appointed the matter would have been settled between them: but truly those who have inherited the Book after them are in suspicious (disquieting) doubt concerning it. 4544 4545 4546

Now then for that (reason) call (them to the Faith) and stand steadfast as thou art commanded nor follow thou their vain desires; but say: "I believe in the Book which Allah has sent down; and I am commanded to judge justly between you. Allah is Our Lord and your Lord. For us (is the responsibility for) Our deeds and for you for your deeds. There is no contention between us and you. Allah will bring us together and to Him is (Our) final goal. 4547 4548
But those who dispute concerning Allah after He has been accepted\n\t\t\tfutile is their dispute in the sight of their Lord: on them is\n\t\t\tWrath and for them will be a Penalty Terrible. 4549
It is Allah Who has sent down the Book in truth and the Balance\n\t\t\t(by which to weigh conduct). And what will make thee realize\n\t\t\tthat perhaps the Hour is close at hand? 4550
Only those wish to hasten it who believe not in it: those who believe hold it in awe and know that it is the Truth. Behold verily those that dispute concerning the Hour are far astray. 4551
Gracious is Allah to His servants: He gives Sustenance to whom He\n\t\t\tpleases: and He has Power and can carry out His Will.\n\t\t\t4552 4553 4554

To any that desires the tilth of the Hereafter We give increase in his tilth; and to any that desires the tilth of this world We grant somewhat thereof but he has no share or lot in the Hereafter. 4555

What! have they partners (in godhead) who have established for them some religion without the permission of Allah? Had it not been for the Decree of Judgement the matter would have been decided between them (at once): but verily the wrongdoers will have a grievous Penalty. 4556

Thou wilt see the wrongdoers in fear on account of what they have earned and (the burden of) that must (necessarily) fall on them. But those who believe and work righteous deeds will be in the luxuriant meads of the Gardens: they shall have before their Lord all that they wish for: that will indeed be the magnificent Bounty (of Allah). 4557 4558

That is (the Bounty) whereof Allah gives Glad Tidings to His Servants who believe and do righteous deeds. Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this except the love of those near of kin." And if anyone earns any good We shall give Him an increase of good in respect thereof: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Ready to appreciate (service). 4559 4560 4561

What! do they say "He has forged a falsehood against Allah"? But if Allah willed He could seal up thy heart. And Allah blots out Vanity and proves the Truth by His Words. For He knows well the secrets of all hearts. 4562
He is the One that accepts repentance from His Servants and\n\t\t\tforgives sins: and He knows all that ye do. 4563
And He listens to those who believe and do deeds of righteousness\n\t\t\tand gives them increase of His Bounty: but for the Unbelievers\n\t\t\tthere is a terrible Penalty. 4564

If Allah were to enlarge the provision for His Servants they would indeed transgress beyond all bounds through the earth; but He sends (it) down in due measure as He pleases: for He is with His Servants well-acquainted Watchful. 4565 4566
He is the One that sends down rain (even) after (men) have given\n\t\t\tup all hope and scatters His Mercy (far and wide). And He is the\n\t\t\tProtector Worthy Of all Praise. 4567
And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and He has power to gather them together when He wills. 4568 4569
Whatever misfortune happens to you is because of the things your\n\t\t\thands have wrought and for many (of them) He grants forgiveness.\n\t\t\t4570
Nor can ye frustrate (aught) (fleeing) through the earth; nor\n\t\t\thave ye besides Allah anyone to protect or to help. 4571
And among His Signs are the ships smooth-running through the\n\t\t\tocean (tall) as mountains. 4572
If it be His Will He can still the Wind: then would they become motionless on the back of the (ocean). Verily in this are Signs for everyone who patiently perseveres and is grateful. 4573
Or He can cause them to perish because of the (evil) which (the\n\t\t\tmen) have earned: but much doth He forgive.
But let those know who dispute about Our Signs that there is for\n\t\t\tthem no way of escape. 4574
Whatever ye are given (here) is (but) a convenience of this Life: but that which is with Allah is better and more lasting: (it is) for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord; 4575 4576
Those who avoid the greater crimes and shameful deeds and when\n\t\t\tthey are angry even then forgive; 4577
Those who hearken to their Lord and establish regular prayer; who (conduct) their affairs by mutual Consultation; who spend out of what We bestow on them for Sustenance; 4578 4579
And those who when an oppressive wrong is inflicted on them (are\n\t\t\tnot cowed but) help and defend themselves. 4580

The recompense for an injury is an injury equal thereto (in degree): but if a person forgives and makes reconciliation His reward is due from Allah: for (Allah) loveth not those who do wrong. 4581 4582 4583
But indeed if any do help and defend themselves after a wrong\n\t\t\t(done) to them against such there is no cause of blame.\n\t\t\t4584
The blame is only against those who oppress men with wrong-doing and insolently transgress beyond bounds through the land defying right and justice: for such there will be a Penalty grievous. 4585
But indeed if any show patience and forgive that would truly be\n\t\t\tan exercise of courageous will and resolution in the conduct of\n\t\t\taffairs. 4586
For any whom Allah leaves astray there is no protector thereafter\n\t\t\tand thou wilt see the wrongdoers when in sight of the Penalty\n\t\t\tSay: "Is there any way (to effect) a return? 4587

And thou wilt see them brought forward to the (Penalty) in a humble frame of mind because of (their) disgrace (and) looking with a stealthy glance. And the Believers will say: "Those are indeed in loss who have given the perdition their own selves and those belonging to them on the Day of Judgement. Behold! truly the wrongdoers are in a lasting Penalty!" 4588 4589
And no protectors have they to help them other than Allah: and\n\t\t\tfor any whom Allah leaves to stray there is no way (to the Goal).\n\t\t\t4590

Hearken ye to your Lord before there come a Day which there will be no putting back because of (the ordainment of) Allah! That Day there will be for you no place of refuge nor will there be for you any room for denial (of your sins)! 4591 4592

If then they turn away We have not sent thee as a guard over them. Thy duty is but to convey (the Message). And truly when We give man a taste of Mercy from Ourselves He doth exult thereat but when some ill happens to him on account of the deeds which His hands have sent forth truly then is man ungrateful! 4593 4594
To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He\n\t\t\tcreates what He wills (and plans). He bestows (children) male or\n\t\t\tfemale according to His Will (and Plan). 4595
Or He bestows both males and females and He leaves barren whom He\n\t\t\twill: for He is Full of knowledge and power. 4596

It is not fitting for a man that Allah should speak to him except by inspiration of from behind a veil or by the sending of a Messenger to reveal with Allah's permission what Allah wills: for He is Most High Most Wise. 4597 4598 4599 4600

And thus have We by Our command sent inspiration to thee: thou knowest not (before) what was Revelation and what was Faith; but We have made the (Qur'an) a Light wherewith We guide such of Our servants as We will; and verily thou dost guide (men) to the Straight Way 4601 4602
The Way of Allah to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and\n\t\t\twhatever is on earth: Behold (how) all affairs tend towards\n\t\t\tAllah! 4603
Ha Mim. 4604
By the Book that makes things clear
We have made it a Qur'an in Arabic that ye may be able to\n\t\t\tunderstand (and learn wisdom). 4605
And verily it is in the Mother of the Book in Our Presence high\n\t\t\t(in dignity) full of wisdom. 4606
Shall We then take away the Message from you and repel (you) for\n\t\t\tthat ye are a people transgressing beyond bounds? 4607
But how many were the prophets We sent amongst the peoples of\n\t\t\told? 4608
And never came there a prophet to them but they mocked him.
So We destroyed (them) stronger in power than these and (thus)\n\t\t\thas passed on the Parable of the peoples of old. 4609
If thou wert to question them `Who created the heavens and the earth?' They would be sure to reply `They were created by (Him) the Exalted in Power Full of knowledge' 4610 4611
(Yea the same that) has made for you the earth (like a carpet) spread out and has made for you roads (and channels) therein in order that ye may find guidance (on the way); 4612 4613
That sends down (from time to time rain from the sky in due\n\t\t\tmeasure; and We raise to life therewith a land that is dead; even\n\t\t\tso will ye be raised (from the dead) 4614 4615
That has created pairs in all things and has made for you ships\n\t\t\tand cattle on which ye ride 4616 4617

In order that ye may sit firm and square on their backs and when so seated ye may celebrate the (kind) favor of your Lord and say "Glory to Him Who has subjected these to Our (use) for We could never have accomplished this (by ourselves). 4618
"And to Our Lord surely Must We turn back!" 4619
Yet they attribute to some of His servants a share with Him (in\n\t\t\tHis godhead)! Truly is man a blasphemous ingrate avowed!\n\t\t\t4620
What! Has He taken Daughters out of what He Himself creates and\n\t\t\tgranted to you sons for choice? 4621
When news is brought to one of them of (the birth of) what he\n\t\t\tsets up as a likeness to (Allah) Most Gracious his face darkens\n\t\t\tand he is filled with inward grief! 4622
Is then one brought up among trinkets and unable to give a clear\n\t\t\taccount in a dispute (to be associated with Allah)? 4623
And they make into females angels who themselves serve Allah. \n\t\t\tDid they witness their creation? Their evidence will be recorded\n\t\t\tand they will be called to account! 4624
("Ah!") they say "If it had been the will of (Allah) Most Gracious We should not have worshipped such (deities)!" of that they have no knowledge! They Do nothing but lie! 4625 4626
What! have We given them a Book before this to which they are\n\t\t\tholding fast?
Nay! they say: "We found Our fathers following a certain religion\n\t\t\tand We do guide ourselves by their footsteps." 4627

Just in the same way whenever We sent a Warner before thee to any people the wealthy ones among them said: "We found Our fathers following a certain religion and We will certainly follow in their footsteps." 4628
He said: "What! even if I brought you better guidance than that which ye found your fathers following?" They said: "For us We deny that ye (prophets) are sent (on a mission at all)." 4629
So We exacted retribution from them: now see what was the end of\n\t\t\tthose who rejected (Truth)!
Behold! Abraham said to his father and his people: "I do indeed\n\t\t\tclear myself of what ye worship: 4630
"(I worship) only Him Who made me and He will certainly guide\n\t\t\tme."
And he left it as a Word to endure among those who came after him\n\t\t\tthat they may turn back (to Allah). 4631
Yea I have given the good things of this life to these (men) and\n\t\t\ttheir fathers until the Truth has come to them and an Apostle\n\t\t\tmaking things clear. 4632
But when the Truth came to them they said: "This is sorcery and\n\t\t\tWe do reject it." 4633
Also they say: "Why is not this Qur'an sent down to some leading\n\t\t\tman in either of the two (Chief) cities?" 4634

Is it they who would portion out the Mercy of thy Lord? It is We Who portion out between them their livelihood in the life of this world: and We raise some of them above others in ranks so that some may command work from others. But the Mercy of thy Lord is better than the (wealth) which they amass. 4635

And were it not that (all) men might become of one (evil) way of life We would provide for everyone that blasphemes against (Allah) Most Gracious silver roofs for their houses and (silver) stair-ways on which to go up. 4636
And (silver) doors to their houses and thrones (of silver) on\n\t\t\twhich they could recline
And also adornments of gold. But all this were nothing but\n\t\t\tconveniences of the present life: the Hereafter in the sight of\n\t\t\tthy Lord is for the Righteous. 4637
If anyone withdraws himself from remembrance of (Allah) Most\n\t\t\tGracious We appoint for him an evil one to be an intimate\n\t\t\tcompanion to him. 4638
Such (evil ones) really hinder them from the Path but they think\n\t\t\tthat they are being guided aright! 4639
At length when (such a one) comes to Us he says (to his evil companion): "Would that between me and thee were the distance of East and West!" Ah! Evil is the companion (indeed)! 4640 4641
When ye have done wrong it will avail you nothing that day that\n\t\t\tye shall be partners in punishment! 4642
Canst thou then make the deaf to hear or give direction to the\n\t\t\tblind or to such as (wander) in manifest error? 4643\n\t\t\t4644
Even if We take thee away We shall be sure to exact retribution\n\t\t\tfrom them. 4645
Or We shall show thee that (accomplished) which We have promised\n\t\t\tthem: for verily We shall prevail over them.
So hold thou fast to the Revelation sent down to thee: verily\n\t\t\tthou art on Straight Way. 4646
The (Qur'an) is indeed the Message for thee and for thy people;\n\t\t\tand soon shall ye (all) be brought to account. 4647
And question thou Our apostles whom We sent before thee; did We\n\t\t\tappoint any deities other than (Allah) Most Gracious to be\n\t\t\tworshipped? 4648
We did send Moses aforetime with Our Signs to Pharaoh and his\n\t\t\tChiefs: he said "I am an apostle of the Lord of the Worlds."\n\t\t\t4649
But when he came to them with Our Signs behold they ridiculed\n\t\t\tthem. 4650
We showed them Sign after Sign each greater than its fellow and We \n\t\t\tseized them with Punishment in order that they might turn (to \n\t\t\tUs). 4651
And they said "O thou Sorcerer! invoke thy Lord for us according\n\t\t\tto His covenant with thee; for We shall truly accept guidance."\n\t\t\t4652
But when We removed the Penalty from them behold they broke their\n\t\t\tword.
And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people saying: "O my people! does not the dominion of Egypt belong to me (witness) these streams flowing underneath my (palace)? What! see ye not then? 4653
"Am I not better than this (Moses) who is a contemptible wretch\n\t\t\tand can scarcely express himself clearly? 4654
"Then why are not gold bracelets bestowed on him or (why) come\n\t\t\t(not) with him angels accompanying him in procession?"\n\t\t\t4655
Thus did he make fools of his people and they obeyed him: Truly\n\t\t\twere they a people rebellious (against Allah).
When at length they provoked Us We exacted retribution from them\n\t\t\tand We drowned them all 4656 4657
And We made them (a people) of the Past and an Example to later\n\t\t\tages. 4658
When (Jesus) the son of Mary is held up as an example behold thy \n\t\t\tpeople raise a clamor there at (in ridicule)! 4659
And they say " Are Our gods best or He?" This they set forth to\n\t\t\tthee only by way of disputation: yea they are a contentious\n\t\t\tpeople.
He was no more than a servant: We granted Our favor to him and We\n\t\t\tmade him an example to the Children of Israel. 4660
And if it were Our Will We could make angels from amongst you\n\t\t\tsucceeding each other on the earth. 4661
And (Jesus) shall be a Sign (for the coming of) the Hour (of\n\t\t\tJudgment): therefore have no doubt about the (Hour) but follow ye\n\t\t\tMe: this is a Straight Way. 4662
Let not the Evil One hinder you: for he is to you an enemy\n\t\t\tavowed.
When Jesus came with Clear Signs he said: "Now have I come to you with Wisdom and in order to make clear to you some of the (points) on which ye dispute: therefore fear Allah and obey me. 4663
