"For Allah; He is my Lord and your Lord: so worship ye Him: this\n\t\t\tis a Straight Way." 4664
But sects from among themselves fell into disagreement: then woe\n\t\t\tto the wrongdoers from the Penalty of a Grievous Day!
Do they only wait for the Hour that it should come on them all of\n\t\t\ta sudden while they perceive not? 4665
Friends on that Day will be foes one to another except the\n\t\t\tRighteous. 4666
My devotees! no fear shall be on you that Day nor shall ye grieve\n\t\t\t4667
(Being) those who have believed in Our Signs and bowed (their\n\t\t\twills to Ours) in Islam.
Enter ye the Garden ye and your wives in (beauty and) rejoicing.\n\t\t\t4668
To them will be passed round dishes and goblets of gold: there will be there all that the souls could desire all that the eyes could delight in: and ye shall abide therein (for aye). 4669
Such will be the Garden of which ye are made heirs for your\n\t\t\t(good) deeds (in life). 4670
Ye shall have therein abundance of fruit from which ye shall have\n\t\t\tsatisfaction. 4671 4672
The Sinners will be in the Punishment of Hell to dwell therein\n\t\t\t(for aye):
Nowise will the (punishment) be lightened for them and in despair\n\t\t\twill they be there overwhelmed.
Nowise shall We be unjust to them: but it is they who have been\n\t\t\tunjust themselves. 4673
They will cry: "O Malik! would that thy Lord put an end to us!" \n\t\t\tHe will say "Nay but ye shall abide!" 4674 4675
Verily We have brought the truth to you: but most of you have a\n\t\t\thatred for Truth. 4676
What! have they settled some Plan (among themselves)? But it is\n\t\t\tWe Who settle things. 4677
Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private\n\t\t\tcounsels? Indeed (We do) and Our Messengers are by them to\n\t\t\trecord. 4678
Say: "If (Allah) Most Gracious had a son I would be the first to\n\t\t\tworship." 4679
Glory to the Lord of the heavens and the earth the Lord of the\n\t\t\tThrone (of Authority)! (He is free) from the things they\n\t\t\tattribute (to Him)! 4680
So leave them to babble and play (with vanities) until they meet\n\t\t\tthat Day of theirs which they have been promised. 4681
It is He Who is Allah in heaven and Allah on earth; and He is\n\t\t\tfull of Wisdom and Knowledge.
And blessed is He to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all between them: with Him is the knowledge of the Hour (of Judgment): And to Him shall ye be brought back. 4682
And those whom they invoke besides Allah have no power of\n\t\t\tintercession; only he who bears witness to the Truth and they\n\t\t\tknow (him). 4683
If thou ask them Who Created them they will certainly say Allah:\n\t\t\thow then are they deluded away (from the Truth)? 4684
(Allah has knowledge) of the (Prophet's) cry "O my Lord! truly\n\t\t\tthese are a people who will not believe!" 4685\n\t\t\t4686
But turn away from them and say "Peace!" but soon shall they\n\t\t\tknow! 4687
Ha Mim. 4688
By the Book that makes things clear 4689
We sent it down during a blessed night: for We (ever) wish to\n\t\t\twarn (against Evil). 4690
In that (night) is made distinct every affair of wisdom\n\t\t\t4691
By command from Our presence.  For We (ever) send (revelations)
As a Mercy from thy Lord: for He hears and knows (all things);\n\t\t\t4692
The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all between them if ye\n\t\t\t(but) have an assured faith. 4693
There is no god but He: it is He Who gives life and gives death\n\t\t\tthe Lord and Cherisher to you and your earliest ancestors.
Yet they play about in doubt. 4694
Then watch thou for the Day that the sky will bring forth a kind\n\t\t\tof smoke (or mist) plainly visible. 4695 4696
Enveloping the people: this will be a Penalty Grievous.
(They will say:) "Our Lord! remove the Penalty from us for We do\n\t\t\treally believe!"
How shall the Message be (effectual) for them seeing that an\n\t\t\tApostle explaining things clearly has (already) come to them\n\t\t\t4697
Yet they turn away from him and say: "Tutored (by others) a man\n\t\t\tpossessed!" 4698
We shall indeed remove the Penalty for a while (but) truly ye\n\t\t\twill revert (to your ways). 4699
One day We shall seize you with a mighty onslaught We will indeed\n\t\t\t(then) exact Retribution!
We did before them try the people of Pharaoh: there came to them\n\t\t\tand apostle most honorable 4700 4701
Saying: "Restore to me the servants of Allah: I am to you an\n\t\t\tapostle worthy of all trust; 4702 4703
"And be not arrogant as against Allah: for I come to you with\n\t\t\tauthority manifest.
"For me I have sought Safety with my Lord and your Lord against\n\t\t\tyour injuring me. 4704 4705
"If ye believe me not at least keep yourselves away from me."\n\t\t\t4706
(But they were aggressive): then he cried to his Lord: "These are\n\t\t\tindeed a people given to sin." 4707
(The reply came): "March forth with My servants by night: for ye\n\t\t\tare sure to be pursued.
"And leave the sea as a furrow (divided). For they are a host\n\t\t\t(destined) to be drowned." 4708
How many were the gardens and springs they left behind.\n\t\t\t4709
And corn-fields and noble buildings.
And wealth (and conveniences of life) wherein they had taken such\n\t\t\tdelight!
Thus (was their end)! And We made other people inherit (those\n\t\t\tthings)!
And neither heaven nor earth shed a tear over them: nor were they\n\t\t\tgiven a respite (again). 4710
We did deliver aforetime the Children of Israel from humiliating\n\t\t\tPunishment 4711
Inflicted by Pharaoh for he was arrogant (even) among inordinate\n\t\t\ttransgressors.
And We chose them aforetime above the nations knowingly\n\t\t\t4712
And granted them Signs in which there was a manifest trial.\n\t\t\t4713
As to these (Quraish) they say forsooth: 4714
"There is nothing beyond our first death and we shall not be\n\t\t\traised again.
"Then bring (back) our forefathers if what ye say is true!"
What! are they better than the people of Tubba and those who were\n\t\t\tbefore them? We destroyed them because they were guilty of sin.\n\t\t\t4715 4716
We created not the heavens the earth and all between them merely\n\t\t\tin (idle) sport: 4717
We created them not except for just ends: but most of them do not\n\t\t\tunderstand.
Verily the Day of Sorting Out is the time appointed for all of\n\t\t\tthem 4718
The Day when no protector can avail his client in aught and no\n\t\t\thelp can they receive. 4719
Except such as receive Allah's Mercy: for He is exalted in Might\n\t\t\tMost Merciful. 4720
Verily the tree of Zaqqum 4721 4722
Will be the food of the Sinful
Like molten brass; it will boil in their insides
Like the boiling of scalding water.
(A voice will cry:) "Seize ye him and drag him into the midst of\n\t\t\tthe Blazing Fire!
"Then pour over his head the Penalty of Boiling Water;
"Taste thou (this)! Truly wast thou Mighty full of honor!\n\t\t\t4723
"Truly this is what ye used to doubt!" 4724
As to the Righteous (they will be) in a position of Security\n\t\t\t4725
Among Gardens and Springs;
Dressed in fine silk and in rich brocade they will face each\n\t\t\tother; 4726 4727
So; and We shall Join them to Companions with beautiful big and\n\t\t\tlustrous eyes. 4728 4729
There can they call for every kind of fruit in peace and\n\t\t\tsecurity; 4730
Nor will they there taste Death except the first Death; and He\n\t\t\twill preserve them from the Penalty of the Blazing Fire\n\t\t\t4731 4732
As a Bounty from thy Lord! That will be the supreme achievement!\n\t\t\t4733
Verily We have made this (Qur'an) easy in thy tongue in order\n\t\t\tthat they may give heed. 4734
So wait thou and watch; for they (too) are waiting.
Ha Mim. 4735
The revelation of the Book is from Allah the Exalted in power\n\t\t\tFull of Wisdom. 4736
Verily in the heavens and the earth are Signs for those who\n\t\t\tbelieve. 4737
And in the creation of yourselves and the fact that animals are\n\t\t\tscattered (through the earth) are Signs for those of assured\n\t\t\tFaith. 4738

And in the alternation of Night and Day and the fact that Allah sends down Sustenance from the sky and revives therewith the earth after its death and the change of the winds are Signs for those that are wise. 4739 4740
Such are the Signs of Allah which We rehearse to thee in truth:\n\t\t\tthen in what exposition will they believe after (rejecting) Allah\n\t\t\tand His Signs? 4741
Woe to each sinful Dealer in Falsehoods: 4742
He hears the Signs of Allah rehearsed to him yet is obstinate and\n\t\t\tlofty as if he had not heard them: then announce to him a Penalty\n\t\t\tGrievous!
And when he learns something of Our Signs he takes them in jest:\n\t\t\tfor such there will be a humiliating Penalty. 4743
In front of them is Hell: and of no profit to them is anything they may have earned nor any protectors they may have taken to themselves besides Allah: for them is a tremendous Penalty. 4744
This is (true) Guidance: and for those who reject the Signs of\n\t\t\ttheir Lord is a grievous Penalty of abomination. 4745
It is Allah Who has subjected the sea to you that ships may sail\n\t\t\tthrough it by His command that ye may seek of His Bounty and that\n\t\t\tye may be grateful. 4746
And He has subjected to you as from Him all that is in the\n\t\t\theavens and on earth: behold in that are Signs indeed for those\n\t\t\twho reflect. 4747
Tell those who believe to forgive those who do not look forward to the Days of Allah: it is for Him to recompense (for good or ill) each People according to what they have earned. 4748 4749 4750
If anyone does a righteous deed it is to his own benefit; if he\n\t\t\tdoes evil it works against (His own soul). In the end will ye\n\t\t\t(all) be brought back to your Lord. 4751
We did aforetime grant to the Children of Israel the Book the Power of Command and Prophethood; We gave them for Sustenance things good and pure; and We favored them above the nations. 4752 4753

And We granted them clear Signs in affairs (of Religion): it was only after knowledge had been granted to them that they fell into schisms through insolent envy among themselves. Verily thy Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgement as to those matters in which they set up differences. 4754 4755
Then We put thee on the (right) Way of Religion: so follow thou\n\t\t\tthat (Way) and follow not the desires of those who know not.\n\t\t\t4756
They will be of no use to thee in the sight of Allah: it is only\n\t\t\tWrongdoers (that stand as) protectors one to another: but Allah\n\t\t\tis the Protector of the Righteous. 4757
These are clear evidences to men and a Guidance and Mercy to\n\t\t\tthose of assured Faith. 4758

What! do those who seek after evil ways think that We shall hold them equal with those who believe and do righteous deeds that equal will be their Life and their death? Ill is the judgment that they make. 4759
Allah created the heavens and the earth for just ends and in\n\t\t\torder that each soul may find the recompense of what it has\n\t\t\tearned and none of them be wronged. 4760

Then seest thou such a one as takes as his god his own vain desire? Allah has knowing (him as such) left him astray and sealed His hearing and his heart (and understanding) and put a cover on his sight. Who then will guide him after Allah (has withdrawn Guidance)? Will ye not then receive admonition? 4761 4762
And they say: "What is there but our life in this world? We shall\n\t\t\tdie and we live and nothing but Time can destroy us." But of that\n\t\t\tthey have no knowledge: they merely conjecture: 4763
And when Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them their argument is\n\t\t\tnothing but this: they say "Bring (back) our forefathers if what\n\t\t\tye say is true!" 4764
Say: "It is Allah Who gives you life then gives you death; then\n\t\t\tHe will gather you together for the Day of Judgement about which\n\t\t\tthere is no doubt": but most men do not understand.
To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and\n\t\t\tthe Day that the Hour of Judgment is established that Day will\n\t\t\tthe dealers in Falsehood perish! 4765
And thou wilt see every sect bowing the knee: every sect will be\n\t\t\tcalled to its Record: "This Day shall ye be recompensed for all\n\t\t\tthat ye did! 4766
"This Our Record speaks about you with truth: for We were wont to\n\t\t\tput on record all that ye did." 4767
Then as to those who believed and did righteous deeds their Lord\n\t\t\twill admit them to His Mercy: that will be the Achievement for\n\t\t\tall to see. 4768
But as to those who reject Allah (to them will be said): "Were\n\t\t\tnot Our Signs rehearsed to you? But ye were arrogant and were a\n\t\t\tpeople given to sin!

"And when it was said that the promise of Allah was true and that the Hour there was no doubt about its (coming) ye used to say `We know not what is the Hour: we only think it is an idea and we have no firm assurance.'" 4769
Then will appear to them the evil (fruits) of what they did and\n\t\t\tthey will be completely encircled by that which they used to mock\n\t\t\tat! 4770
It will also be said: "This Day We will forget you as ye forgot\n\t\t\tthe meeting of this Day of yours! And your abode is the Fire and\n\t\t\tno helpers have ye! 4771

"This because ye used to take the Signs of Allah in jest and the life of the world deceived you." (From) the Day therefore they shall not be taken out thence nor shall they be received into Grace. 4772
Then Praise be to Allah Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth\n\t\t\tLord and Cherisher of all the worlds! 4773
To Him be Glory throughout the heavens and the earth: and He is\n\t\t\tExalted in Power Full of Wisdom!
Ha Mim. 4774
The revelation of the Book is from Allah the Exalted in Power\n\t\t\tFull of Wisdom. 4775
We created not the heavens and the earth and all between them but\n\t\t\tfor just ends and for a term appointed: but those who reject\n\t\t\tFaith turn away from that whereof they are warned. 4776

Say: "Do ye see what it is ye invoke besides Allah? Show me what it is they have created on earth or have they a share in the heavens? Bring me a Book (revealed) before this or any remnant of knowledge (ye may have) if ye are telling the truth!" 4777 4778
And who is more astray than one who invokes besides Allah such as\n\t\t\twill not answer him to the Day of Judgement and who (in fact) are\n\t\t\tunconscious of their call (to them)? 4779
And when mankind are gathered together (at the Resurrection) they\n\t\t\twill be hostile to them and reject their worship (altogether)!
When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them the Unbelievers say of\n\t\t\tthe Truth when it comes to them: "This is evident sorcery!"\n\t\t\t4780

Or do they say "He has forged it"? Say: "Had I forged it then can ye obtain no single (blessing) for me from Allah. He knows best of that whereof ye talk (so glibly)! Enough is He for a witness between me and you! And He is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful." 4781

Say: "I am no bringer of new-fangled doctrine among the apostles nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I follow but that which is revealed to me by inspiration: I am but a Warner open and clear." 4782

Say: "See ye? If (this teaching) be from Allah and ye reject it and a witness from among the Children of Israel testifies to its similarity (with earlier scriptures) and has believed while ye are arrogant (how unjust ye are!) truly Allah guides not a people unjust." 4783 4784

The Unbelievers say of those who believe: "If (this Message) were a good thing (such men) would not have gone to it first before us!" and seeing that they guide not themselves thereby they will say "This is an (old) old falsehood!" 4785
And before this was the Book of Moses as a guide and a mercy; and\n\t\t\tthis Book confirms (it) in the Arabic tongue; to admonish the\n\t\t\tunjust and as Glad Tidings to those who do right. 4786
Verily those who say "Our Lord is Allah" and remain firm (on that\n\t\t\tPath) on them shall be no fear nor shall they grieve.\n\t\t\t4787 4788
Such shall be Companions of the Garden dwelling Therein (for\n\t\t\taye): a recompense for their (good) deeds.

We have enjoined on man Kindness to his parents: in pain did his mother bear him and in pain did she give him birth. The carrying of the (child) to his weaning is (a period of) thirty months. At length when he reaches the age of full strength and attains forty years he says "O my Lord! grant me that I may be grateful for Thy favor which Thou hast bestowed upon me and upon both my parents and that I may work righteousness such as Thou mayest approve; and be gracious to me in my issue. Truly have I turned to Thee and truly do I bow (to Thee) in Islam." 4789 4790 4791

Such are they from whom We shall accept the best of their deeds and pass by their ill deeds: (they shall be) among the Companions of the Garden: a promise of truth which was made to them (in this life). 4792

But (there is one) who says to his parents "Fie on you! Do ye hold out the promise to me that I shall be raised up even though generations have passed before me (without rising again)? " And they two seek Allah's aid (and rebuke the son): "Woe to thee! have Faith! For the promise of Allah is true." But he says "This is nothing but tales of the ancients!" 4793
Such are they against whom is proved the Sentence among the\n\t\t\tprevious generations of Jinns and men that have passed away; for\n\t\t\tthey will be (utterly) lost. 4794
And to all are (assigned) degrees according to the deeds which\n\t\t\tthey (have done) and in order that (Allah) may recompense their\n\t\t\tdeeds and no injustice be done to them. 4795

And on the Day that the Unbelievers will be placed before the Fire (it will be said to them): "Ye received your good things in the life of the world and ye took your pleasure out of them: but today shall ye be recompensed with a Penalty of humiliation: for that ye were arrogant on earth without just cause and that ye (ever) transgressed." 4796 4797

Mention (Hud) one of `Ad's (own) brethren: behold he warned his people about the winding Sand-tracts: but there have been Warners before him and after him: "Worship ye none other than Allah: truly I fear for you the Penalty of a Mighty Day." 4798 4799
They said: "Hast thou come in order to turn us aside from Our\n\t\t\tgods? Then bring upon us the (calamity) with which thou dost\n\t\t\tthreaten us if thou art telling the truth!" 4800
He said: "The Knowledge (of when it will come) is only with\n\t\t\tAllah: I proclaim to you the mission on which I have been sent:\n\t\t\tbut I see that ye are a people in ignorance!"... 4801

Then when they saw the (Penalty in the shape of ) a cloud traversing the sky coming to meet their valleys they said "This cloud will give us rain!" "Nay it is the (calamity) ye were asking to be hastened! a wind wherein is a Grievous Penalty! 4802
"Everything will it destroy by the command of its Lord!" Then by\n\t\t\tthe morning they nothing was to be seen but (the ruins of) their\n\t\t\thouses! Thus do We recompense those given to sin! 4803

And We had firmly established them in a (prosperity and) power which We have not given to you (ye Quraish!) and We had endowed them with (faculties of) hearing seeing heart and intellect: but of no profit to them were their (faculties of) hearing sight and heart and intellect when they went on rejecting the Signs of Allah; and they were (completely) encircled by that which they used to mock at! 4804 4805 4806
We destroyed aforetime populations round about you; and We have\n\t\t\tshown the Signs in various ways that they may turn (to Us).\n\t\t\t4807

Why then was no help forthcoming to them from those whom they worshipped as gods besides Allah as a means of access (to Allah)? Nay they left them in the lurch: but that was their Falsehood and their invention. 4808

Behold We turned towards thee a company of Jinns (quietly) listening to the Qur'an: when they stood in the presence thereof they said "Listen in silence!" When the (reading) was finished they returned to their people to warn (them of their sins). 4809
They said "O our people! We have heard a Book revealed after\n\t\t\tMoses confirming what came before it: it guides (men) to the\n\t\t\tTruth and to a Straight Path.
"O our people hearken to the one who invites (you) to Allah and\n\t\t\tbelieve in him: He will forgive you your faults and deliver you\n\t\t\tfrom a Penalty Grievous. 4810
"If any does not hearken to the one who invites (Us) to Allah he cannot frustrate (Allah's Plan) on earth and no protectors can he have besides Allah such men (wander) in manifest error." 4811
See they not that Allah Who created the heavens and the earth and\n\t\t\tnever wearied with their creation is able to give life to the\n\t\t\tdead? Yea verily He has power over all things. 4812

And on the Day that the Unbelievers will be placed before the Fire (they will be asked) "Is this not the Truth? " They will say "Yea by our Lord!" (One will say:) "Then taste ye the Penalty for that ye were wont to deny (Truth)!" 4813 4814

Therefore patiently persevere as did (all) apostles of inflexible purpose; and be in no haste about the (Unbelievers). On the Day that they see the (Punishment) promised them (it will be ) as if they had not tarried more than an hour in a single day. (Thine but) to proclaim the Message: but shall any be destroyed except those who transgress? 4815 4816
Those who reject Allah and hinder (men) from the Path of Allah\n\t\t\ttheir deeds will Allah render astray (From their mark).\n\t\t\t4817

But those who believe and work deeds of righteousness and believe in the (Revelation) sent down to Muhammad-for it is the Truth from their Lord He will remove from them their ills and improve their condition. 4818
This because those who reject Allah follow vanities while those\n\t\t\twho believe follow the Truth from their Lord: Thus does Allah set\n\t\t\tforth for men their lessons by similitudes. 4819

Therefore when ye meet the Unbelievers (in fight) smite at their necks; at length when ye have thoroughly subdued them bind a bond firmly (on them): thereafter (is the time for) either generosity or ransom: Until the war lays down its burdens. Thus (are ye commanded): but if it had been Allah's Will He could certainly have exacted retribution from them (Himself); but (He lets you fight) in order to test you some with others. But those who are slain in the way of Allah He will never let their deeds be lost. 4820 4821 4822 4823 4824
Soon will He guide them and improve their condition.\n\t\t\t4825
And admit them to the Garden which He has announced for them.\n\t\t\t4826
O ye who believe! if ye will aid (the cause of) Allah He will aid\n\t\t\tyou and plant your feet firmly.
But those who reject (Allah) for them is destruction and (Allah)\n\t\t\twill render their deeds astray (from their mark). 4827
That is because they hate the Revelation of Allah; so He has made\n\t\t\ttheir deeds fruitless. 4828
Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of those before them (who did evil)? Allah brought utter destruction on them and similar (fates await) those who reject Allah. 4829
That is because Allah is the Protector of those who believe but\n\t\t\tthose who reject Allah have no protector.

Verily Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to Gardens beneath which rivers flow; while those who reject Allah will enjoy (this world) and eat as cattle eat; and the Fire will be their abode. 4830
And how many cities with more power than thy city which has\n\t\t\tdriven thee out have We destroyed (for their sins)? And there was\n\t\t\tnone to aid them. 4831
Is then one who is on a clear (Path) from his Lord no better than\n\t\t\tone to whom the evil of his conduct seems pleasing and such as\n\t\t\tfollow their own lusts? 4832

(Here is) a Parable of the Garden which the righteous are promised: in it are rivers of water incorruptible: rivers of milk of which the taste never changes; rivers of wine a joy to those who drink; and rivers of honey pure and clear. In it there are for them all kinds of fruits and Grace from their Lord. (Can those in such Bliss) be compared to such as shall dwell for ever in the Fire and be given to drink boiling water so that it cuts up their bowels (to pieces)? 4833 4834 4835 4836

And among them are men who listen to thee but in the end when they go out from thee they say to those who have received Knowledge: "What is it he said just then?" Such are men whose hearts Allah has sealed and who follow their own lusts. 4837
But to those who receive Guidance He increases (the light of)\n\t\t\tGuidance and bestows on them their Piety and Restraint (from\n\t\t\tevil). 4838

Do they then only wait for the Hour that it should come on them of a sudden? But already have come some tokens thereof and when it (actually) is on them how can they benefit then by their admonition? 4839 4840
Know therefore that there is no god but Allah and ask forgiveness for the fault and for the men and women who believe: for Allah knows how ye move about and how ye dwell in your homes. 4841 4842

Those who believe say "Why is not a Surah sent down (for us)?" But when a Surah of basic or categorical meaning is revealed and fighting is mentioned therein thou wilt see those in whose hearts is a disease looking at thee with a look of one in swoon at the approach of death: but more fitting for them 4843 4844 4845
Were it to obey and say what is just and when a matter is\n\t\t\tresolved on it were best for them if they were true to Allah.\n\t\t\t4846
Then is it to be expected of you if ye will do no mischief in the\n\t\t\tland and break your ties of kith and kin? 4847
Such are the men whom Allah has cursed for He has made them deaf\n\t\t\tand blinded their sight. 4848
Do they not then earnestly seek to understand the Qur'an or are\n\t\t\ttheir hearts locked up by them?
Those who turn back as apostates after Guidance was clearly shown\n\t\t\tto them the Evil One has instigated them and buoyed them up with\n\t\t\tfalse hopes. 4849
This because they said to those who hate what Allah has revealed\n\t\t\t"We will obey you in part of (this) matter"; but Allah knows\n\t\t\ttheir (inner) secrets. 4850
But how (will it be) when the angels take their souls at death\n\t\t\tand smite their faces and their backs? 4851\n\t\t\t4852
This because they followed that which called forth the Wrath of\n\t\t\tAllah and they hated Allah's good pleasure; so He made their\n\t\t\tdeeds of no effect.
Or do those in whose hearts is a disease think that Allah will\n\t\t\tnot bring to light all their rancor? 4853
Had We so willed We could have shown them up to thee and thou shouldst have known them by their marks: but surely thou wilt know them by the tone of their speech! And Allah knows All that ye do. 4854
And We shall try you until We test those among you who strive\n\t\t\ttheir utmost and persevere in patience; and We shall try your\n\t\t\treported (mettle). 4855 4856

Those who reject Allah hinder (men) from the Path of Allah and resist the Apostle after Guidance has been clearly shown to them will not injure Allah in the least but He will make their deeds of no effect. 4857
O ye who believe! obey Allah and obey the Apostle and make not\n\t\t\tvain your deeds!

Be not weary and faint-hearted crying for peace. When ye should\n\t\t\tbe Uppermost: for Allah is with you and will never put you in\n\t\t\tloss for your (good) deeds. 4859
The life of this world is but play and amusement: and if ye believe land guard against evil He will grant you your recompense and will not ask you (to give up) your possessions. 4860 4861
If He were to ask you for all of them and press you ye would\n\t\t\tcovetously withhold and He would bring out all your ill-feeling.\n\t\t\t4862 4863

Behold ye are those invited to spend (of your substance) in the way of Allah: but among you are some that are niggardly. But any who are niggardly are so at the expense of their own souls. But Allah is free of all wants and it is ye that are needy. If ye turn back (from the Path) He will substitute in your stead another people; then they would not be like you! 4864 4865
Verily We have granted thee a manifest Victory: 4866
That Allah may forgive thee thy faults of the past and those to\n\t\t\tfollow; fulfil His favor to thee; and guide thee on the Straight\n\t\t\tWay; 4867
And that Allah may help thee with powerful help. 4868

It is He who sent down Tranquillity into the hearts of the Believers that they may Add Faith to their Faith; for to Allah belong the Forces of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom; 4869 4870 4871

That He may admit the men and women who believe to Gardens beneath which rivers flow to dwell therein for aye and remove their ills from them; and that is in the sight of Allah the highest achievement (For man) 4872

And that He may punish the Hypocrites men and women and the Polytheists men and women who imagine an evil opinion of Allah. On them is a round of Evil: the Wrath of Allah is on them: He has cursed them and got Hell ready for them: and evil is it for a destination. 4873 4874
For to Allah belong the Forces of the heavens and the earth; and\n\t\t\tAllah is Exalted in Power Full of Wisdom. 4875
We have truly sent thee as a witness as a bringer of Glad Tidings\n\t\t\tand as a Warner: 4876
In order that ye (o men) may believe in Allah and His Apostle\n\t\t\tthat ye may assist and honor Him and celebrate his praises\n\t\t\tmorning and evening. 4876

Verily those who plight their fealty to thee do no less than plight their fealty to Allah: the Hand of Allah is over their hands: Then anyone who violates His oath does so to the harm of his own soul and anyone who fulfills what he has covenanted with Allah Allah will soon grant him a great Reward. 4877

The desert Arabs who lagged behind will say to thee: "We were engaged in (looking after) our flocks and herds and our families; do thou then ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say: "Who then has any power at all (to intervene) on your behalf with Allah if His will is to give you some loss or to give you some profit? but Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do. 4878 4879 4880

"Nay ye thought that the Apostle and the Believers would never return to their families; this seemed pleasing in your hearts and ye conceived an evil thought for ye are a people lost (in wickedness)." 4881
And if any believe not in Allah and His Apostle We have prepared\n\t\t\tfor those who reject Allah a Blazing Fire!
To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: He\n\t\t\tforgives whom He wills and He punishes whom He wills: but Allah\n\t\t\tis Oft- Forgiving Most Merciful. 4882

Those who lagged behind (will say) when ye (are free to) march and take booty (in war): "Permit us to follow you." They wish to change Allah's decree: Say: "Not thus will ye follow us: Allah has already declared (this) beforehand": then they will say "but ye are jealous of us." Nay but little do they understand (such things). 4883 4884 4885 4886

Say to the desert Arabs who lagged behind: "Ye shall be summoned (to fight) against a people given to vehement war: then shall ye fight or they shall submit. Then if ye show obedience Allah will grant you a goodly reward but if ye turn back as ye did before He will punish you with a grievous Penalty." 4887 4888 4890

No blame is there on the blind nor is there blame on the lame nor on one ill (if he joins not the war): but he that obeys Allah and His Apostle (Allah) will admit him to Gardens beneath which rivers flow; and he who turns back (Allah) will punish him with a grievous Penalty. 4890

Allah's Good Pleasure was on the believers when they swore Fealty to thee under the Tree: He knew what was in their hearts and He sent down tranquillity to them and He rewarded them with a speedy Victory; 4891 4892 4893 4894 4895
And many gains will they acquire (besides): and Allah is Exalted\n\t\t\tin Power Full of Wisdom.

Allah has promised you many gains that ye shall acquire and He has given you these beforehand; and He has restrained the hands of men from you; that it may be a Sign for the Believers and that He may guide you to a Straight Path; 4896 4897 4898
And other gains (there are) which are not within your power but\n\t\t\twhich Allah has compassed: and Allah has power over all things.\n\t\t\t4899
If the Unbelievers should fight you they would certainly turn\n\t\t\ttheir backs; then would they find neither protector nor helper.\n\t\t\t4900
(Such has been) the practice. (Approved) of Allah already in the\n\t\t\tpast: no change wilt thou find in the practice (approved) of\n\t\t\tAllah. 4901
And it is He who has restrained their hands from you and your hand from them in the midst of Mecca after that He gave you the victory over them. And Allah sees well all that ye do. 4902

They are the ones who denied revelation and hindered you from the Sacred Mosque and the sacrificial animals detained from reaching their place of sacrifice. Had there not been believing men and believing women whom ye did not know that ye were trampling down and on whose account a crime would have accrued to you without (your) knowledge. (Allah would have allowed you to force your way but He held back your hands) that He may admit to His mercy whom He will. If they had been apart We should certainly have punished the Unbelievers among them with a grievous punishment. 4903 4903 4904 4905 4906

While the Unbelievers got up in their hearts heat and cant--the heat and cant of Ignorance--Allah sent down His tranquillity to His Apostle and to the Believers and made them stick close to the command of self-restraint; and well were they entitled to it and worthy of it. And Allah has full knowledge of all things. 4907 4908 4909

Truly did Allah fulfil the vision for His Apostle: Ye shall enter the Sacred Mosque if Allah wills with minds secure heads shaved hair cut short and without fear. For He knew what ye knew not and He granted besides this a speedy victory. 4910 4911
It is He who has sent His Apostle with Guidance and the Religion\n\t\t\tof Truth to proclaim it over all religion: and enough is Allah\n\t\t\tfor a Witness. 4912

Muhammad is the Apostle of Allah; and those who are with him are strong against Unbelievers (but) compassionate amongst each other. Thou wilt see them bow and prostrate themselves (in prayer) seeking Grace from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure. On their faces are their marks (being) the traces of their prostration. This is their similitude in the Torah; and their similitude in the Gospel is: like a seed which sends forth its blade then makes it strong; it then becomes thick and it stands on its own stem (filling) the sowers with wonder and delight. As a result it fills the Unbelievers with rage at him. Allah has promised those among them who believe and do righteous deeds Forgiveness and a great Reward. 4913 4914 4915 4916 4917 4918
O ye who believe! put not yourselves forward before Allah and His\n\t\t\tApostle: But fear Allah: for Allah is He who hears and knows all\n\t\t\tthings. 4919
O ye who believe! raise not your voices above the voice of the Prophet nor speak aloud to him in talk as ye may speak aloud to one another lest your deeds become vain and ye perceive not. 4920 4921
Those that lower their voice in the presence of Allah's Apostle\n\t\t\ttheir hearts has Allah tested for piety: for them is Forgiveness\n\t\t\tand a great Reward. 4922
Those who shout out to thee from without the Inner Apartments\n\t\t\tmost of them lack understanding. 4923
If only they had patience until thou couldst come out to them it\n\t\t\twould be best for them: but Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.
O ye who believe! if a wicked person comes to you with any news ascertain the truth lest ye harm people unwittingly and afterwards become full of repentance for what ye have done. 4924

And know that among you is Allah's Apostle: were he in many matters to follow your (wishes) ye would certainly fall into misfortune: but Allah has endeared the Faith to you and has made it beautiful in your hearts and He has made hateful to you unbelief wickedness and rebellion: such indeed are those who walk in righteousness 4925 4926
A grace and favor from Allah; and Allah is full of Knowledge and\n\t\t\tWisdom.

If two parties among the Believers fall into a quarrel make ye peace between them: but if one of them transgresses beyond bounds against the other then fight ye (all) against the one that transgresses until it complies with the command of Allah; but if it complies then make peace between them with justice and be fair: for Allah loves those who are fair (and just). 4927
The believers are but a single Brotherhood: So make peace and\n\t\t\treconciliation between your two (contending) brothers: And fear\n\t\t\tAllah that ye may receive Mercy. 4928

O ye who believe! let not some men among you laugh at others: it may be that the (latter) are better than the (former): Nor let some women laugh at others: it may be that the (latter) are better than the (former): nor defame nor be sarcastic to each other nor call each other by (offensive) nicknames: Ill-seeming is a name connoting wickedness (to be used of one) after he has believed: And those who do not desist are (Indeed) doing wrong. 4929 4930

O ye who believe! avoid suspicion as much (as possible): for suspicion in some cases is a sin: and spy not on each other nor speak ill of each other behind their backs. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? Nay ye would abhor it...but fear Allah: for Allah is Oft-Returning Most Merciful. 4931 4931 4932

O mankind! We created you from a single (pair) of a male and a female and made you into nations and tribes that ye may know each other (not that ye may despise each other). Verily the most honored of you in the sight of Allah is (he who is) the most righteous of you. And Allah has full knowledge and is well acquainted (with all things). 4933

The desert Arabs say "We believe." Say "Ye have no faith; but ye (only) say `We have submitted our wills to Allah.' For not yet has Faith entered your hearts. But if ye obey Allah and His Apostle He will not belittle aught of your deeds: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful." 4934 4935

Only those are Believers who have believed in Allah and His
			Apostle and have never since doubted but have striven with their
			belongings and their persons in the Cause of Allah: Such are the
			sincere ones.
Say: "what! Will ye instruct Allah about your Religion?" but\n\t\t\tAllah knows all that is in the heavens and on earth: He has full\n\t\t\tknowledge of all things. 4936

They impress on thee as favor that they have embraced Islam. Say "Count not your Islam as a favor upon me: Nay Allah has conferred a favor upon you that He has guided you to the Faith if ye be true and sincere. 4937
"Verily Allah knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth: and\n\t\t\tAllah sees well all that ye do." 4938
Qaf. By the Glorious Qur'an (Thou art Allah's Apostle).\n\t\t\t4939 4940
But they wonder that there has come to them a Warner from among\n\t\t\tthemselves. So the Unbelievers say: "This is a wonderful thing!\n\t\t\t4941
"What! when we die and become dust (shall we live again?). That\n\t\t\tis a (sort of) Return far (from our understanding)."\n\t\t\t4942
We already know how much of them the earth takes away: with Us is\n\t\t\ta Record guarding (the full account). 4943
But they deny the truth when it comes to them: So they are in a\n\t\t\tconfused state. 4944
Do they not look at the sky above them? How We have made it and\n\t\t\tadorned it and there are no flaws in it? 4945
And the earth--We have spread it out and set thereon mountains\n\t\t\tstanding firm and produced therein every kind of beautiful growth\n\t\t\t(in pairs) 4946 4947
To be observed and commemorated by every devotee turning (to\n\t\t\tAllah). 4948
And We send down from the sky Rain charged with blessing and We\n\t\t\tproduce therewith Gardens and Grain for harvests;
And tall (and stately) palm-trees with shoots of fruit-stalks\n\t\t\tpiled one over another 4949
As sustenance for (Allah's) Servants; and We give (new) life\n\t\t\ttherewith to land that is dead: Thus will be the Resurrection.
Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the people of Noah the\n\t\t\tCompanions of the Rass the Thamud 4950
The `Ad Pharaoh the Brethren of Lut
The companions of the Wood and the people of Tubba; each one (of\n\t\t\tthem) rejected the apostles and My warning was duly fulfilled (in\n\t\t\tthem).
Were We then weary with the first Creation that they should be in\n\t\t\tconfused doubt about a new Creation? 4951
It was We who created man and We know what dark suggestions his\n\t\t\tsoul makes to him: for We are nearer to him than (his) jugular\n\t\t\tvein. 4952
Behold two (guardian angels) appointed to learn (his doings)\n\t\t\tlearn (and note them) one sitting on the right and one on the\n\t\t\tleft. 4953
Not a word does he utter but there is a sentinel by him ready (to\n\t\t\tnote it). 4954
And the stupor of death will bring truth (before his eyes): "This\n\t\t\twas the thing which thou wast trying to escape!" 4955
And the Trumpet shall be blown: that will be the Day whereof\n\t\t\twarning (had been given). 4956
And there will come forth every soul: with each will be an\n\t\t\t(angel) to drive and an (angel) to bear witness. 4957
(It will be said:) "Thou wast heedless of this; now have We\n\t\t\tremoved thy veil and sharp is thy sight this Day!" 4958
And his companion will say: "Here is (his record) ready with me!"\n\t\t\t4959
(The sentence will be:) "Throw throw into Hell every contumacious\n\t\t\tRejector (of Allah)! 4960
"Who forbade what was good transgressed all bounds cast doubts\n\t\t\tand suspicions;
"Who set up another god besides Allah: throw him into a severe\n\t\t\tPenalty."
His companion will say: "Our Lord! I did not make him transgress\n\t\t\tbut he was (himself) far astray." 4961 4962\n\t\t\t4963
He will say: "Dispute not with each other in My Presence: I had\n\t\t\talready in advance sent you Warning. 4964 4965
"The Word changes not before Me and I do not the least injustice\n\t\t\tto My Servants." 4966
One Day We will ask Hell "art thou filled to the full?" It will\n\t\t\tsay "are there any more (to come)?" 4967
And the Garden will be brought nigh to the righteous no more a\n\t\t\tthing distant. 4968
(A voice will say:) "This is what was promised for you for\n\t\t\teveryone who turned (to Allah) in sincere repentance who kept\n\t\t\t(his law). 4969
"Who feared (Allah) Most Gracious unseen and brought a heart\n\t\t\tturned in devotion (to Him): 4970
"Enter ye therein in Peace and Security; this is a Day of Eternal\n\t\t\tLife!" 4971
There will be for them therein all that they wish and more\n\t\t\tbesides in Our Presence. 4972
But how many generations before them did We destroy (for their\n\t\t\tSins) stronger in power than they? Then did they wander through\n\t\t\tthe land: Was there any place of escape (for them)? 4973
Verily in this is a Message for any that has a heart and\n\t\t\tunderstanding or who gives ear and earnestly witnesses (the\n\t\t\ttruth). 4974
We created the heavens and the earth and all between them in Six\n\t\t\tDays nor did any sense of weariness touch Us. 4975\n\t\t\t4976 4977
Bear then with patience all that they say and celebrate the\n\t\t\tpraises of thy Lord before the rising of the sun and before (its)\n\t\t\tsetting 4978
And during part of the night (also) celebrate His praises and (so\n\t\t\tlikewise) after the postures of adoration. 4979
And listen for the Day when the Caller will call out from a place\n\t\t\tquite near 4980 4981
The day when they will hear a (mighty) Blast in (very) truth):\n\t\t\tthat will be the day of Resurrection. 4982
Verily it is We Who give Life and Death; and to Us is the Final\n\t\t\tGoal--
The Day when the Earth will be rent asunder from (men) hurrying\n\t\t\tout: that will be a gathering together quite easy for Us.\n\t\t\t4983 4984
We know best what they say; and thou art not one to ever awe them\n\t\t\tby force. So admonish with the Qur'an such as fear My Warning!\n\t\t\t4985
By the (Winds) that scatter broadcast; 4986\n\t\t\t4987
And those that lift and bear away heavy weights; 4988
And those that flow with ease and gentleness; 4989
And those that distribute and apportion by command 4990
Verily that which ye are promised is true; 4991
And verily Judgment and Justice must indeed come to pass.\n\t\t\t4992
By the Sky with (its) numerous Paths 4993
Truly ye are in a doctrine discordant 4994
Through which are deluded (away from the Truth) such as would be\n\t\t\tdeluded. 4995
Woe to the falsehood-mongers
Those who (flounder) heedless in a flood of confusion:\n\t\t\t4996
They ask "when will be the Day of Judgment and Justice?"
(It will be) a Day when they will be tried (and tested) over the\n\t\t\tFire!
"Taste ye your trial! this is what ye used to ask to be\n\t\t\thastened!" 4997
As to the Righteous they will be in the midst of Gardens and\n\t\t\tSprings 4998
Taking joy in the things which their Lord gives them because\n\t\t\tbefore then they lived a good life.
They were in the habit of sleeping but little by night\n\t\t\t4999
And in the hours of early dawn They (were found) praying for\n\t\t\tForgiveness; 5000
And in their wealth and possessions (was remembered) the right of\n\t\t\tthe (needy) him who asked and him who (for some reason) was\n\t\t\tprevented (from asking). 5001
On the earth are Signs for those of assured Faith
As also in your own selves: will ye not then see? 5002
And in heaven is your Sustenance as (also) that which ye are\n\t\t\tpromised. 5003
Then by the Lord of heaven and earth this is the very Truth as\n\t\t\tmuch as the fact that ye can speak intelligently to each other.\n\t\t\t5004
Has the story reached thee of the honored guests of Abraham?\n\t\t\t5005
Behold they entered His presence and said: "Peace!" He said\n\t\t\t"Peace!" (and thought "these seem) unusual people." 5006\n\t\t\t5007
Then he turned quickly to his household brought out a fatted\n\t\t\tcalf. 5008
And placed it before them... He said "Will ye not eat?"
(When they did not eat) He conceived a fear of them.  They said\n\t\t\t"Fear not" and they gave him glad tidings of a son endowed with\n\t\t\tknowledge.
But his wife came forward (laughing) aloud: she smote her\n\t\t\tforehead and said: "a barren old woman!" 5009
They said "Even so has thy Lord spoken: and He is full of Wisdom\n\t\t\tand Knowledge." 5010
(Abraham) said: "And what O ye Messengers is your errand (now)?"
They said "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin
"To bring on on them (a shower of) stones of clay (brimstone)\n\t\t\t5011
"Marked as from thy Lord for those who trespass beyond bounds."\n\t\t\t5012
Then We evacuated those of the Believers who were there.\n\t\t\t5013
But We found not there any just (Muslim) persons except in one\n\t\t\thouse: 5014
And We left there a Signs for such as fear the Grievous Penalty.\n\t\t\t5015
And in Moses (was another Sign): Behold We sent him to Pharaoh\n\t\t\twith authority manifest. 5016
But (Pharaoh) turned back with his Chiefs and said "A sorcerer or\n\t\t\tone possessed!"
So We took him and his forces and threw them into the sea: and\n\t\t\this was the blame. 5017
And in the `Ad (people) (was another Sign): Behold We sent\n\t\t\tagainst them the devastating Wind: 5018
It left nothing whatever that it came up against but reduced it\n\t\t\tto ruin and rottenness.
And in the Thamud (was another Sign): Behold they were told\n\t\t\t"Enjoy (your brief day) for a little while!" 5019\n\t\t\t5020
But they insolently defied the command of their Lord: so the\n\t\t\tstunning noise (of an earthquake) seized them even while they\n\t\t\twere looking on. 5021 5022
Then they could not even stand (on their feet) nor could they\n\t\t\thelp themselves. 5023
So were the people of Noah before them: for they wickedly\n\t\t\ttransgressed. 5024
With the power and skill did We construct the Firmament: for it\n\t\t\tis We Who create the vastness of Space. 5025
And We have spread out the (spacious) earth: how excellently We\n\t\t\tdo spread out!
And of everything We have created pairs: that ye may receive\n\t\t\tinstruction. 5026
Hasten ye then (at once) to Allah: I am from Him a warner to you\n\t\t\tclear and open! 5027
And make not another an object of worship with Allah: I am from\n\t\t\tHim a Warner to you clear and open! 5028
Similarly no apostle came to the Peoples before them but they\n\t\t\tsaid (of him) in like manner "A sorcerer or one possessed"!\n\t\t\t5029
Is this the legacy they have transmitted one to another? Nay they\n\t\t\tare themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds!\n\t\t\t5030
So turn away from them: not thine is the blame. 5031
But teach (thy Message): for teaching benefits the Believers.
I have only created jinns and men that they may serve Me.\n\t\t\t5032
No sustenance do I require of them nor do I require that they\n\t\t\tshould feed Me. 5033
For Allah is He Who gives (all) Sustenance Lord of Power\n\t\t\tSteadfast (for ever). 5034
For the wrongdoers their portion is like unto the portion of\n\t\t\ttheir fellows (of earlier generations): then let them not ask Me\n\t\t\tto hasten (that portion)! 5035
Woe then to the Unbelievers on account of that day of theirs\n\t\t\twhich they have been promised! 5036
By the Mount (of Revelation); 5037
By a Decree Inscribed 5038
In a Scroll unfolded;
By the much-frequented House; 5039
By the Canopy Raised High; 5040
And by the Ocean filled with Swell 5041 5042
Verily the Doom of thy Lord will indeed come to pass
There is none can avert it
On the day when the firmament will be in dreadful commotion.\n\t\t\t5043
And the mountain will fly hither and thither. 5044
Then woe that Day to those that treat (truth) as Falsehood\n\t\t\t5045
That play (and paddle) in shallow trifles.
That Day shall they be thrust down to the Fire of Hell\n\t\t\tirresistibly.
"This" it will be said "is the Fire which ye were wont to deny!\n\t\t\t5046
"Is this then a fake or is it ye that do not see? 5047
"Burn ye therein: the same is it to you whether ye bear it with\n\t\t\tpatience or not: Ye but receive the recompense of your (own)\n\t\t\tdeeds." 5048
As to the Righteous they will be in Gardens and in Happiness\n\t\t\t5049
Enjoying the (Bliss) which their Lord hath bestowed on them and\n\t\t\ttheir Lord shall deliver them from the Penalty of the Fire.
(To them will be said:) "Eat and drink ye with profit and health\n\t\t\tbecause of your (good) deeds." 5050 5051
